A must if you're into contemporary/modern art. Istanbul Modern is one of the few museums in Turkey that is on par with its European counterparts. Of course how well you relate with the art inside is subjective (and also depends on the exhibitions that are in place at the time). Personally I think the museum is in a way similar to prominent modern art museums in Europe but has a different edge to it due to its being closer to the east. The building and the view of the sea from the museum creates a sentimental mood which adds up to the experience. Overall, I really love the place.

Contemporary art and architecture lovers will enjoy!. Don't miss the Istanbul Modern! Good collection of contemporary work by Turkish and international artists! Some great video pieces that must be seen. The retrospective of Eviner's work was just mind-blowing! I wish the basement floor would leave it up permanently.For the non-art lovers, the museum is a special spot of calm in the city! Gorgeous cafe with a deck just feet over the Bosphorous and fabulous views. The front lawn was full of people hanging out and enjoying the space, soaking up the special atmosphere.
Must be visited. I recommend for everyone. One of the best art and culture museum I have seen.Also the area Şişli Beşiktaş is great to walk around.
not worth the money. It was very expensive and boring. The museum building is nice and new, but the art inside is poor and not so interesting.

Pleasantly surprised!. Some really fun and accessible modern art. One highlight is their restaurant with a great view of the boats going up and down the Bosphorus. And the food was one of the best meals I had in Istanbul!

enthralling art. I've been to modern art museums around the world but this is one of the most engaging. All exhibits were done by Turkish artists, none of whom I'd ever heard of, but the works of art were excellent and probably easily appreciated even by those who normally do not like modern art. The one thing to note is that modern art does not necessarily mean abstract art. In fact a fair number of exhibits were photographs which simply depicted modern reality. I only had two hours to spare but left feeling that I would love to come back and spend more time in there as I didn't get a chance to really savor everything on exhibit. this museum is relatively easy to get to. If you can find the tram, you just get off at Tophane station and it's a short walk from there. Highly recommended for those who have more than the usual 3 or 4 days in Istanbul. I nearly forgot, there's an excellent cafe in the museum with magnificent views across the water of Sultanahmet, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace.

Best Modern Museum. Istanbul Modern is one of the best modern museums I have ever been to. The building is normal but the art pieces inside are incredibly amazing! From paintings to sculptures to simple ceiling decorations! I really took my time to carefully observe every piece of art and most were really intriguing on how the artists came up with the idea and how they did it. Amazing!

Great Counterpoint to Historical Istanbul. One of my favourite museums. Firstly, the view of the Bosphorous is amazing from the restaurant. The exhibit itself is a bit of an acquired taste - but personally, I enjoyed it. The artworks are quirky, some really deep, some extremely avant-garde--but my favourite was the installation of hanging books!

So glad we went!. This museum is so well done and the exhibits we saw were wonderful. If you are in Istanbul for an extended visit, it is also a nice change from all of the mosques and ancient attractions. They also have a great restaurant with a lovely view of the Bosphorus and delicious food. We enjoyed the whole experience.

Istanbul Modern: Not to be Missed. Istanbul Modern is not to be missed. Even if you plan to focus on the city’s many historical sites, you owe it to yourself to experience Istanbul (in particular) and Turkey (in general) from the varied perspectives of its thoughtful modern and contemporary artists. Especially given the tumult the country is in today (after events like last week’s unsuccessful coup attempt), it is important to acknowledge and learn about present-day circumstances, and you will find Turkey’s rich artistic culture to be a fine teacher. We visited the museum in May of 2016 and found it excellent in every way, from its beautiful placement on the Bosphorus, to its sleek architectural design, to the quality of its collection and expertly curated exhibits. Many individual artworks have stayed with me since my visit, including the disorienting and powerful installation of two lighted globes called “Strange Fruit” by Hale Tenger, which alone is worth the price of admission. In addition to great art, the museum also has an elegant—and yet reasonably priced—restaurant with a stylish interior seating area and, even better, a balcony right on the Bosphorus. After the hard work of museum-going, that balcony is heavenly. We had planned to go to the museum just once, but found the whole experience too good not to visit a second timeAn added note: not far from the Istanbul Modern is another excellent museum (in the Beyoglu district), The Museum of Innocence, which is set in a house and is organized like a large kunstkammer, with curious, emotion-laden displays of everyday objects “used” by the fictional characters in the novel of the same name by Nobel Prize-winning Turkish author Orhan Pamuk. If you like Surrealism, Joseph Cornell, and/or shadow boxes, you will love this unusual museum.
Modern, stylish. Clean, modern, stylish....Those 3 words represent this Museum.Combination between Art and Technology. Recommended to visit!

A good break from antiquities. If you need a break from all the relics, the Modern is a good way to spend a few hours. Great art work from all over the world--neither too big nor too small with a great view of the waterfront. Restaurant was supposed to be good but service wasn't too friendly. Stick to the art work. Just take the tram to Tophane station and it's a short 5 minute walk away on level ground. There's a lot of construction going on about but inside, it's cool and calming. Great choice for a midday hot summer stroll. It's not part of the Museum Pass, though so be ready to pay the 25 turkish lira fee.

A Great Space. The museum is on the small side, so we spent under 2 hours there, I think. That didn't feel rushed. There was a nice array of media and it was curated well. One thing that impressed me the most was that there was a real downplay of the pretension which normally accompanies modern and contemporary art. The space itself is beautiful. It has incredible views of the Bosphorus and the Old City. And it's spacious inside to give each piece space so it can be viewed without the crowding found in other museums.It's in a formerly industrial building and fairly isolated. Our cab driver had a little trouble finding it. It's worth the trip and can be a great morning addition to a Beyoglu and Istikal Street walk/tour. I will say if you are planning to walk it be prepared for the extraordinary hills of Istanbul. And an near unending stair case.

Interesting Taste of Modern Art. After looking at museums of many old things, this was a nice contrast. There is also a lovely cafe for lunch or a little rest. When there isn't a big cruise ship docked there, it offers a nice view of the bosphourus.

Straightforward and gorgious. Down to earth museum with good art (some slightly dated) and very good temporary exhibitions. If you want to spoil yourself, have lunch in the restaurant overlooking the Bosperus... not cheap but very good food!

Very good museum. A very good modern Museum, at the time I visited it had a nice exhibition about gentrification in Istanbul but also several permanent exhibitions can be found. Maybe not the first priority if you have little time but especially on a rainy day worth a visit.Free entrance on Thursday! :-)

Amazing visit. It was hard to find the entrance but we managed. Spent 3 hours lost in the art- there is lots to see. Upstairs main gallery, downstairs photo gallery and library, fancy restaurant with good views. The service was good at the restaurant but it's very pricy. Food was amazing though- had a thin crust margarita pizza (25TL). There's a lot of local art and variety- installations, mixed media, videos, etc. Sometimes the sound from some artworks interferes/is annoying when looking at other pieces- but this is only top RHS gallery, the rest is fine. One of my best things to do so far after a week in Istanbul so it's worth a visit- Tophane tram stop and a short walk.
Well worth a visit. Interesting, spacious, very contemporary. A great contrast to old Istanbul and the sights and smells. Recommended
i love it :). i thought that the museum was hart throbingly amazing and thrilling it deserves the a lot of recognition, the work that went into all the piece.

A Museum by the Bosphorus. The entrance to the Museum is not that easy to find but it is worth the trip.
It offers a good array of modern art exhibits as well as an interesting child workshop every week-end. Thursday is free for all visitors.
It has a great restaurant and cafe overlooking the Bosphorus with a great menu.

Excellent, well-displayed modern art collection. We were very impressed by all aspects of the Istanbul Modern. The museum is large, comfortable, airy, and well-organized. The staff has selected and displayed art that makes a visitor think; it challenged our senses. We arrived mid-afternoon and unfortunately didn't give ourselves adequate time to see everything. Don't overlook the exhibits in the basement.The restaurant overlooking the Bosphorus serves a great lunch. We spent about an hour here; perhaps we should have been looking at the art, but we were tired. The food was excellent and the view is hard to beat.

A good collection of both Turkish and international modern art. An interesting place to see Turkish modern art. The museum is located in warehouse style building with wonderful views of the Bosphoros.

nice selection of modern turkish art. the museum contains a wide collection of modern turkish art and hosts several temporary exhibitions as well. when you get tired you can grab a coffee in the museum cafe, where you will enjoy the Bosphorus view

Very good museum. Well, I try an visit the modern and contemporary art museum everywhere I go, this one is definitely a milestone, I discovered a great Turkish artist, they had a whole level with his work from 20th and 21st century, go, go, go.

Beacon of light during difficult times. When Istanbul Modern first opened Turkey was going through an optimistic phase, with a European perspective, democratisation packages and various cultural advances. Unfortunately the past couple of years have been tough. That being said, Istanbul Modern continues to offer sorely needed artistic escape (or in some cases, artistic engagement with the difficult issues!). As well as an excellent programme of exhibitions, it also houses an arthouse cinema with an eclectic programme of films you would be hard pressed to find on offer anywhere else in Turkey. Well wroth supporting.

GREAT!. I suggest to spend there more than 3 hours because there soooo many interesting things to see in Istanbul Modern. I love the main exhibition and also installations downstairs. Restaurant and view there are beyond any praise. Try wine and any dessert! I literally fell in love with this museum!
very interesting. Very interesting exhibitions ; modern and creative works by young artists ; the restaurant has incredible views on the Bosphorus and good cook.

Varied artists. even though it isn’t the hugest museum but the place must visit as there are plenty of interesting skilled artists work can be witnessed. If you want to know the current exhibition just click on their website!

Love Istanbul Modern. What I love about the Istanbul Modern is the focus on contemporary Turkish art. Often you will see Warhol, Hirst, Richter and there may be a handful of known names here. But they showcase Turkish art which is fascinating and unique.I saw the current collection show plus the nature inspired exhibit and they were both very well done. The one drawback is the show i saw last Spring had a bottom 30% of the same works. I hope the Modern expands its collection. Plus the gallery is just gorgeous. The views over the Bosphorus are spectacular. I don't know why people would give the gallery a low rating because of construction. That has nothing to do with the gallery. It is $12 really well spent.

Interactive and fun. I am not normally a modern art fan, but I'd heard good things about the museum and so one rainy afternoon I decided to check things out. I easily spent two hours wandering through the exhibits - not because it is a huge museum, but because it was such an interesting, interactive space. There are movies and videos and audio that really added dimension to my experience with the art.

Interesting, accessible collection in a stuning location. The collection is at times curious and at times compelling. Most spectacular, however, is its Bosphorus-side location. This is a small museum which can be viwed with just a couple of hours; plan to stay for refreshments and sit out by the water. Delightful!

Museum surrounded by Construction Activity. The museum artwork is well worth a visit & the restaurant has good views of Bosphorus. But on foot via tram access is no easy as the whole area is under reconstruction.

very intertesting. Putting aside the wonderful building, the great view it offers, and the good restaurant, the permanent exhibit "Art in Time" (don't recall the exact title) is extremely interesting.

Take your time and enjoy this space. If you like movies or prefer paintings or just want to hang out in a beautiful space with all sorts of art, and a nice view, Come to the Istanbul Modern. It may be hard to find because of construction in the area, but don't give up. Ask and you will be directed right to it. The new building should be ready soon.
Rich and varied museum. Great museum, varied mix of photography, paintings, sculpture and installations. Big enough to spend a couple of hours at least.
Amazing Museum. The Museum is really astonishing. What a building, the exhibits are giving you a touch of real art, the feeling is thrilling!
still under constraction. while having your lunch becouse of the constraction noises you can hardly hear the person whom you are eating with
Highly recommended. Some very unexpected and thought-provoking pieces of art, excellent photographs, helps understand modern Turkish view on national and global developments

Istanbul for penniless: Istanbul Modern. On Thursdays Istanbul Modern is free of charge. You can see and enjoy the paintings and sculpters of best Turkish artists. What about sun bathing in the lovely garden just by a sculpture of Koray Aris. In the art library of Istanbul Museum of Moden Art reading and learning more about art and artists must be rewarding. At the museum café have a cup of tea (it is not free) and live the pleasures of Bosphorus and the historic peninsula.We were there with our friend from Romania two weeks ago, and had manti (Turkish ravioli with yogurt sauce). It was not exceptional, but the view was for sure.

Best place to view contemporary Turkish artists. It is a must see for those who visit New York and head first for MoMa. Otherwise, if you are in Istanbul for a week or this is the second or third time and have done the Topkapi, Hagia Sophia, Chora, Blue Mosque, Suleymaniye, Covered Bazaar, Spice Market the previous visit, why not? Before noon, seldom crowded.

Top rate place. Well presented, well explained. Small enough to feel intimate and not over-powering. The admission price of TRY25, and the tucked away location, might discourage some and explain the modest number of visitors.At the moment it's not so easy to find, hidden behind a mosque restoration: but it's worth persevering.The restaurant attached is a joy, the terrace over the water is a delight. Outside main meal-times you can enjoy just a drink and a snack there: though in the summer the air-condirioned interior might be more welcoming.
Wonderful Art, Great Food!. Istanbul Modern has a fabulous collection of art and wonderful changing exhibitions. The restaurant is really great....beautiful food overlooking the Bosphorous!

Great Modern Art in the World's most Storied Metropolis. IMM sits near the water, in one of modern Istanbul's trendiest areas. You can stop here before or after a day exploring Ishtiklal, and after or before grabbing one of the neighboring ferries to one of Istanbul's numerous cultural centers. Every time I've been (5 times over 3 years), the IMM has had a new, fresh, imaginative exhibit to explore. Definitely worth a visit if modern art interests you, and/or you happen to be in the 'hood.

great collection put together very well. Very nice collection of modern art. Lots of Turkish artists. Expect photos, installations, sculptures and paintings. Work was divers but put together very well.

Don't miss it!. Having travelled quite a lot and art being my meaning of life, I would say I have been to my fair share of galleries. Having not discovered much in the way of contemporary art in the huge city of Istanbul I was pleasantly surprised by the Istanbul Modern. One of my top galleries. Beautiful setting right on the Bosphorus with fantastic views from the gallery restaurant. We didn't eat there, but if you want to treat yourself I would definitely recommend hanging out there for a drink or some food. The gallery has two floors. It's the perfect size. Big enough that you feel you have been to a substantial exhibition, whilst not maxing out your appreciation of the work. A fantastic mix of works and well curated. If you love contemporary art - go! If you think you don't like contemporary art - go! I think this could be the beginning of your appreciation.
Wonderful place. It was quite great visit, we enjoyed the place and everything there was marvellous. Plenty of Art works that reflects the life in Turkey. I recommend this wonderful museum.

Fascinating art, great location. If you're staying in Karaköy or at the Witt Istanbul suites in Cihangir (or even further afield!) then it'd definitely worth a trip to Istanbul Modern. It doesn't have the scope of, say, Tate Modern, but is definitely interesting and great if the weather is dull, grey, windy or wet. Very helpful staff as well and nice and quiet.

my best place to relax and enjoy the view in bosporous!. This place is always an interesting place to go as usually host very interesting exhibitions but most i like it as it has a very nice balcony on the sea with spectacular view.

Istanbul Modern Museum. Location is on the Bosphorous tucked away behind some building works and a mosque. Not a very large museum but some fun and interesting art on display. Your museum pass is not valid here so you will have to pay to get in.

Very nice museum . A lovely change from all the ancient wonders of Istanbul, this museum has a very large collection of modern Turkish artists, and maintains a wonderful international feel. It has a national flavor without being nationalistic. Highly recommend.

Great Gallery & Very Relaxed. This was a relaxing experience with some inspiring work on display. I hung around longer than I expected. It seemed expensive when I went in but my wife assured me that it is cheap for a gallery :-) Although the cafe / restaurant is expensive I recommend it for the view from the terrace. The food looked good but expensive. Cheesecake my wife let me try (I starved myself in protest) was good but London prices.

Great exhibitions. This was my first visit to the museum of modern art. I visited after seeing an ad in The Guide Istanbul (magazine) for an exhibition on the environmental and sustainability, but was however surprised by the overall ambience and quality of the other exhibitions that were on. There were one or two school groups that were there and doing school activities amongst the exhibitions, I found this to be fantastic! To see young children gain such great exposure and get comfortable in that setting. I was amazed by the diversity of contributing artists on show from Turkish to South African. A great afternoon spent. I found the museum entrance a bit pricey (25 TL), which may be steep for a budget traveler, but worth it nonetheless.

Fot the contemporary art lovers. If you like contemporary art and want to be informed about the progress in Turkish culture go there befoere it might be to late. Those type of statement might upset the current political streams in this country. The museum is very interesting, it is also directly on the Bosphorus with a nice coffee shop to relax on the water.

Not as good as it was. The museum used to maintain a balance between turkish artists and modern art. The pendulum has swung totally to modern art. As always, the restaurant has a very nice view and serves excellent light fare. Worth a short visit on a nice day to enjoy the terrace.TIP - there is construction on all sides of the museum so it is not the easiest to get into. Look for the red tower sign.

INSPIRING, THOUGHT PROVOKING, UP LIFTING. I cannot tell you how much i loved the exhibition i saw at the Modern are Gallery as a member of the Tate London modern gallery of art i see a lot of art - this was the most inspiring thought provoking and up lifting exhibition i have been to in years! The space was incredible and the views amazing. cannot wait to go back and have told everyone they must visit. Brilliant!!!
Lovely place, good art, great view.. Lovely place, good art, great view.Get the museum pass to save on entrance fee.Accessible location.

A must see when in istanbul. The Istanbul modern is a great showcase for modern and contemporary Turkish and european artists . They always have interesting shows on which explore different mediums . great cafe too

Remembering that Istanbul is a thoroughly modern city. We didn't have huge expectations about Istanbul Moder even though we'd read that it was an excellent museum. It is in fact one of the best modern art museums I've ever seen. Heavy on excellent Turkish artists, unpretensious, just the right size (i.e. large enough that its worth the money, small enough that you can see it in a couple of hours and not be overwhelmed) and a spectacular setting with large windows over the bosphorous. Actually each window is a living portrait of Istanbul.

Nice collection. Really enjoyed walking around a few hours here, the place is well located and the collection although sometimes weird in general is ok for non art lovers. Restaurant is perfect with a view to die for.

Art break- nice occasion for modern art lovers. This place is not so big, dont expect somewhere like Tate Modern:)
But it is OK for Istanbul, location is amazing. Seaside, fantastic view, some art, good foods..for taking a breath and relaxing very good option!

Not only for museum lovers, a good time spending for all. The exhibitions were very interesting. As a bonus, it has a nice view from its balcony (where cafe is located). Since the area is under reconstruction right now, it was a bit hard to find the entrance.

Worth a visit. Once we had actually found Istanbul Modern we enjoyed two hours here wandering amongst the permanent and temporary exhibitions. We were extremely grateful for the detailed English translations! Some of the photography in particular gave us a brief insight into Turkish life which you simply arent aware of as a tourist doing the rounds of istanbul's many sights. Well worth a visit for a different perpsective.

Horrible Location, rather small, and over priced.. I love a good modern museum. I found that my favourite pieces in the museum happen to be Danish.... Didn't find much focus in the museum and over all it was quite underwhelming. They seem to have an amazing location by the water, but unfortunately they don't take advantage of it at all. It was also hard to find the main entrance between all the construction going on.
Good museum. It hosts some interesting exhibitions and has a collection of Turkish Modern Art would give a retrospective idea. Also has a good restaurant with a view.

Inspiring and informative. This time only had one day in Istanbul so myself and husband chose one place each to visit. This was mine and it was such a treat. Firstly the building is a delight, a converted warehouse right on the waterfront with a rather good restaurant. We looked out of the huge windows at grey skies and choppy water which felt like an artwork itself. The multi media works are very accessible, and different, ranging from paintings, huge installations and videos. All were telling a story of Istanbul and Turkish issues today....yes , politics are very present here but expressed with sensitivity and respect for difference. Lots of food for thought.This was great for us as it was pouring with rain, but this gallery should not be missed on a fine day as the building and its outside seating on the river looks fabulous. I will go again as the exhibitions change regularly.

Unexpected highlight of Istanbul. Quite diverse and very enjoyable modern art collection with great views of the Bosporus. I visited for Istanbul Design Week but the Modern Museum turned out to be way more interesting.
What a surprise. A great new landmark for bustling Karaköy. Big, industrial, great view on the Bosphorus, interesting collection. A must for art lovers.
A must if you like modern art. Wonderfull collection and the museum is very tourist friendly. The restaurant inside is good but a little bit pricey.

A Different View of Turkey. If overloaded with Byzantine and Ottoman history while visiting Istanbul, pay the comparatively steep entrance fee to see a different side of Turkish culture. Even those who are not modern art enthusiasts will find something of interest. We are glad we came.

free on thursdays. modern art museum. objects presented are subject to taste but its definitely worth a visit especially on thursdays when its a sponsored day and therefor free of charge. if you dont like the art you will shurely like the nice view on the bosphorus from the cafeterias balcony (betta then some of the artworks for shure)

Impressive art . It's not the biggest gallery in the world, but every piece in there gets the required space to make it stand out. They have a lot of different and skilled artists from allover the world. The only downside is the security guards, they are absolutely everywhere, and you feel a bit watched

Truly Modern Museum with Some Interesting Pieces.. Everything in Istanbul is so old, so a visit to this museum brings you into the 21st century. It is a great place to visit. The museum has some interesting collections. Check their website to see current exhibitions. The museum is not very big and features mostly Turkish artists, but it is worth the trip. You can see everything in a couple of hours.

..a MUST to understand Turkey as a modern country... Any tourist visiting this splendid city should visit this museum, and add it to the city's 'must see' list. It not only expresses a less known voice of Turkey, by showing an intense art life, mostly unknown abroad, but it propels the country itself into the 21st century by showing how vibrant the Turkish art world is, and integral to the rest of world. Besides, gifted with a great location on the Bosphorus and an inviting restaurant with a splendid view.

LOved their font .... ... and the simple very modern architecture. Open space, no sepearting walls. Very light. Not so sure about the art pieces, but the entire atmosphere and the attached restaurant is wonderful!

stunning place for art tester. in this place you can enjoyed the catchy art from painting to live shows to short movies from different places , you can spend more than 4 hours without knowing , the mordern museum has an amazing view near the sea and an amazing restaurant with great food , don't forget to pass by the shop tho take souvenir .

ı love this place. Istanbul Modern is the first private museum devoted to modern and contemporary art in Turkey. Located beside the Bosphorus, the museum brings together the Istanbul cityscape with the production of arts ranging from painting,sculpture and photography to video and new media.
Good Start. I went to the Istanbul Modern Museum with low expectations. I was pleasantly surprised. The museum is not large, but it had a nice range of styles. I would go again.

Interesting Installation, Beautifully located on Water. The Modern Art Museum is located on the water and the view is spectacular. There is a restaurant and coffee shop on the main floor. The exhibit showing when I visited hosted international artists raising issues of nature and our surroundings. The exhibit was small but some pieces were poignant. The gift shop sells locally made jewellery and crafts at a reasonable cost. Better to go when the weather is favourable to sit outside and enjoy the view!

Doesn't compare to any major Modern Museum, but is a nice little visit.. This is a nice little visit if you are looking to let your feet rest from walking walking walking up and down and up and down hills all over Istanbul (I'm looking at you Cihangir and Galata). I'd say look for 1-2 hours here and maybe have a tea or something on the deck out back, overlooking the Bosphorus. The restaurant prices are steep but the view is nice and it is pretty peaceful.The museum itself doesn't really compare to any major museum in any other metropolitan city. It had a few interesting exhibits, though, and was worth the visit. The entrance fee wasn't too steep (30 TL I think).

Who knew there were so many Turkish female artists?. I'm sure that Turkish art lovers know, but I was surprised to see the collection included so many women. We visited on Ataturk Day, which was called Childrens' Day, and there were kids taking art classes everywhere. They only added to our enjoyment of our viewing because they were clearly having such a great time. The food in the cafe was well priced and pretty much what you'd expect for museum food.

Very nice exhibitions. Although I am not that much into art, I like this place a lot because it always feels good when I visit there. Very bright and well designed interior and very convenient location. It also has always interesting exhibitions.

Some really interesting pieces. A good collection of modern Turkish work. Great to see that they encourage children. Apart from the school trips, they also offer pushchairs to todlers. A bit busy on Thursdays as it is free for Turkish residents, so if you like your solitude pick another day.

Best museum of modern art I have ever been to. The museum is small a shows only few select pieced of various modern art. A lot of contemporary turkish art. And a lot of wonderful surprices walking round the museum. The ground floor exhibition has been the best the two times I was there.
Good for you rmind and soul .... Istanbul is surprisingly modern and traditional at the same time.The IMM is the place where you would catch the best from its creative scene.

Great view from the restaurant, expositions differ in quality. I am not a great art enthousiastic, but I went here twice. Everytime there is something interesting to see, but also thinks that are not impressive at all. If you like modern art, of course you should go here. Restaurant serves good food, and the view over the Bosporus is great!
Ok if you are into art. The museum has some interesting drawing, nice object but I was not amazed by it. It was more of a relaxing activity.
Art and food. Istanbul Modern Museum always offers a good selection of art with contemporary exhibition.The restaurant on the top floor is an equal winner. Top choice!

Great collection, awesome restaurant, magnificent views. Some excellent exhibits, other than Reina Sofia in Madrid I have not enjoyed a modern art museum more. Fantastic setting, one can easily spend a good hour taking in the view of the city and the Bosphorus. Not given five stars because there were not enough pieces which made me want to spend a good length of time lingering over them.

Very nice museum. Nice place to visit, interesting modern paintings and others manifestations of pop art.The Museum is close to Tophane Metro Station, sea side and with a beautiful view of Sultanahmet.
Surprising collection. This museum features contemporary artists, mainly Turkish and a good number are women. Large, ample room to look. Also good views of the Bosporus. A nice café on site.
carpark not enough. very big place. good for art exhibition. location is perfect. but carpark area is not enough. so takng a taxi to get here is better idea.

Great Art. The Istanbul Modern really have a great selection of art and the exhibits are wonderfully displayed. Downstairs they had a free temporary exhibition when we visited. The exhibits cover a big area and make sure to give yourself enough time so as not to rush through. The restaurant is good and you can enjoy a cup of coffee overlooking the Bosphorus and the museum has a good selection of items for sale. Take the Kabatas tram line and get off at Tophane stop. From there just follow the signs for the museum. It is an easy walk of about 10 minutes. If you are over 60 years of age you get a discount on the entrance fee. Closed on a Monday.

very cool art museum on the water. Wide-ranging array of pieces at the Istanbul Modern, I really enjoyed all the pieces in there. It takes a long time to soak it all in! Make sure you spend enough time downstairs too!Be sure to check out the restaurant attached to it. Very good food and on the water! Unfortunately there was a big cruise ship blocking our view when we were there...BUT it was still very nice harbor feel.

Lovely coffee and snacks on the cafe terrace. After enjoying the exhibits and facilities inside the museum, I was feeling a bit hungry, so I joined friends who had snagged a table outside along the river. One of my favorite memories of my time in Istanbul. I felt urbane and sophisticated as we joked and nibbled. If you're tired of the typical Istanbul sights come here for a refreshing change.

Modern space. The museum is easily accessible by public transport (tramway), located at Tophane. Its size is satisfactory for hosting enough art items. You have to leave your bags-big items at the garderobe at the entrance. There is also a small but lovely museum shop and a wonderful restaurant whith amazing view to Bosphorus!

Great collection in a great space. The best thing about this museum is its proximity to the cruiseport. You can check into your cruise ship then come out and visit the museum. Great collection of contemporary works in airy space. There is also a cafe if you need a break.
Modern but small. Modern museum is a small fantasy M. near Kabatash. pictures ,paintings, art films and installations of Turkish artists all together make this M.. Down levels are closed to repair.
A must see when you are in Istanbul. The Istanbul modern has a very attractive collection of modern Turkish art. The location on the Bosphorus is spectacular.
excellent. Do book at table at the restaurant! great food and an incredable view. Modern interpatations of Turkish classics and good service.

Modern times in Istanbul. The first and best modern art museum in Istanbul founded by the Eczacıbası family.You can enjoy a cup of coffe at the terrace of the museum.But a little bit expensive.A must see place if you are visiting Istanbul.many thanks to Eczacıbası family for their generousity.

Fantastic. Amazing exhibitions, wide range of mediums, some interactive (walking through feather boas in to a room that felt like space). Could spend all day there. Enjoyed a beer overlooking the sea and sunset at the end.
small yet lovely. a very lovely place having a lot of interesting stuff to show to its visitors. Enjoyed exploring it a lot.

Great insight into Istanbul's modern art scene. A good, varied and non-pretentious modern art gallery, showcasing Turkey's modern artists (though is lacking in younger artists) as well as some contemporary artists from overseas. The cafe is good too.

Varied and well presented modern Turkish art. Great display of modern Turkish art that provides a synthesis of contemporary production. Do visit the restaurant, beautiful view of the Bosphorus and very good Turkish dishes.
Modern by name and by being.. Fantastic building and wonderful displays. Pity that the entrance is still in such a mess. The displays included many wonderful modern artists on two levels.

A little disappointed, but the view is great. This ART museum is my top list in my bucket list, but I felt a little disappointed by its collection. It was not so many compared to other art museums I visited in my own countries, or other countries. But the view of sea side is great. The food served in the restaurant is expensive.

Contemporary art beside the Bosphorus. A great place to visit! Especially if you have been soaking up the magnificent historic mosques and museums, the Modern provides an excellent contrast and an introduction to talented 20/21st C artists.

Contemporary Meets Classic. The Istanbul Modern is a worthwhile stop on your Istanbul itinerary and should include lunch on a non cruise ship day. It has a great cafe with a fantastic view of the Bosphorus that most unfortunately is frequently cut off by a cruise ship being docked right in front as was the case the day we visited. The modern collection is quite varied and very eclectic.

Thought provoking pieces, worth a visit!. This was my first visit to the Istanbul Modern Museum. What a pleasure! Some extremely thought provoking pieces on display! Much to please the senses... Easy to access the museum via the tram, and it has the added bonus to take in some stunning views of the Bosphorus!

Awonderful and inspiring visit. The Istanbul Modern was an inspiring and surprising experience. As an art educator, I went to the Gallery to see what they offered..... and was blown away! Apart from the astounding architecture of the gallery itself, which has huge windows overlooking the Bosphorus, the artwork is carefully chosen and superbly displayed. I would strongly suggest that anyone who has even a vague interest in visual art should visit this gallery. It is a thoughtful, incredible experience. I planned on spending a couple of hours there. I ended up spending almost a whole day!

WOW! WOW! WOW!. Although we go often (or did until they closed for remodeling) to the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, this was simply amazing. The collection is incredible, but it is equally exciting to see artists that are never displayed in the western art museum. We spent about an hour and a half and wished that we had a little more time.
Must see. It's not in the typical destination in Istanbul but if you are interested in art specially modern art definitely a must see place!!

As good as in any big city. This is a good visit, especially on a rainy day. Easy to get with the metro, stopping just outside and it is a quality exhibition in line with other bigger cities in Europe. 30T entry is reasonable and if you're into modern art you should check it out.

Other side of Turkish Civilisation: Modern art of Turkey. If you do interested in art and especially the modern Turkish civilisation, it is the best place to visit. Usually people think Turkey is only Ottoman culture and oriental civilisation. It was but not any longer. Of course there will be influence of the Ottoman Empire civilisation and Middle East culture but there is also European influence too. Therefore if you want to know the current culture / current art of Turkey, please do visit that place. I strongly recommend if you want to see & learn about the modern / current Turkish culture & art

Worth a visit. Great place if you like or are interested in more modern art. We actually took a stroll from Eminonu, across the Galata bridge and then just followed tram lines down to Tophane. You could see the red little signs for the Modern from this area so quite easy to locate. The upstairs has a good mix of works. The one which seemed to grab attention was the feather boa installation! It was very interesting to see what was on the other side. I do think though that the downstairs exhibition that is currently on is very interesting and I wish we had started down there so as to spend more time having a look. Personally for me it was nice to go back after 7/8 years though it is a shame that it is no longer free admission to tourists. Nonetheless, if you want to have a look around something different, head here. Some lovely mosques nearby as well to take in.

Interesting and accessible - I loved this museum. The Istanbul Modern Museum is a fantastic gallery filled with many interesting and quite beautiful works. I found the art more accessible than some modern museums, and I enjoyed seeing works by Turkish artists. I combined my visit with a trip to the Dolmabahce Palace which is not far and the two attractions provide a fascinating contrast of aesthetics. The museum also provides a refreshing contrast to the many holy sites and ancient sites around Istanbul. Highly recommended.

Worthwhile (If you like modern art). If you like modern art, this is a real treat. The installations were fascinating, the art interesting, and overall pretty cool stuff. I'd do the bottom floor, take a break for a coffee and then do the upstairs. A good variety of works, particularly from regional artists.Downside:Not enough bathrooms. Could have been arranged thematically a bit better. I did not like the "art" made of other people's art, e.g. the so-called collage of TIME magazine images or the room where they say "don't step on the salt." Really not transformative at all...

Fun museum with good variety. The main floor has the best exhibits. If you are pressed for time, skip the lower floor. This had a lot of good pieces and a beautiful view of the bosphorus from the restaurant deck. It was a nice change of pace from the old city and touristy sites. If the lower level had been as strong as the main floor, I would give five stars.

great stuff. enjoyed it very much, fresh and fun. Make sure you don't take the wrong lift from downstairs, one takes you up to the next floor of museum, the other will take you to the exit - and then there is no way back. :/
Amazing . . Was there for Bienal . Amazing thematic exhibition and the first floor permanent collection was impressive. Beautiful modern building . Fantastic restaurant with unbelievable view !

Brief but interesting. If you have a spare 1-2 hours in Istanbul this is a great break from monument/palace/mosque hopping. When we were there unfortunately the bottom floor was closed, which from what I could see is half the museum! But the views are amazing and the artwork there is really fun - especially the globe hidden behind a curtain of feathers.

Great museum.. This museum showcases mostly Turkish artists in many mediums. I was especially taken with a video production showing a famous square during several time periods and demonstrations. There is photography, sculpture, paintings and video installations. Well worth the time to visit. There is also a very nice, but somewhat expensive, café in the museum.

Art to Enjoy. If you are a person who enjoy modern art, this is a great place for you. My daughter went there and enjoyed a full day there, and came back with many pictures, memories, and a lot of excitement.

Some questionable art, but the restaurant has one of the best views in Istanbul. Some questionable art, but the restaurant has [probably] best views of IstanbulIf you have been to the Tate Modern in London, then you will appreciate that a wonderful building does not disguise the quality of the art within. There are some wonderful paintings here, but also rather a lot of self-indulgent “installations” (rather heavy on artistic/tedious films). However, as well as the site itself which is spacious and alone lifts the mood, the restaurant is terrific (you do not need to pay to access) and has a high river-side unrestricted and panoramic view up the Bosphorus, across to Uskudar and the Topkapi Palace. Have a leisurely lunch over a bottle of something fruity & chilled and watch the ferries, tours and fishing boats go about their business.

It's not about art. I thought you have to be into art to go to it But you don't, all you need is to be human Really this the best thing i did in my trip to Istanbul, and i did a lot of things I freed hour and half for its visit, but needs more I thing it's a must in Istanbul

Tate Modern in Instanbul. Definitely worth visiting, a cavernous converted shipping terminal that reminded me of Tate Modern only smaller. Architecturally very modern especially after visiting the many beautiful world heritage sites and situated on the mighty Bosphorus. Restaurant has stunning views overlooking said river and whilst more pricey than local restaurants on the others side of the Galata Bridge of good quality with excellent service. Exhibitions are exciting from the first floor Turkish exhibits to the downstairs exhibits of local artists. Nice walk back to the Funicular to Taxim Square made this a very interesting day.

Disappointing!. Great location, appropriate building facilities with potential in exhibiting modern art, I found it lacks though in art exhibits, as well as in the art to exhibit them. Restaurant will great potential lacking though also in inspiration as far as concept, food quality, selection of dishes and service. It needs a deep, new breath.

Ziyaret her zaman büyük bir zevk. I am never disappointed by a visit to Istanbul Modern. I love contemporary art, and the museum hosts beautiful collections. Plus many temporary exhibits that are challenging, interesting, addressing my aesthetic emotions. I also enjoy the museum itself : the rooms are big enough not to feel crowded even when there is a crowd. And its café restaurant is a piece of jewellery for those who love watching the sea and the busy seaside of Istanbul against the old city and the Asian coast.
Won't waste 5 minutes. It will take you around 5-10 minutes to visit it, it won't waste your time.Shows the mix of the ancient and future culture.

Great space and diversity of work. Enjoyed the diversity of work and the challenging of culture and life in the 20th century by a group of predominantly contemporary artists. Good mix of 2D, 3D and mixed media work. Lovely space. Don't use the restaurant. Overproced and slow service. Little cafe at the entrance to the gallery is fantastic.

3 and a half hours passed without us realising we were so engrossed. one of the best art galleries we have ever visited. consistently high quality of exhibits, some very moving. beautifully located and with an excellent restaurant on the water. a great experience.

must visit for cruise pasengers. Possibly the coolest museum in istanbul to visit to feed your art craving. It consists of a collection section, temporary exhibitions, cinema, store and a nice restaurant with great view. If youre a cruise passenger visiting istanbul, I d definitely reccommend you to visit istanbul modern as it is located nearby the port. The standard admission fees are 10 tl per visit.

Thoroughly enjoyable. The gallery is a great mixture of fun, thought-provoking and interesting works of art. A definite highlight of our stay in Istanbul that we would recommend to anyone into art. The nearby Cihangir is also great for exploring smaller galleries and arty shops.

2015 Biennial - some interesting stuff here. well curated, close to tram stop. information in English, good wide-ranging selection of works. worth the walk through a building site to get here. ate at the restaurant, quite expensive (4 quid for a beer) but pizza was decent quality. Worth a visit if you like modern art.
excellent. there is always a few galleries are showcasing amazing works of local and not so local artists. highly recommended

Art of the present facing out onto history. Specializing in contemporary words by Turkish artists, one sees the influences of Turkey, the Middle East....and other parts of the world on their work. A beautiful setting facing out to the Bosporus directly (when cruise boats are not occupying the cruise port directly in front)....and a lovely restaurant to boot.

Visited during the Istanbul Biennial. Very good space and glad to see that they participated in the Istanbul Biennial. I enjoyed the artist that displayed at the Modern Museum and thought the work was presented well.
Good place to visit in Tophane. I always like to see art, it tells the stories of the country and the people. This is no exception and the art is interesting and evocative.

Modern Art in an ancient city. Visited during Biennale. Strong collection of contemporary Turkish work alongside some good quality international workGreat cafe with cold fresh juice to slake your thirst

Istanbul Biennial. Great collection of Turkish artists as well as some well known international artists. Upstairs houses the collection while downstairs was hosting works commiserate for the biennial on our visit. There is a lovely restaurant attached, good food, amazing views and like most gallery restaurants, toward the upper end of the price range but worth it to sit outside and soak up the sunshine and the views over Eurooe and Asia after a couple of hours happy art viewing. Museum Pass does not work here so make sure you have your entrance fee in Tl.
Nice space & interesting collection. A refreshing break from the heat and crowds of Istanbul. The collection was interesting, diverse and interactive. Had an enjoyable few hours browsing.
Modern indeed !. A great way to spend a rainy afternoon. Some very thought provoking installations. The cafe overlooking the Bosphorous is a nice break.
So so. This place before it's was free but now not no need too go there nothing special there... tricking tourists...

Perfect museum size and content!. A contemporary art Museum needs to be like Istanbul Modern Museum. Not huge, Wonderful pieces from around the world, Good views of the river, nice restaurant and cool store. Istanbul Modern Museum is a place to understand the visual power of the city and the country.

I strongly advice you to visit that museum.. It is contemporary. Paintings are worth seeing. Spacious area easy to walk around. It is in the centre of the city , convenient location. Nice cafe that looks over the bosphorous. The small souvenir shop is great too.
Spekulär und interessant. Good mix of Art! Different und very special exponates.It's Nicaragua for Kids and adults.To find the entrance ist very difficult.
Don't miss it. Fabulous! Great permanent exhibition and really interesting specials and the restaurant on the top floor is superb. Don't miss it!

Great permanent exhibit. The permanent exhibition is great, an amazing experience. There is work of Olafur Eliasson and other accomplished artists.There are also temporary exhibits. When I was there, the Istanbul Biennial was taking place.

Surely worth the visit. Surely focussed on modern and contemporary Turkish art (but not only), the first private museum is show casing a great sample of the local art scene. Paintings, videos and installations are well displayed. The museum is well located and easily accessible by tram.
Modern Turkish Art with breathtaking views of Bospherous. The museum is one of the best curated ones and offers great views of the majestic city line with minarets and domes abound.
Excellent art. Highly recommended. Really enjoyed this place. There some captivating pieces here. Has excellent Cafe/Restaurant on the Bosphorous and also a nice smaller one in the gardens.

Eclectic and engaging artistic triumph. Located right on the waterfront this is an Istanbul gem.An eclectic mix of visual and aural artistic experiences await the visitor as well as an excellent restaurant

Modern Art with a Beautiful View. The Istanbul Modern does a nice job of showcasing national artists. The real show is the incredible view of the Bosporus while viewing the galleries. Make sure to visit the incredible Istanbul Modern Cafe. Great food but spotty service.

Must visit for Art lovers. An interesting modern art museum located in Tophane which is only 250 meters far from Tophane metro station through Eminono line, the entrance fees is reasonable around 20 TL (if not mistaken),great location with beautiful modern art gallery pieces, modern art lovers would enjoy it alot or art lovers overall like me. Its open from 10 am and closed on Mondays.

Good of you like modern art. As far as modern art goes, this was quite a good museum, well,laid out and with descriptions of art works in English as well as Turkish. Allos a couple of hours to see the whole collection. Avoid the costly restaurant and eat at the little cafe just inside the security entrance.

Guards are too strict. This is NOT a review of the exhibits. The art was great. However, the guards were incredibly strict. When I came here with my family, there was an interactive exhibit with magnifying glasses and suitcases and chairs. The sign said we could touch and move the art, so we did. We wanted to open one of the suitcases, but the guard rushed up to us and said we couldn't open it. I told her that it was an interactive exhibit, but she was really insistent. That ruined my "interaction." I wonder what the artist would have thought about that. She proceeded to follow us to the next exhibit (not even from a distance, literally SHOULDER TO SHOULDER) and scolded every little thing we did. When my stepmom pulled out her phone for pictures, the lady quickly said "No video!" The exhibit was in a separate room, and played a short song in a loop. When the short song finished, she strangely rushed us out of the room saying "It's finished! It's done!" It was super weird. Why was this necessary? What was she afraid we would do? At the restaurant, the servers were extremely rude. After not even being acknowledged and standing there waiting, I decided to just get menus and sit. Then they acted really weird and offended about it! I even told them that we had been waiting and no one showed up. This trend continued throughout the whole time we were there. They didn't come back to get our order, so I had to run and get them. When they finally came with our drinks, they didn't give us sugar and rushed away before we could ask for it, and I had to go get it from them. Then when we wanted the check, I had to run and get them again. Each time I ran over, they acted super annoyed! But I wouldn't have been doing that had they served us properly!! Ugh!Later on, we walked down the stairs. When we were done, we tried to walk back up but there was this lady sitting there making sure people didn't go up the stairs??? Why?? There were people coming down the stairs! She pointed in the general direction of a supposed elevator, which was hard to find since it was a freight elevator with a door that didn't automatically open. Thankfully, the art made up for the weird guards and servers. It's worth seeing even if you have this same experience. I hope they decide to make the rude guards part of the exhibit. That would actually be pretty cool.

Some Surprises. A Museum of Modern art is usually a good place to see where the city and its culture are headed and Istanbul was no exception. Located in a somewhat run down neighbourhood which seems to be in a state of abandonment with derelict but not demolished buildings with very sad remnants of the old area still struggling to survive close by - this museum exactly epitomises the dilemma that Istanbul finds itself. The building is relatively modern with a hard to find entrance but once inside you could be in Barcelona or Berlin . The exhibits were interesting and thought provoking with a particularly interesting photographic section and some film or video performances that demonstrated the cultural clashes in Turkey resulting mainly from religious differences. We were just taking tea in the café when what we thought was a block of apartments outside started to move - it was a huge cruise ship coming in to dock - the side view of which glided silently past the window. A strange vista indeed as was the whole experience. Go there if you get the chance - we are somehow glad we did.

Hard to find and marginally worth the effort. I looked forward to visiting this museum for several years If you want to find it, look across the Bosphorus to where you see parking spaces for giant cruise liners. The museum is in an old warehouse a few feet from the ships.The art was marginal when I was there. Today, as in so much of art, theatre and lit., everything is about Feminism, Racism and How I suffered from (name it) not having enough Lego blocks or the current best cell phone. I know the former two are serious matters, but really 40 years of Feminist shouting at us and lecturing us at every turn is already enough - thanks. Anti-racism "art" may feel good, but what has all the "feel good" activity ever accomplished in the past 4 decades of it.Frankly, I think this Museum trivializes real art, Budapest on the other hand has one of the most beautiful new galleries, in a spectacular setting, with a decent collection and when I was there, a nice Russian show of recent art.

Wonderful Surprize. This museum is a great surprise as it gives you a great insight into modern Turkey. Their collection of modern art is equal to the caliber of our big city Modern Art Museums in the States.

Istanbul Modern Museum A Must See. When you go to Istanbul, you are immediately struck with the collision of the old and new, the simple and grand, ancient and modern. The Istanbul Modern Museum serves to put you in touch with the modern end of the spectrum of this amazing and great city.
Wonderful art in Istanbul. My wife's favorite site in Istanbul--great cultural responses and art here in beautiful setting on the Bosporus.

biennale. I mainly went here to see a part of the Biennale but ended up seeing the whole exhibition. As far as I can gauge the art was of top-level. Both the view and the restaurant are valid reasons to make the trip there.

World Class. A really great gallery full of interesting exhibits and installations. What I really liked was that the art was fresh and new and related to Turkey and Istanbul and featured lots of local artists. I am a prolific visitor to art museums and galleries and I find I see the same art by the same artists in galleries all over the world but here I only recognised one pice of art that I had previously viewed at Tate Modern in London.I would highly recommend this gallery if you are interested in Contemporary Art.A lot of guide books say that this gallery is free on Thursdays but it's only free to residents of Istanbul... so not the best day to visit if you don't live there! It's only 10 L entry or 5 L if you have a student card. You can get here easily by tram but finding the way in isn't straight forward, you can see it but the way in is confusing... though a car park. They have a restaurant where you can sit by the water that serves first class food and wines, puts the food served in Tate Modern Restaurant in London to shame and at a fraction of the price!

Great review and wonderful cafe!. We enjoyed our visit to this museum, it will interesting and memorable. The exhibition about famous photographs and how the photographer chose the particular shot was great.

Great museum to spend an afternoon in. We went to the museum since we wanted a light day before hitting old city. The museum was fantastic. Right mix of modern art and very interesting installations. Towards the end of it while you move down there are some downright weird ones but even those were fun. They have done a really good job of explaining the art and highlighting turkish artists. Definitely a great way to spend a few relaxed hours.

Eclectic magnificence. I have been to many modern art galleries, from MOMA in NY to Tate Modern in London, and this is a standout among them for it's diversity, creativity and inclusivity. I was not expecting such a mesmerising range of work, and only wished I had longer - we had to leave to catch a plane! There was a large installation going in downstairs which was a shame but nonetheless I loved it.

A very interesting modern museum. The museum is an excellent place to visit, with some really stimulating art, extremely well presented. To give it full justice, at least two to three hours are needed for a visit.

Good activity when in Galata. A good activity for your third of fourth day in Istanbul or when you are in the Galata Area. Although it is not among the Top Atractions it is an interesting way to understand more of modern Turkey.

No respect at the bar. We have been attracted by the amazing situation of the cafeteria which is near to the Bosphore, at the museum. But what a surprise ! It has been really bad. There are 4 people in the staff : one of them is working behind the bar to prepare the coffee, the other one is dealing with paying, and two young women are waiting for ... your leaving... ! Indeed it is a self service bar : we have to choose betwenn iced tea, water and so on and to help ourselves but.... No price is indicated ! Furthermore, we have to wait almost 5-10' so that we can pay, because just one "waiter" deals with paying while both women don't do anything. So we queued at the bar, then the waiter said we had to take the drink in the fridges, we did it and then we had to queue again to pay, the drinks in hands... Finally we paid : a hairless waiter with a beard spoke very fast, we didnt understand the price and it seemed like he didn't care about us. We gave 20 TL because we believed having understand that we had to pay 20 TL (I remain that absolutely no price is indicated). But the waiter asked if we had 2 TL more. Thinking that we didn't understand the price well, we gave him 2 TL. And what a surprise... He put the 2 TL in the tip-box without asking us, as if it was included in the price !!!! We were so astonished that we couldn't find any word... We found it very disrespectful. Furthermore the two waitresses have always been waiting that we finished our two iced teas so as to they can clean the table. We had barely finished our drinks that they cleaned the table although we were still sitting. The ice tea was tasteless. We have been very disappointed.

Spectacular location, very interesting art. Very interesting art that is not derivative of either European or American modernism; some very thought provoking pieces including a significant number of works by female artists. The location is spectacular; the cafe has nice meals.

See the 14th Biennale - Saltwater!. My daughter visited the museum a few years ago and highly recommended I see the Biennale. I arrived with only two hours till closing time and was told it was free. I saw the ground floor exhibits then followed a guide's instructions and took a service lift up to see a sculpture composed of a stairwell that joined the first and ground floors. When I got up to there I was told that - even though there were only 15 minutes left before closing - I would have to buy a full-price ticket to take the sculpture-stairway down.Nonetheless, I would highly recommend a visit - both to the Istanbul Modern and the 14th Biennale called Saltwater. What it lacks is a clear presentation of the exhibition sites, comprehensible to non-Istanbulites - and specific guided tour of the different venues.

That's Real. My recommendation is to wonder around the museum, on way to the Galata bridge you will find small area with a beautiful stylish coffee houses an in some of them you can see the realy nice modern paintings.Walking on the streets there for sure you will have the filing that's this is Real!
Well worth a visit!. Excellent modern art gallery with an amazing restaurant which serves great food, right next to the ocean liner docks!

Nice exhibits on the other side of outside renonvation. Just went there yesterday. Very nice exhibits, under construction on the outside. The exhibits were great on the inside. Don't let the construction fool you.

Art lovers add this place to your to-see list!. If you are in Istanbul and done with the historic part of your trip (which is not easy) and if you are a modern art lover you should visit one of the biggest modern art museums in Istanbul. You'll love Istanbul Modern and its surroundings. If you have time after you've seen some of the exhibitions, I highly recommend that you go to upstairs and drink a cup of coffee in front of the amazing view.

Well worth an hour or two, close to Karakoy. The building is curiously ugly from the outside but very well designed inside. The pictures are displayed in as effective a fashion as I have seen in any museum or gallery anywhere.I was surprised to see no works by world-famous modern European or American artists, but don't let that put you off. I was equally surprised by the quality of some very fine works by Turkish artists. It is an interesting and colourful collection, and there is a cinema for art-house foreign movies in the basement.The cafe/restaurant has a balcony with superb views of the Bosphorus, unless a cruise liner is moored at the quayside!Close to the 'Tophane' tram stop, and the Tophane i Amiri Museum which is also worth a visit, depending on the exhibition that is showing. In May I saw an exhibition on Mimar Sinan the great architect of many famous Istanbul mosques. It was terrific.
Well worth a visit. For a change of pace from old Istanbul, the museum is on 2 levels. Unfortunately lower floor was closed to prepare for upcoming exhibition. Thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

Kiwi T-Shirt wearer welcomed us to innovative Gallery. Some exhibits that broke new ground for me, but [Bias warning] - being Kiwis, my partner & I were so pleased to see one of the desk clerks wearing an Aotearoa New Zealand T-shirt. We had a long conversation & welcome to Istanbul Modern.

Very worthwhile visit. The Museum of Modern Art is a very low key relaxing way to spend an hour or two. Finally a break from the hustle and bustle of Istanbul. Bring a student id if you have one since there is a discounted rate for students. We ate lunch in the Museum's restaurant after. Pricey but delicious and well worth it.

top museum in Istanbul. great museum with magnificent view over the Bospohorus
nice building and superbly arranged collection
at the time of my visit the temporary collection downstairs was being renovated

Unassuming but Over Delivering, A fantastic modern art museum. If I had been in NYC I would be impressed but since I was in Istanbul I was simply floored. The whole experience was great.The layout is well thought out and even though there are a lot of people in the space you hardly notice them. The views are also breathtaking, in terms of the art there are many great pieces but I would highly recommend the Everyone Can Sing installation as well as the Contrasts muriel are some of my favourites.I have attached pictures, yes you can take photo's at this museum!

Great break from turisty Istanbul. We love to visit galleries and muzeums of modern art and Istanbul Modern provides excellent inside into the art scene of modern Turkey. It's well organised and provides a great break from traditional turisty attractions of Istanbul. It has a cafe with amazing view on Bhosporus.

Much of it was just ridiculous.. Perhaps 10-20% of the exhibits honestly merited the title of "art." Much of it was just ridiculous. For example, some guy sent in a video of himself dressed like a woman, trying badly to bellydance, and they actually put it on display.

The best modern art museum i've been to. I loved the place a lot. Bright spaces, great installations. Two installations have touched me deeply - woman in yellow rain coat is lip-syncing with Leonard Cohen's "Hallelujah" with Istanbul of 1970 on the background. Istanbul Modern. Great collection of modern arts. I do you have time you can visit a restaurant there for drink or lunch. Enjoying for spectacular views for Asian site of Istanbul

An experience. Spend a couple of ours at Istanbul Modern. Exciting exhibitions. Plenty of room to Watch art, people or... Fine restaurant too. Sit on th outside facing Asia.

Well worth a visit. My wife and I stopped here with little expectations and found it to be a highlight of our visit. Excellent art and a beautiful building.

Stunning place to Visit. This place is a gorgeous place to visit who loved modern art, its in the new city and at the seaside in Tophane area. The seeds for the Istanbul Modern project were sown in 1987, during the 1st International Contemporary Art Exhibition, known today as the International Istanbul Biennial. Motivated by the interest shown in the event and the dynamism it contributed to the Istanbul art scene, Dr. Nejat F. Eczacıbaşı embarked on the project to endow Istanbul with a permanent Museum of Contemporary Art.After a long quest, the Feshane, a former 19th century textile manufacturing plant on the Golden Horn, was converted into a Museum of Contemporary Art. Although the building housed the 3rd International Istanbul Biennial in 1991, the Project never reached its long term goal.From then on, various institutions and individuals sought to establish a Museum of Modern Art in Istanbul. Unfortunately, these initiatives failed for lack of suitable space or due to difficulties in obtaining artworks to form the core of the permanent collection.The fate of the Project changed once again in 2003, when the fourth warehouse on the Galata pier, near the Mimar Sinan Academy of Fine Arts, served as the main venue for the 8th Istanbul Biennial. After Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdoğan gave his approval for the permanent use of the site, the Project’s main obstacle was removed. The 8,000 square meter dry cargo warehouse, owned by the Turkish Maritime Organization, was transformed into a modern museum building with all corresponding functions.

Lovely collection of art!. It is a great place to visit if you are an art lovers.This place is full of Turkish art.I enjoyed every moment in this lovely place.A must visit place if you are in Turkey.

Magnum photography exhibition . This is a great exhibition to attend the photos are amazing and all the snaps before the final pick are also amazing to look at I would definitely recommend if it's still on

Worth a visit and nice restaurant too!. We walked here from the other side of the Galata Bridge. There is a really good selection of modern art.......we're more traditionalist in our tastes, but there was plenty to interest us. Contemporary Turkish Art. A great half day spent wandering around this rectangular building, nothing special about the space but its contents were absorbing. The cafe there was good too. It's located a bit back from a main road and a walk through a temporary building site when we visited but that should pass in time to reveal a more attractive exterior setting.

Excellent collection - great visit. It's not on the museum card, but worth the 19TL each. It's such a diverse collection and really interesting details on how art changed here. It'll take maybe 1hr and a half. Strongly recommend. How to find it? Go to Tophane on the blue tram line. Cross towards the Kilic Ali Pasa mosque and turn left. At the red scaffolding turn in (it looks like and IS a car park) go across the parking to the right and it's in a warehouse. Very rundown industrial area. Cafe gas a good view though. Alternatively there are some great local cafes in an alleyway just off the entrance to the carpark.

Loved the photos, paintings were okay too. This place is really aster of taste. I personally enjoyed the photography exhibit. It's downstairs and well worth seeing first before you get tired. The other art was fine but not all of it was to my taste. Based on other reviews, I expected that there would be very few international artists profiled. When I went however, there was one exhibit tied to a chronological history of Turkish artists but the remainder is the art was done mostly by international artists.

A good insight into Turkish contemporary art. While you enjoy the 19th century and older splendors of Istanbul, spend some time at the Istanbul Modern Museum. The current exhibit - Past and Present - provides an oversight of modern and contemporary art created by Turkish artists. Very well done and interesting.Don't forget the rooftop restaurant to enjoy the food or drinks and a view of the sea.

Great permanent collection . They have a beautiful exhibition on view of works from their permanent collection in the main halls. From what I've discussed with other friends, this has been on for quite a while. Some truly fantastic works on display by regional and local artists. The temporary magnum contact sheet exhibition was much more amazing than I had thought it would be.A beautiful museum of contemporary art. Ticketed, but no long lines. Go from Tophane station. A bit hard to find because of construction around it but look for the bright red metal grid stricture on the building in front of it for a marker. Must go for art-tourists.

Worl class and stunning. Hard to find unless you spot their signs on the main Bosporus boulevard. The art is beautifully displayed by time periods. The waterside restaurant has outdoor tables,large interior with gourmet quality lunch choices.if coming by tram or on foot ,look for signage as the museum is hidden for now in a wharehouse district. The Bosporus views look toward the profile of Topkapi Palace.
Wonderful Museum. Visited with our guide providing the educated knowledge and direction.We spent 2-3 hours here without any difficulty. A relaxing visit to a very good museum

A professional look at the art of republic close to a century. As the name implies, it is a very modern building housing the collection. The museum restaurant is very nice. Unless there is a cruise ship in port you have wonderful views of the Bosphorus waterway. Although a bit pricey, lunch is excellent and worth it for the food and the view. The entry fee is modest.
First Class Museum. Fantastic place, you could easily spend 2 or 3 hours here. Go early (before 11) to avoid the school children. Can't recommend it enough.

Nice space and good selection. The exhibitions will always change of course, but they curate their works quite well. Get inside and the building opens to the water. Now they're constructing even bigger buildings too.

Top arts. I went to the place last week, and I was surprised of what I saw.Very beautiful art works, well organized, and you can enjoy the Turkish touch in modern arts.Also they are expanding the place....looking forward to see that.

Great collection of modern art. The curation of the art pieces exhibited is great work and the location of the museum right along the Bosphorous River also gives visitors a great perspective of the Old City.

Some people really swoon over it. Some people really seem to swoon over this art gallery and there is every chance my own lack of knowledge about art is at play here but I didn't find much of particular interest here except for an extensive display of photography. The photography exhibits really brought out a lot of human drama from episodes in the cities history and were a real eye witness window into certain events.The rest of the art work at the Istanbul Modern was your average collection of landscapes (a couple of quite pleasing ones), some stylised portraits and some modern art/sculpture installations which left me utterly unmoved.The Museum itself is not particularly close to any other major attractions but there is some parking if you have your own car and it has some nice views as it is right on the water. There is a cloakroom which is handy for the traveller to divest themselves of their backpack and a restaurant (which I didn't eat at so can't comment) which looks out over the water. A gift shop near the entrance rounds out the Istanbul Modern experience.
Must See for Art Lovers. Wide variety of paintings from many artists working with different techniques and materials. Has a good Restaurent and a shop which sells interesting artworks.

Nice!. We like the art that is presented here. After a day or so in the old city, this is refreshing.
The restauarnt has a brilliant view of the Bosporus. Sadly they seem to have a need to play music pretty loud outside on the terrace.

Intense, quirky and instructive. Great immersion in Turkey's thriving modern art scene, with a good breadth of pieces in a great space. The museum's cafe is worth a visit in its own right, with an interesting setting, menu and of course stunning view of the city by the water.

While I know lots about contemporary art, I was not familiar with the Turkey experience. It is fascinating to see the development.The temporary exhibit was also a retrospect of a turkish artist - 350 pieces and was equally as interesting. A gorgeous restaurant and lovely gift shop. For under $10 this is a great site and for art lovers you will appreciate this insightful look .

Difficult to access but a great brunch cafe overlooking river. A car is useful to get here and the museum is not an architectural wonder, but offers great views of the Bosphorus with a quiet and friendly and large brunch restaurant on top overlooking River. Go for that.

Modern art made accessible. Istanbul Modern is a large contemporary art gallery in a warehouse on the Bosphorous. Apart form the pretentious artist descriptions it is one of the most accessible art galleries i have ever visited. Young children , teens, families and artists mingled in a busy but comfortable environment. Large main gallery with permanent collection of modern artists- look out for Julian Opies dancing animation at the entrance to the cafe and do gov ethe video art a look - some moving pieces _ Beirut piece in particular. The downstairs photography and architecture galleries are the highlight and a stunning library. There is a cloakroom and signs that say you can take pictures. A nice surprise. My daughter and I visited around noon. No lines. Nicely surprised at the quality of the museum. It contains a nice array of contemporary art?

Good restaurant .... The restaurant is definitely worth going for and it's nice to see a bit of modern art in this city full of history, but it's not up to the standards of MOMA or Tate Modern.
Good for a rainy day. The exhibits focus on local artists. No international big names here, but certainly some interesting ideas. Good for a rainy day.

very interesting. It was a rainy day and we decided to visit this museum. What a nice surprise! In the museum you may also have coffee and/or lunch at its wonderful restaurant with a wonderful view of the Bosporus and there is a cinema where they were projecting movies of a film festival.
