Nice. Lots of pieces there. Worth a visit for sure. Has two floors. Restaurant looked good though I didn't go in. Cost about 36-38 lera for two people

A stunning museum on Bosphorus. Combination of everything you need to enjoy one museum even if you are non-museum lover: great exhibitions that can be pre-checked on well updated app and web, stunning view and delicious food. Also, place has a good shop to buy some modern staff to take with you.
İstanbul's must see exhibitions... To understand metropols art approach and modern art this place is so suitable for those wants to explore with spacious rooms..

Excellent pieces but hard to find. It is worth making the effort to find this place if your looking for your art fix, we approached from the bridge and walked along the doc. you can see it but its not that easy to walk to.Some truly amazing building around the modern and great photo opportunities.

Serendipity Traveler's Best of Turkey. A stunning museum on the waterfront that is worthy of exploration. The cafe is serving lovely lunch and the views are spectacular when the mega cruise ships are not in port. Strolling the museum gives one a sense of the past and present day Turkey.

Rich variaty of modern and beautiful installations,paintings,photographes and movies.. This place is surprisingly not popular among tourists although it present really modern and interesting art. The price of the ticket was 19 TL and it was worth! if you want to go away for while form the old cultural sightseeing this is your place.
Surprisingly Good. Very interesting and quite extensive modern art collection. Some pretty interesting videos. Worth a several hour visit.

The most child unfriendly museum in Istanbul . What's wrong about this Museum'a security staff why do they have such an unfriendly behavior towards little children. Different. We were there several times. Breakfast, lunch and dinner. Each time place was different then other. View and dishes is delicious.

Istanbul Modern. The entrance fee was incorresctly posted on a travel guide. The fee had increased significantly.Some exhibits were more interesting than others, as is the case for most art museums. The Museum offered enough varied art that the visit was interesting. The Museum is located conveniently near a train stop and the surrounding area is fun for exploring. The restaurant is wonderful. An outdoor deck offers a lovely waterfront view.

Great Art, Rude Staff. Let's get this out of the way. Is the staff friendly? Not at all. In fact, I've seen more charm in a pitbull than some of the staff here. But does it make the art any less spectacular? Nope. Not a bit.Istabul Modern is a new concept and a welcome breath of fresh air to the tourism of Istanbul. museum, cafe/restaurant and ocean cruise dock :). this is where the cruise ships dock also.......towering above (although beside) the outdoor cafe.............the museum itself is a treat to view the history of art in Turkey.....as well as to celebrate the new and upcoming artists .............along the Tram Line, easy access........and obviously ON the Bosphorus :)

Jewel at the harbor. After several days of intense history from the Ottomans and before, this museum off the leisure ship docks is a wonderful counterpoint of Turkey in the modern era. Lovely cafe...get a table outside overlooking the Sultanahmet across the waters.

Yes it is modern... As we can understand from the name of the museum it shows us modern part of Turkey. They exhibit current events and they are really good at picking up the point. I enjoyed every peace of the museum it should be visited..

The only Modern Art Museum in Istanbul. It is the only official Modern Art Museum in Istanbul which is a ''must to visit'' for all tourists . Permanent collection is the biggest contemporary Turkish artists collection. Several temporary projects and exhibitions during the year are always attractive. Don't forget to experience the cafe inside which has one of the best Bosphorus and Old Town panaromic view in town.

An Important Centrepiece in the Istanbul Arts Scene. Not to be missed especially if you are a lover of the arts. Situated conveniently in Karakoy now booming with many cafes and galleries and near a tram stop, Istanbul Modern should be on the to-visit list of any tourist. It is focused and streamlined to complete effect, bridging Turkish modern art with the rest of the world, highly comprehensive. Nice restaurant overlooking the sea, as well as an interesting little museum shop. This was my second visit, and I would love to return to visit again the next time I have the chance to. A good place to visit alone, with friends or family.

Great experience.
