I don't think you need to see it more than once if you're a traveler because most of the paintings are permanent exhibitions, but I really enjoyed it.I would recommend it if you love art or have more time in the city.

Incredible art. Istanbul Modern is very big museum of very good artworks which is definitely worth visiting. All artworks are exhibited differently and sometimes there are a particular themes to exhibitions.

Exceptional view but not so great art. It's the only modern art museum in Istanbul and a museum Istanbul deserved for many years. There is an exhibition every day. The works of both local and international artists are represented. It's on the tram line which makes it easy to visit. It's right by the Bosphorus so a quick coffee break while you see some art is a nice touch. However; as far as the museum itself and the art represented go; it's a rather weak alternative compared to other modern art museums you'd visit all across Europe. But the view from the museum itself is worth the trip.

sea and modern art. A brilliant place for art lovers and anyone who enjoys lunch on a sunny terrace above the sea. The view over the Bosphorus Strait where Europe and Asia meet is just breath-taking. It's always first on my list when returning to Istanbul.
Great Museum for Modern Arts. There is almost an exhibition every day, but you need to check the program before you go. There is not a constant program that goes on for a year or so.

Worthwhile break from Istanbul historical sites . An easy walk from the Tophane tram stop and a very different experience from the historical sites in Sultanahmet. As of January 2015, you enter through the parking area. We enjoyed the art installations (painting and sculpture) but particularly enjoyed the video pieces, which provide a good excuse to sit down and rest for a while. There is a nice restaurant and museum shop on site and the museum overlooks the water. The audio guide was so-so. If you walk back towards Karaköy instead of Tophane, there are some cool non-touristy cafes a block away from the water.

Truly a contemporary and captivating art museum!. I was forced to go there on a school trip, thinking that this museum will be as lame as my school, but it was the extreme opposite. The variety of art there in all shapes and sizes truly captivates you. No art piece in this place is distasteful or poor. The majority of the artists' works were Turkish and that really stood out for me. I'm glad I was forced to go there as I enjoyed every second of it!
Impressive Modern Art Pieces. A place to visit if you are into modern and contemporary art. Plenty of rooms playing art videos as well. Worth a visit if you are an art lover.

Enjoyed our visit here with the kids. We visited the Istanbul modern when there was an interactive Art Exhibition on. The kids really enjoyed the visit and the activities made it easier to take the kids around an art museum which we probably wouldn't have attempted otherwise.

A modern touch in a traditional city. All in all a decent modern art museum. Thing is that its "direct competitors" are museums like the moma of ny,of tokyo and of london which set too high a bar. It has a collection of many turkish modern artists, focusing mostly on expressionism exhibits. I don't know if it was a temporary exhibition. The ground floor has a very nice exhibition about the history of turkish cinema. Quite interesting. It's a rather small museum,only took us about two hours to go through the whole thing. It's gonna be a nicer museum probably when they finish constructing their new buildings

My favourite non-historical place in Istanbul. I visited Istanbul for the 4th time (and definitely coming back) this December.We have seen all the tourist places so far - so we planned to see some new places. We got recommendation from our local friends about Istanbul Modern.We came around 3pm (tough party last night) and at first enjoyed few sunbeams on the amazing terrace (Istanbul Modern Restaurant).The lower floor the Istanbul Modern was closed due to some event last night, so we only took a guided tour of the permanent exhibition - and I must say, despite the fact I am not a big lover of modern art (visiting MOMA in US was a real pain for me), Istanbul Modern has a lot to offer to anyone.Most of the pieces are not part of the modern abstract art (which I really dont like), but there are many beautiful paintings from the post-Ottoman era. I must strongly recommend to go with organized tour - we heard many interesting stories about the "behind the courtains" things.Some paintings were really lame, but the guide told us what is the reason why they are in the gallery - there was always some strong reason, which made part of the modern turkish art mosaic.The walk took us around 2hrs - but apart from the paintings / photographs / video installation, we also heard many interesting stories from the modern Turkish history. I must also highlight the possibility to understand, how the people work in the gallery with blind kids - definitely ask for this opportunity (to hear how they do the exhibitions for them) - I dont want to spoil it now for you.I must strongly recommend visiting Istanbul in the winter - the weather was more than pleasant - around 16 - 17 C during the day with lots of sun and there was definitely less tourists then during top season months (so it was easier to go anywhere).
Worth the visit. A diverse display as expected. Well worth the visit if you are into art. Would take an average person a bit over an hour to get around.

A highlight of our visit. If you have any interest in contemporary art this is a must see when you visit Istanbul. A great space with wonderful views over the Bosphorous. Also contains an interesting area dedicated to the history of turkish cinema.

Great space. This art space is fairly small, but has some amazing works in it. Right down by the river, it is a great place to visit, check out the art, and then go for a stroll afterwards. Worth the stop.

Modern indeed. I found the current exhibit on istanbuluans love of cinema to be unique and in many ways parallel Pamuk's Museum of Innocence. The modern art is excellent and shows the creative side of when east meets west.

Food and wine mecca!. Yes ... we confess. My wife and I didn't come here for the art. We came here for the food and wine! My wife had been bragging to me about how she and her family had come here for the food and wine before. So during our honeymoon, and because we both love Istanbul, we weren't going to miss the Istanbul Modern Museum.And despite a HUGE CRUISE LINER that blocked our view of the Bosphorus that divides the eastern and western continents, we loved their (copious and exquisite) food and wine. We were even served by a wonderful man who remembered my wife and her family all those years ago!We can't wait to come back to visit Istanbul again, including the Istanbul Modern, and this time we'll check out the art.

A surprising addition to the list of sights to see. The Istanbul Modern Museum occupies a long two-story space with frontage directly on the Bosporus, and features the work of local contemporary artists, in what seems to be a burgeoning art scene. There is a very handsome restaurant cafe in the museum, with excellent views of the historic center of Istanbul, and further afield, to the Anatolian side.
Lovely collection. Nice and diverse collection of mostly Turkish modern art housed in a recently renovated warehouse on the seashore. Good place to spend the afternoon.

Tate goes Istanbul!. Excellent museum of art. An opportunity to get to know younger Turkish artists. Excellent location. Tate-like look and feel. Great shop with many original objects you can not possibly find elsewhere.

Fıne Turkısh Art. Several days ago,I vısıted thıs art museum.Granted the Turkısh paınters were less ınnovatıve than the French and Amerıcan paınters ın the late 19th and early 20th Çentury,nevertheless I stıll appreçıated the fıne paıntıngs that I saw by suçh Turkısh paınters as:Mıgurdıç Gıvanıan("Istanbul"),Nedır Gunsur("Mıner"),and Haça Al Rıza("Landsçape").I also lıked the fıne Çontemporary vıdeos,I saw by Çanan("Exemplary") and Sukran Moral("Bordello"),among others.I also enjoyed the fabrıç çreatıon of Sabere Susuz and the audıo-musıçai presentatıons of Hale Tenger and Ferhat Ozgın.Senıors lıke myself reçeıve a dısçount.

interesting modern museum with a Turkish twist. We spent a few hours here looking at a variety of exhibits. One of the exhibits dealt with the treatment of minorities in Turkey; another with art that incorporated sound and music. There is a nice place to eat here that looks out over the Bosphorus.

Nice change of pace from historic sites. Istanbul's historic sites will always take center stage, but the Modern Art Museum is refreshing after looking at all the antiquities. I'm no art expert, but the collection is fun to view and provides an interesting take on the people and artists of modern day Turkey. The building itself is architecturally progressive, and its location on the Bosphorous offers gorgeous views over the water. (Apparently if the cruise ships are in port, views can be obscured -- but that wasn't the case the day we were there.) Many of the museum visitors are locals, rather than tourists, so they're as much on view as the art. Excellent restaurant on the premises. Take the time to have a nice lunch. It's a little pricier than your average Istanbul eatery but still reasonable by American standards.
Excellent. You should absolutely visit the museum. After some dose of art, you should have something to drink in the restaurant. Nice decoration, nice view
excellent views.... We came on the recommendation of the owner of the hotel we stayed.restaurant is really impressive.drink your coffee, you can watch the historical island..I highly recommend it.

Nice museum. Nice mix of the old and the new. My girlfriend loved the place. I thought it was good also. Didnt get too much out of the history of turkish cinema in the basement, but there were some great installations on the first floor.

An excellent modern art museum. The Istanbul Modern Art Museum is an excellent place to see modern Turkish artists and a few from other countries. The museum is in a huge warehouse along the wharf, sometimes almost dwarfed by cruise ships anchored next to it. The space inside is very well done--it's easy to wander and gaze at modern paintings with sculptures carefully placed. We always are interested in seeing contemporary painters, and this museum is well worth a visit by anyone interested in contemporary art.

A favourite past-time. One of my favourites past-times is to visit the Istanbul Modern especially on a Thursday where it's free for residents. There is always variety of amazing exhibitions to see and I can easily spend hours in there meandering through the spectacular works of art. It's easily accessible by a short walk from either Tophane or Findikli tram stops. I highly recommend this as a great way to spend time and to see the amazing exhibitions. Afterwards enjoy a tea in the Istanbul Modern restaurant to admire the Bosphorus views.
NOT A TON OF STUFF. But still very cool. Well curated, with an excellent cafe that overlooks the old city. That's good enough for me. Sit out there with some cay cay and breathe, guyz.
Really Cool!!!. With an incredible good taste and rich in turkish way of life, it's a great and different trip to see Istanbul and Turkey.

Nice experience. Due to the temporary work sites finding the museum is a little bit challenging. If you are interested in modern art, definitely you will enjoy the place. It’s not quite common to see Turkish modern artists, at least in my country, so visiting the museum was a good opportunity to find out something about them and their works. I was pleased with everything that I saw and experienced here.

Wonderful and compact. The range of art is good and there was a brilliant photography exhibition downstairs. The restaurant is pricey but the experience was good. The waiters are off hand, but do not pay attention to that.

Delightful museum. Very nice modern art museum. Collection when I visited included many works from Turkish artists depicting cultural and historical events in the recent history of the country. Was informative, inspiring and fun. Diverse pieces where everyone should be able to find something to enjoy and definitely should find something to make you think.

Sister Trip. Amazing museum! My sister and I are not museum buff at all, yet we found ourselves really enjoying the visit! So much to see and you will definitely be intrigued! A must-see if you enjoy modern art!

Great collection, even better atmosphere.. This is one of the better museums I've attended. In addition to a great collection, I was especially fascinated with the works by Turkish artists - we don't get to see them often in the U.S. and I enjoyed reading about both the artist and the piece itself. The atmosphere itself was wonderful, and blissfully quiet, which was a welcome change from the busy and crowded streets and other tourists attractions. I also loved their cafe, which has outdoor seating and proivdes incredible views of the Bosphorous. If you love art, take the time and check Istanbul Modern out.

Interesting and inspiring!. One of the best museums of modern art I have ever visited. Permament (?) collection on Turkish art is just fascinating, also great section with international work. Felt genuinely invigorated after the visit. Hosts also a great, but pricey, restaurant - however, it is worth it. Exclelent museum shop as well.
Modern style in old Istanbul. Great place to see differnce between the old monumental buildings and views. Good choice with pictures and sculptures.

It's all been said before but.... Can't praise this place enough .Excellent introduction to modern art forms in Turkey.Cutting edge exhibitions with lots going on and in most cases excellent English translations.Ditto to everything good that has been said in previous reviews.Great restaurant/cafe with unequalled views over the Bosphorous.I cannot believe that they allow those monstrous cruise ships to berth in front of it.Luckily we were there on a ship-free day.The restaurant is open evenings as well.Highly recommended.

Interesting Turkish modern art. It doesn't looked like a museum, but it was astonishing. Lots of interesting of modern art, but only Turkish. Would have been nice if there was some international art, which I was expecting. Make sure you visit the place in the morning, as the queue gets longer every hour. Its a bit hard to find, as the place is at the end of a parking lot with no real marked entrance. Just look for the great grey hall.

Exciting Art. This modern art museum, by Tophane tram stop, is small but very good. There was a wide range of art, which was accessible and not pretentious. Very aesthetically pleasing and impressive, in a nice venue next to the port for the cruise ships. Restaurant there is expensive. Outside there is a cute row of bars, cafes, and restaurants, and next door there is a cute mosque and chic haman. These are also worth a visit.

Really good gallery space. Was well beyond expectations. Some great exhibitions. Nice space. Good restaurant / cafe with great views across Bosphorous. Only criticism is 'security staff' could be more friendly!! :-)

Addressing modern issues in witty & arresting ways. This what I look for in modern art museum - works that are stimulating, addressing modern issues in sometimes witty, sometimes arresting ways. Most importantly of all for me is that you can see a unique national response to common artistic themes. There are a few international artists represented here but I enjoyed discovering new names in the art world from Turkey, including several women. There are relatively few sculptural & craft pieces, but the video, photography & paintings gave me a wonderful couple of hours in great Turkish company.

PLEASE don't spoil this art gallery. Istanbul Modern is a wonderful space for modern art with wonderful light, until...........a giant cruise liner berths beside it. This really shouldn't be allowed and I hope the gallery management are objecting strongly. The city should have more pride in one of their great assets than to allow this to happen. Many of the pictures and installations are of high quality. There is an excellent restaurant where we have eaten before although last weekend it was so busy we went elsewhere. This is a gallery that has an good permanent collection and the temporary exhibitions are very interesting. Our one gripe on our recent visit was that the Securitas guards, especially the young women, were officious and looking for trouble, quite unpleasant. PLEASE, Istanbul, this is a special place so please keep it that way.

An Ideal Weekend. Istanbul Modern is more than a modern art gallery. There are attractions for the children as well. If you want to spend a few hours with your young children, that's the place to go. It also has a very good restaurant with the panorama of the Bosphorus and the Topkapi Palace provided that no monster passenger boat is moored right in front of it. The permanent exhibition is all Turkish artists' work. But the temporary ones offer cleverly curated topics and usually accompanied by films. The bottom line is that it's just a very very pleasant place to visit.

Fascinating gallery, great restaurant. This is one of the better modern art galleries, with an electic mix of media, including sculpture, photography, painting, film and audio. It makes for a really interesting few hours out of the hustle and bustle of Istanbul's hectic traffic.And to make things better, the Modern's restaurant is excellent - probably the best views in city from the terrace, gazing back at the Golden Horn, and perched right on the edge of the Bosphorous, Add really good food and good service and you have a winner.And if art is not your thing, you can bypass the gallery and head straight to the restaurant. Well worth it!

This is a great place, with a wonderful restaurant,. We have been to the Istanbul Modern many times, most recently a few days ago. The art selection is pretty amazing, given that their artists are relatively unknown outside of the country. But the restaurant is truly amazing: this time we had to eat indoors because it was too crowded on the deck, but usually we eat outside and the view is wonderful, since the museum is on the Bosphorus.This time we had wonderful bread and olive oil, pizza and a salad. Do not leave without sampling their desserts, which are just spectacular. The art here is always worth a visit because they change it all the time, in order to keep up with the new artists.A great place.

Worthwhile. If you want to have a break from the Byzantine and Ottoman sights and get some insight into Modern Turkish art visit Istanbul Modern. There are some foreign artists featured, but the bulk of the exhibition is Turkish art. Short movies and temporary exhibits are also shown, as are feature films (check times and days). This is unrelated, but 100 meters before the entrance there are nice cafes where you can indulge in some nargileh/shisha/hookah smoking.

The most impressive sight in Istanbul. I have never missed an opportunity to visit this museum whenever in town and over the years, this has proven to be the most worthwhile experience in the city. The museum contains a comprehensive overview of Turkish art, organized in a well-curated, labeled and analyzed collection. It's a very enjoyable trip in time which in itself takes about an hour and a half. Where this museum excels, however, is in the temporary exhibits, which are always thought-provoking and extremely well organized and presented. It's a very user-friendly environment and you can totally spend several hours without feeling tired or bored. Stunning views over the Bosphorus from the cafe and the large windows.

Thought provoking! Non-professional photos without flash is allowed.. If you enjoy exploring provocative and inspiring themes, the contemporary work featured here is powerful and wonderful. It's not a large space and can be enjoyed in an afternoon. I spent two hours before closing here but could have spent my whole day here if I had more time in Istanbul than only 2 full days. Admission was 17TL. Closed on Mondays.Location-wise, it's near where the cruise ships dock, the Fountain of Mahmud I, Kılıç Ali Paşa Mosque, Rainbow Steps, and Cihangir neighborhood (Orhan Pamuk's office is here). If you have time to visit Cihangir, it came highly recommended by my hotel concierge as it's one of Istanbul's best loved districts. Popular with local and foreign artists, writers, actors and musicians, this was a lively and fun place to hang out in cafes and bars with a definite boho vibe. Skip Istanbul Modern's Restaurant and head over to Cihangir instead.

Superb Gallery. Talking about art is rarely a good thing so I'll keep it brief.
If you like modern art galleries then you must visit this gallery. It excels across a number of mediums: the photography is thought provoking; the video installations captivating; and the paintings strikingly fresh.
Nice. If you like modern art you will love this museum. And if you go there I recommend visiting the restaurant in the museum. There's really beautiful view from that terrace

Must visit. A choice different than Byzantine and Ottoman Istanbul. A very interesting and illuminating overview of modern turkish art. Plus a restaurant with perfect view of Bosphorus and Golden Horn, as well as very good cuisine. Don't miss Istanbul Modern.
Museum of contemporary art. Not very big, though there is a good variety on show, including sculptures, paintings, photographs, movies and more. Would highly recommend.

Enjoyable afternoon. The collection at Istanbul Modern is intriguing and impressive. We enjoyed an afternoon there and could have stayed longer. The works are displayed very well and the collection gives you a good sense of the recent developments in Turkish art and the identity of the city. The cafe overlooking the Bosphorus is great too.

A fine art gallery, stimulating works.. Free on Thursdays, but a reasonable entrance fee anyway. Stunning location on the banks of the Bosphorus, extensive & stimulating collection of 20th century Turkish art, with constantly changing temporary exhibitions by Turkish and international artists. A must for art lovers. Cafe/restaurant is better than most. The easiest way to get there is by tram to Tophane station and then walking a couple of hundred metres. The entry is still under construction but don’t be put off, it’s a fine art gallery.

Visual Arts and Music in Turkey. As for me... it was unforgettable experience of feeling modern Istanbul through art & music collaborations. Strictly recommended for aesthetically educated travelers! “Plurivocality” exhibition, located on the ground floor (paintings, sculptures, videos and installations), features current works by artists that treat the visual and the auditory as two fields of creativity. Following which I've found the next musical object - a real grand piano hanging in the large hall, but now as a part of permanent collection. An amazing way of self-actualization turns your mind on two different floors of conceptual metaphors. Some areas of this museum look as the whole one: there are also photo-gallery, cinema, library, restaurant and store. Admission fee is 17 TL, and no extra charge for making photo. English language required! Don’t doubt about visiting.

A surprising mixture. Istanbul Modern includes a wide range of differing media, my only regret, in the photo gallery there was one photograph I wanted to buy but the museum shop did not have copies for sale.The café terrace was also very good, but 6TL for a Turkish tea I felt was unreasonable.

nice experience. Interesting place to visit - the buiding is quite cool (however, the way there was strange - through some parking lots etc, I thought we went the wrong way at first). There were some interesting exhibits in the collection too.

really good for getting out of the crowded city for a brainstorming afternoon. One of my best experiences in Istanbul. I attended only the 2 temporary exhibitions (On the road, Çok Sesli). Both of them were smart, thought-provoking and very informative as well. The museum was not crowded and met all requirements of modern museology.

Enjoy art as well as the view!. Make sure to have some tea overlooking the beautiful Bosphorus in addition to the art! When you are inside, one tends to forget the museum is right along the water, and the view is just lovely. The website is always a good place to go first to make sure the museum is open on the day you are going, and to see more information about the exhibits, and prices,

Art in the City. Istanbul modern museum is by the Bosphorus in the City center (Tophane, Karaköy).You can check their program on the touch screen boards which are located all around the city. Don't forget to check the beautiful cafe, have a Turkish coffee while enjoying the great view.Every Thursday is public day, that means free admission.
Free Thursdays are only for Turkish residents. Something I didn't see on Trip Advisor, but when I went there, they said I needed to buy a ticket even though it was Thursday.

Contemporary art in ancient city. Loved Istanbul Modern on the banks of the Bosphorus. Unlike the ancient mosques and palaces, this was relatively uncrowded when I visited. The art is wonderful, diverse and large scale. Much of it concerns the repression of women so very interesting in a country that is undergoing social conflict. Great restaurant on the balcony overlooking the river.

Great place to get to see Istanbul through modern eyes. This proves that Istanbul is more than just mosques! Also, great place to grab lunch on the water.Like most old cities, you'll realize that all mosques/churches/museums are the same. Well, the Instanbul Modern is such a pleasant departure that talks about life in the vibrant and multilayered city in so many media. Unlike other modern museums where there's a must see piece, the whole collection highlights Turkish artists and their view of the Republic and what it means to be Turkish.Also, its one of the few places where the building is completely air conditioned, so a great place to spend a day when its too hot and humid outside.

Wonderful art in a pleasant setting. Very diverse and creative, but like other reviewers, I was also impressed with the photo gallery. Humane and powerful photographs. Ordinary people of Turkey's recent history and present deserve not less attention than the glamorous imperial past.

energy. I am not a big fan of modern art, but I enjoy visiting modern galleries. I do believe it expresses well the spirit of the nation. Very creative, very powerfull and touching. Especially the photo galleries depict the very rare moments of rural Turkey from places you would unlikely to travel yourself... to me though it gave a very strong motivation to actually travel to central Turkey to see its real authentic life

Not just a museum or exhibition space. You can have a good time. Eczacıbaşı family thanks to the contributions and hard-working curators, this Istanbul's first and only museum of Modern Art opened its doors in December 2004. A useful library, exhibition, photo gallery, sculpture courtyard, cinema, café and gift shop overlooking the Bosphorus with renovated old docks in Karaköy district, is home. This private museum of contemporary Turkish art on a lot of things you can find one, your idea may occur.

Different in a good way. Istanbul Modern is not a huge museum but is always confronting and inspiring with its exhibitions. You can see not just west European but also many middle-eastern and eastern European originated modern art which is quite unusual and attractive to the eye. Well looked after Istanbulites are proud of their modern museum.

Great Installations!. The museum is quite big and it offers a variety of permanent and temporary exhibitions. In Turkey artists are very happy to experiment with new techniques and media and in this museum the video installations are outstanding! Amazing view from the Cafeteria (in which you can drink a very good cappuccino and some prosecco from Italy)!

V Interesting !!. V interesting experience.. Especially after visiting historical landmarks like Hagia sofia, blue mosque & Topkapi Museum.. I am not follower of modern art but loved the work there ...Actually it gives completeness to your Istanbul experience of visiting earlier places...just 15 min by taxi from Sultanahmet ...It is located exactly in the middle of Sultanahment & Ortakoy from where we took short Bosphorus tour at 14.50 so logistically also it worked out very well...Restaurant annexed to museum is bit pricey but really good.. service is quite professional & quick... will recommend anytime...
Worth a look. Really interesting and varied works. A beautiful water front position; spacious and beautiful building. Particularly good video installations.

Learn about Turkish history and art. Our only morning of rain in Istanbul found us heading for the Museum of Modern Art. What a great decision!After negotiating the flooded parking lot via pallets that had been thoughtfully placed by museum staff, we bought our tickets, checked our rain gear, and spent a morning browsing wonderful installations, paintings, photography and videos. Descriptions are in English and help to understand the art on display. Very enjoyable, kids would probably like it, too.

Worthwhile for fans of modern art. The ambition of Istanbul to be a great modern city is evident in this museum - and the shift from Ottoman culture in such a short space of time is striking. A variety of modern art styles and techniques is on display . Those who do not like modern art should avoid it - for those who do there is much to enjoy. Lunch on the terrace with panoramic Bosphorus views was a surprising bonus.
Well worth a visit. We decided to visit the Modern and were not disapointed.Nice calm setting on the banks of the river.Easy access by tram.Interesting short films and paintings by local artists.

Great experience. The museum building is very new, modern with clean lines and plenty of open space. Very good mix of paintings, sculptures, video and immersive experiences on the sprawling two floors of the museum. I was amazed at the talent and creativity of Turkish artists. The café - restaurant has a gorgeous view of the Bosporus and the old city, a stylish decor and exquisite meals. Highly recommended!

we really enjoyed this museum. I really enjoyed this museum I was really impressed with some of the artwork. They also had a few rooms with interesting videos. There's a nice restaurant, although it was a bit pricey,I recommend this museum, we really enjoyed it.

stumbled upon!. we had taken the tram and funicular to taskim square, for history's sake and then drifted down the steep streets and past a new soccer stadium being built. and past the dolmabahce palace, which was closed, being a Thursday, and walked along and stumbled upon the sign for Istanbul modern. I had read in fodor's guidebook that it was turkey's first museum of modern art, so in we went. I make myself go to art galleries and although I don't understand or appreciate abstract art, I go because I believe it's good for my brain to absorb such. a wide variety of art, however, what the bonus for me happened to be downstairs, which was an incredible photography exhibition. it was stunning. dealt with the many situations in turkey. tough pics and incredibly well done. I saw that there was a restaurant on site and I've found that most museums have good food however we decided to continue on strolling back to our hotel, our loss by the sound of other's comments! do go to this gallery/museum!

Get to know Modern Istanbul at Istanbul Modern. My wife and I visited Istanbul Modern on something of a whim and were treated to one of the highlights of our Istanbul holiday. Boasting a picturesque location on the shores of the Bosphorus and housed in a former warehouse, Istanbul Modern is well worth a visit. The permanent exhibition is small by international standards but it's meticulously curated. A focus on Turkish artists and perspectives allows for a fascinating insight into 20th century Turkish cultural history. I was especially moved by Kutluğ Ataman’s "Women Who Wear Wigs".Temporary exhibitions are housed downstairs. At the time we visited "On The Road: Images of Turkey from the Nar Photos Archive" was showing, an illuminating exhibition of photographs exploring multiple facets of contemporary Turkish urban and rural life. It’s running until November 9, 2014, check it out if you get the chance.Heads up, it’s closed on Mondays

Istanbul Modern. My partner keeps dragging me to see galleries and museums of modern art whenever we go overseas and while this is not really my idea of having a good time, I have to confess that I was very impressed by the collection of works on display at Istanbul Modern AND that I would happily have spent more time there if circumstances had been different.Another excellent reason for coming to this gallery of modern art is the excellent restaurant which deserves a strong recommendation even if you don't look at a single work of art in the building! The view over the Bosphorus is very pleasant and stimulating.Finally, I was amazed at how this wonderful institution is situated in such a drab industrial setting but I suppose that makes it an oasis of beauty!

Great artwork but stressful experience. We loved the exhibitions and artwork on display at the museum. Very interesting, thought provoking and original. We have visited several museums of modern art and this one had the most enjoyable displays for the entire family. Even my daughter who is 5 enjoyed some of the displays immensely. However, the atmosphere of the museum is quite stressful. Security guards follow you around constantly and because we have children I think we constantly had one or two of them within 5 feet of us. At one point I had to speak to one of them to let them know that I was keeping an eye on my children and didn't need to be followed around as I was finding it quite difficult to enjoy the art. I did see several others who touched artwork so I understand that there are issues there, however, a more discreet and less intense monitoring of the areas would be most welcome. There needs to be a balance between enjoying art and preserving it. Moreover the staff was quite rude and unfriendly. I think the administration needs to step in and fix this problem.

Really interesting art. We loved Istanbul Modern, some excellent works from modern artists we were not previously aware of. The museum is a lovely space to view art and the permanent exhibition is quite extensive. The temporary photographic exhibition was also very enjoyable. Drinks on the terrace overlooking the Bosphorus were delightful. Highly recommend the whole experience.

Inspirational. A great place for art lovers. Not on the Istanbul card but no fee for kids and students. Worth the fee. Contemporary art forms well displayed and good representation of artists. Nice Cafe. Unfortunately the cinema was closed at the time we were there. Check cinema time and then plan your trip. Best shop for sophisticated artistic and expensive souvenirs in Istanbul.

Istanbul Modern. If you have an extra couple of hours to kill and you are interested in Modern Art, then this is the place for you. If you have gone to Istanbul to see ancient sites and only have a few days, you may want to skip it. If it is super hot or raining it is a nice cool place to view modern and contemporary art.

great time away from tourists. This is a new art gallery with artwork shown mainly from Turkish artists. The gallery was well layed out and very quiet. It was nice to get away from the mass tourist sites. There is a restaurant in the gallery with a great view of the Bosphorus and the old city and fantastic food!

Must see!. A stunning and important gallery which is often overlooked by visitors who tend to gravitate to the historic sites. Gives an insight into the political and creative tensions in today's Turkey with an very high quality collection in an architecturally impressive building next to the cruise port. Not to be missed!

Surprisingly Good. This museum has an amazing collection of Turkish modern art, arranged by decade. There are explanations in English and if you know a bit of the history it's easy to see the progression. There are a lot of small rooms with art films…very strange stuff but fascinating! The restaurant is lovely but expensive.

Some excellent pieces but it felt a little on the small side. Worth the visit, there were some amazing pieces in there and of course some not so great pieces. The first floor was excellent but the ground floor/basement was really disappointing, there's pretty much nothing down there
is a must. if you are interested in Contemporary Art you should not miss it. Located at the Bosphorus an the European side, good architecture

Istanbul has also a Modern Museum. Istanbul Modern Museum location is great. Easy to reach, the old dock building was used for housing the museum. It has a big car park so there's no parking problem which is very important at Istanbul. The building is big and spacious. You can see all on the exhibit clearly and one by one so you can pay attention all the details. The museum has also a part for the children's activities which I think is a good touch. The exhibits change from time to time so it's a good idea to visit this museum on a continuous / periodical basis. The musuem has a small but tasty souvenir shop where I can always find something different. Also, there's a cafe & restaurant on the sea front side with a successfull menu and great panorama balcony looking towards the old city and the start of the Bosphorus strait. If there's a cruise ship, then unfortunately nothing to see but the walls and portholes of the ship. But if there's no ship at the dockyard then it's really a fantastic place for dinner looking towards the lightened Topkapı Palace after visiting the museum.

Nice modern art museum, oceanfront. If you have already visited all the main sites in Istanbul and you have some extra time, this is a good place to visit. It is 2 blocks away from the tram station. The entrance is not included in the museum pass (Muze pass). You can spend 1 hour visiting the exhibits. It is oceanfront so you have a great view from the terrace.

"Ace caff with quite a nice gallery attached". This advertising line for the V&A came to mind when we visited Istanbul's Modern Art museum. It is currently in an area being "redeveloped", but once inside it has all the ambience of being a modern, bright gallery with installations and exhibits that will appeal to a wide variety of visitors. In particular there was a temporary exhibition of contemporary photographs that appealed to me which gave a fascinating insight into Turkish life. However it's location on the coast gave it fabulous views and the restaurant offered us one of the best presented meals we had in the city. We were lucky enough to have timed our visit with that of a tall ship which added further interest to the view. We travelled from Old Town by taxi and it was £10 TL each way. The tram also goes that way and sails through the terrible traffic, but for four people is actually more expensive (4x3TL)
Yes!!. Good standard/long-term collection and good temporary/pop-up collections. Nice mix between paintings, pictures, film, and sculptures, etc

A treasure!. I loved this art museum, and gained a better understanding of the development of Turkish art. The temporary exhibitions were great, including a photographic gallery which was contemporary and fascinating. The permanent collection is well worth a visit, and I also enjoyed some of the video installations. The café/restaurant serves good food, and you are rewarded with one of the best views in Istanbul .........until a cruise ship comes up to park next door!

Contemporary Art Its Best. The contemporary art work on view was some of the best by European and Turkish artists. The museum space is open and airy. There were impressive videos and short films in various rooms throughout the galleries. The museum gives visitors to Istanbul a different perspective of the cultural scene of the city. There are certain picturesque windows that overlook the river.

Good permanent collection, fantastic temporary exhibitions. When living in Istanbul I went to Istanbul Modern probably once a month.The hustle and bustle of the city dies away when you're inside, and building is designed so as to subtly remind you that you're right next to the Bosphorus. The permanent collection covers 20th century Turkish art, whereas the temporary exhibitions range from painting to sculpture to fashion to video to [you name it]. The selection was always a very good one, focusing on Turkish artistic production, either nationally or overseas. Be sure to check their exhibitions online, as their catalogue is updated regularly. Entry was free on Thursdays.

Loved the Istanbul Modern Museum. Not quit what Istanbul is renowned for this was a bit of a change from all the classic sites. The museum is cozy, easy to cover in 2 hrs, and well designed. We liked a lot the selection of local modern art pieces and some of the videos that depicted rural life in the region. There was also a fantastic photo exhibit about Istanbul modern politics in contrast with its conservative roots. The building external views are not memorable and the access from the main road could definitely use a face lift BUT take some time to enjoy the cafeteria overlooking the Bosphorus.... just mesmerizing!

Extraordinary and innovative concept. We came by chance due to some rain, and were very impressed by the great selection of paintings and oeuvres, including Video installations that I usually to not like that much, the interior itself, it's worth visiting Istanbul Modern!

Excellent collection. This really is a fantastic collection of modern art which warrants at least half a day of exploring. Most (if not all) works are by Turkish artists and there are some fascinating and inspiring pieces to contemplate.I would say that a visit here makes a nice contrast in an itinerary heavy with historical sights, as most short trips to Istanbul are, so definitely come here to see another side of this multi-faceted city.

A real gem. Evocative and inspiring. I am so glad I made the effort to walk to this museum. I spent at least 4 hours exploring and absorbing the modern art. There was a real range from painting, photography, 3-d sculpture and performance art (film). I particularly like the art work reflecting the artists thoughts and explorations of Turkey and the journey it has made and is making. The historic influence of this wonderfully exciting and evocative country is being made a theme for some of the art. This was highly interesting to the outsider. I was there alone so could fully indulge my interest in the whole aspects of the museum. I was glad I had not missed it. The café afterwards served some lovely food and with such a view it was the perfect end to the perfect visit. Thank you Istanbul Modern.
Excellent modern art. A lot of effort has been put into this museum and it shows. The exhibitions are varied and worth checking out. Also some nice views from the balcony.

Once of the best museums!. One of the best museums I have been too. We had a rainy day and spent the afternoon here looking at the art and watching the movies they had on display. Very interesting something different to do in Istanbul. Great activity to fill a rainy day.

One of the best Modern Art museums around?. This really is a "must" for Istanbul. The exhibits are generally from Turkish artists or are Turkish themed. I am not a great mmuseum person but could easily have spent a whole day here. The exhibits are first class and very varied and the location is pretty inspiring as well. I'm sure a lot of visitors to Istanbul stick to the mainstream sights like Hagia Sophia, etc. but anyone with an interest in art should really visit this one.

Varied and worth it. While the museum houses mostly modern art, you are exposed to exhibits that reflect the cultural underpinnings of a variety of time periods in Turkey. Some exhibits were more typical oil paintings, but there were more modern video and 3D pieces as well. I found that I enjoyed listening to the headset as I browsed the floors, which is not always the case. The only drawback was that the headset only covered certain works. I could spend hours on the main floor alone, and downstairs, there were multiple other temporary exhibits. The museum is located on the water, so when you are finished or when you need a break, you can walk outside past the cafe and look out onto the water to both the Asian side of Istanbul and Sultanahmet.I spent several hours here and was not disappointed. I would have bought something from the gift shop, but I found that their most striking works were unavailable. The cafe also looked like it would be a nice place to dine, but I already had other dinner plans. The menu looked a little overpriced, but not more than anywhere else in the tourist areas.

Modern Art. We really enjoyed this museum, a change from all the ancient (also interesting) things in Istanbul. Being modern art it is also very topical and thought provoking especially for us from across the other side of the world!

You'll love it or hate it!. We visited this museum early on in our trip to Istanbul, because it came highly recommended in our guide book. I suspect this is one museum about which opinions will be deeply divided.In our case, we liked some - only a few - of the exhibits, and found others distinctly poor. Most of the exhibits have an explanatory notice beside them, giving biographical details of the artists, and the motivation which led them to execute the particular work. Many people will find these helpful; unfortunately, in my case, I found too many of them pretentious.There are a small number of late 19th century, early 20th century works by Turkish artists which may be out of place here, but these were the pieces I preferred.

Excellent. It is an amazing museum of modern art with a variety of artworks. My daughter aged 9years old told me it was the best place we visited in Istanbul. The view from the cafe restaurant was breathtaking and the sweets, delicious! The gift shop is also very interesting. I recommend visiting this museum laying on the banks of Bosphorus in Istanbul since you will love both the exhibits and the view.

Perfect museum to spend a day at. This is one of the best museums I've been to. You can spend a whole day here! Very good mix of installations and paintings. Me, myself, are not a big museum fan, but this is something worth a visit. When you get tired, take a coffee at the seemingly nice café facing the Bosphorus. The only thing that felt a bit awkward were the guards that never stood still in one spot and really watched the visitors. I'm not a villain, or maybe I am? were my feelings of this.

A Lot to see and Enjoy. A broad selection of modern art that helps prepare a visitor to Turkey on its culture. Well organized with descriptions of art and artist in English and Turkish. The café within the museum is located on the Bosphorus and the outside seating is a great place for coffee or lunch.A nice and informative starting point for a visit to Istambul.

Small Intriguing Museum. The museum was interesting located by the sea. The art exhibits by different Turkish artists was either thought provoking, weird, or beautiful. There were several rooms that played odd videos about topics such as wearing wigs, bordellos, and some other silly short videos that can be viewed through the museum such as 'man who was cold and fart quilts' which was funny. Like any other museum it was well laid out. The highlight of my visit was actually the restaurant. It was the most quickest and delicious meal I ever had in a museum setting.

Enriching. No discounts even with museum pass. YTL 17 per ticket.
Exhibits from Turkish artists. Gives view into the different schools of Turkish art.
More inspired by west than east.
Includes video exhibits and cinema.
Photography not allowed.
Pricey souvenir shop with intriguing items.

a way to know modern Turkey. NOT hard to get to (use the Gulhane stop off the T1 tram - follow the big red signs... not hard at all). NOT free for over 65 (maybe if you're Turkish...).Wonderful introduction to what Turkish artists especially - tho' not exclusively - have been doing for the past several decades. We particularly "enjoyed" videos about women's issues in Turkeys, as well as art highlighting women's perspectives - by men and women. Great location on the industrial (or formerly industrial) waterfront with lovely views.

Nice but Do Not Go Out of Your Way. We stayed at the lovely Karakoy Port Hotel, which right next to the Modern museum. We decided to visit it in the morning before our flight and we are glad that we did. It is a small museum with a limited selection of modern Turkish art. Although we enjoyed our visit, I would not include this site in the must see list unless you are in the area with free time to spare.

Modern art with a view. Modern art certainly is not everyone's cup of tea and Istanbul Modern might disappoint some visitors who walked in accidentally or did not know what to expect. The museum looks very much like those of its kind in some European capitals; here the focus is on local artists, thus demonstrating part of contemporary Tukrey's culture. But no matter how you feel about modern (Turkish) art, you will definitely enjoy the breathtaking view from the museum's cafe terrace towards the Bosphorus, Topkapi and Hagia Sophia!
Cafe is recommended. The building of this museum is not small, but the collection deplayed is not so much. We loved its cafe viewing Topkapi Palace and Asian side. It's worth to go for the cafe.

Was pleasantly surprised by a great modern art musuem on the Bosphorus. This is not a museum of world modern art. It is a museum of Turkish modern and complementary art which is quite good. The museum is right on the Bosphorus and has great views along with a great restaurant.

Visit & eat at restaurant. We happened upon the museum while walking about. It was a nice coincidence as we were hungry and the museum has a great waterfront restaurant. It is free to visit on Thursdays.

A bit disappointed. We were expecting a world class Art Gallery, but were somewhat disappointed. All the works were by Turkish Artists, no International works whatsoever.The building looks generally tired and is not in very good upkeep.The area surrounding the Gallery was under construction, so it took a while for us to find the building entrance.Worth a visit on a rainy day...

Interesting even if you don't care for art-too hard to get to though. We visited IM today. The prices were not too bad and children under 12 and those over 65 get in free. The art is really eye catching and there are video exhibitions as well as paintings, sculptures and photography. There are iPads everywhere for you to use. I noticed on the safari app that the recent history included Nike, Facebook and YouTube. Some people must have been really bored! Some of the art is not for everyone but I would say most people would find something they liked in there. I for one liked the stairway to hell. The view is great. The cafe is decent too and our drinks came promptly despite being quite complicated. We didn't get any food. We did have a problem getting there though. The signs directed us to what looked like a car park so we walked around a bit. We found a strawberry on the ground but we couldn't find the art gallery. Eventually we went back to the car park and there it was in the corner.

My favorite part of my Istanbul visit. I love visiting art museums and this is one of my favorites. I've read Istanbul Modern is in the top 10 in the world for Modern Art, and I couldn't agree more. This was the highlight of my trip to Istanbul!

Surprising display of Turkish modern art. Especially the permanent exhibition of modern Turkish art from about 1860 till now appealed to me. Some amazing application of "carpet-weaving" techniques are shown in the form of patchwork and industrial weaving. The temporary exhibitions were a bit disappointing, but as a whole this museum is a highlight in this dazzling city. The restaurant/cafe has a wonderful view over the Bosporus.

Go! It is 2014.. If you only have time to visit one museum in Istanbul, come to this one. The exhibits and artists (many of them still alive and actively working) deserve your attention. Because of copyright issues, you can't take pictures inside. You can buy postcards from the reasonably-priced gift shop. I didn't eat at the restaurant, but the view was fantastic.

How to understand modern turkey. A great contrast to the antiquities Fabulous spacious displays. Great range of art installation video photo. Thought provoking. As good as modern art galleries in london paris madrid Edinburgh. The restaurant and setting beside the Bosphorous adds to the spectacular experience. Walking distance from museum of innocence orhan pamuk to further understand modern turkish culture. Our visit to Istanbul would not have been complete without this experience.

Inspiring. Ours was a group visit - 50 students aged 11 - 15 and 9 adults. The students all loved this attraction and would have been happy to spend a bit more time there. Security presence was high and guards followed the students around but this was not an issue as the students were interested and realised the value of the exhibits.
Great building, ok collections. The building is beautiful and the location is fabulous. The collections are nicely displayed and of various levels of interest.
Great museum with a beautiful view. Great museum in the historic kabatas area with a beautiful view. A must see in istanbul for art lovers

Something new among the old... When you tire of all the historic monuments, Istanbul Modern provides a glimpse of young, trendy and happening Turkey. Located in the old warehouse district on the water side, the museum is architecturally interesting and the collection is a real surprise. Turkish artists ...painters, sculptors, film producers, printers are all showcased in exhibits that are well displayed with excellent and informative explanations. The museum. Is really outstanding...think Tate Modern without the crowds. The museum restaurant with a large waterfront balcony and indoor seating is also excellent.

Wonderful exhibition, and food!. The mordern works by Turkish artists are fascinating. The whole museum itself is appealing as well. However, another unexpected spot is the restaurant inside. Great food, great European & Asian view towards the sea, you also will not regret ordering the delicius dessert. Wonderful afternoon there!

So nice and interesting!. Istanbul Modern is lokated in perfect place, near Tophane tramway station and very close to Kabatas.Exposition is very interesting, it was very nice to know a lot perfect turkish painters and artists....i was spend some hours there, and after i could get nice coffee at terrace of museum. Of course, i could not take photos of arts objects there, but i took some photos of interior....My advice to all travellers, to visit this wonderful museum!

Art Heaven. It's the only place I feel like in art heaven all the time. Located in a great bosphorus place and you can spend your whole day there. They have a very nice restaurant for lunch and dinner. Very big place and there is not only one exhibition you chance many options to visit. One if my favourite in Europe!
Great turkish modern art. What a great not very big museum of modern art, if you are interested in modern art, it is a must to visit it

COOL!!. Located in Karakoy...a artsy area of Istanbul...
Love the building and the eye catching art and sculptures..

great place!. I really like this place! Its a bit hard to find, next to a mosque and looks like a factory. But the collections are really good and has lots of short films. I especially love their temporary exhibition space, which is downstairs. You can view the Bosphorus from the museum

Skip It. On my second attempt at seeing this museum I was shaking in my boots from a really scary taxi driver who ripped me off and was so notorious he wouldn't even enter the parking lot...!Any way I pretty much agree with the couple from Moscow: this museum falls terribly short on nearly every aspect. The quality, range and depth is very poor. I have a feeling that this really is a product of Turkey and as such there is a definite cultural problem which puts the whole project way behind what conemporary art is in the West or some such difficulty in finding it's identity in the world of art.Poorly conceived poorly curated and poorly administered...
great. we've visited with istanbulairportcar.com and private guide, realy good place, very modern art galery.
Collection Not That Great.. Almost all Turkish artists and really this is not a world-class museum. Some of the pieces were nice but I have seen better in smaller cities.

Boring and small. With this grand name I expected much more. The largish building has a collection of works on the first floor, but the basement with temporary collections has about enough to fill 10 minutes. Very disappointing, expecially for 17 Lira!!! The restaurant has fabulous views but the staff are beyond rude, the food is beautiful and tasteless and the prices are undeservedly high.
Very Interesting. Loved the exhibitions..all quite unique. The restaurant also has a great view back to the old town and of the Bosphorus.

An excellently compiled quick overview. Great location by the water, great collection spanning the past near 100 years of turkish art. For us it was a fairly wide ranging and very useful introduction to modern art in Turkey.

Nice museum, stupid staff. A small museum with not too bad collection of contemporary artists. The only problem we had was that the staff are not very friendly and gave me a hard time regarding my shoe bag that was on my back. They demanded that this little bag will stay at the cloack room while everyone else were in holding their massive bags on their hand. Also you can not take photos of the exhibitions. Why? No one knows.

A must see. If you like modern art! On par with any major city in the world except missing those famous, recognizable names but who cares when the pieces are fascinating and thought provoking. Also, within walking distance to the port where my cruise ship was docked.

Loved it. I love this museaumn because different than other ones in Istanbul. Itsi right on the water and I thought the art selected was riviting and worth my time. I will definitely go back on another trip to spend more time exploring the different exhibits.

an place to visit. a museum intensely pleasurable to walk through, The exhibits at that time were splendid. I felt a strong urge to make pics of some art work but could not however many tourists with camera phones managed to sneak in some discreet pics

Don't miss their Restaurant terrace!!!!!. It was great to see some master pieces from Turkish artits, and to see how the country promotes Art generally speaking.The Restaurant of the Museum is really pleasant: Nice view on the Bosphorus river.Note: If they propose some wine, ask for the price first! We felt ripped off as our 2 glasses of wine were much more expensive than our meal; and even much more expensive than wine at the Miklar Restaurant!
Great setting. The museum is smaller than I had expected but I enjoyed the "past and present" show--as well as the excellent photography exhibit when I was there.

Great Selection. This museum is very unique when compared to all the history located in the mosques and historical places in Istanbul.It gives the flavor of the modern art been developed in Istanbul and the recognition that is given to local artists. We had i guided tour at night that took almost an hour and we enjoyed all the different rooms and impressive collection.

Waterside Location Musuem --Lovely. I went here one evening just before closing hours. It's a spacious museum that is intensely pleasurable to walk through, The exhibits at that time were splendid. I felt a strong urge to make pics of some art work but could not however many tourists with camera phones managed to sneak in some discreet pics. Afterwards, I spend some time in the outer compound of the museum which has very beautiful sea views.. A chilly spellbinding evening.Very recommended!
Amazig works. We spent the whole afternoon here. I am not much of an art expert but you could spend the whole day. It has some amazing works

Beautiful artwork. I was very impressed with the collection--fresh and vibrant. Very different from anything I've seen before.Very beautiful, mostly Turkish artists I believe. Also, it is not too big so it is not overwhelming. A must see for artists and art enthusiasts! Also, a good option for those who prefer to stay away from the hectic touristy sites.Also, beautiful terrace on the water with a beautiful view of the Bosporus and Sultanahmet.

Amazing, inspirational, as if you are in another world. Istanbul Modern is an absolute must see for anybody who might be just a little bit interested in art - and of course for the art lovers under us. The museum provides contemporary art and they change their exhibitions often. The exhibition which they have offer and which I saw is called "Past and Future" and is absolutely breathtaking.They state: Istanbul Modern’s new exhibition draws from its permanent collection to highlight the historical link to the past that art museums establish as sites of memory, and their role in shaping the future by their commitment to collecting and preserving works of art. This exhibition is very diverse according to me and a big inspiration. It is worth the entrance fee and also a few hours from your day.

Up with the times. There is a great variety of works here. Some are really quite exciting in both execution and in the texture of their reference to the culture of Istanbul, such as the volcanic representation of destruction by fire of Ottoman houses captured in pvc mosaics. Others update tropes of Western art, such as the bathing nudes squiggled in repeated wallpaper-like fashion, or another that uses the bathing nude to pose the question of voyeurism in the context of the orientalist view of Turkish women's sexuality represented by ideas of the harem. Still others are more abstract and universal, such as one composition of mirrors artfully arranged to both to limit and liberate the viewer's vista. A lot of the works currently on show - including several video-based installations - assert women's sexuality against a background identified as repressive paternalism and identifiable if one wishes with the most conservative elements in Turkey's current ruling élite. The appeal of these works will perhaps depend on one's interest in and commitment to women's struggle for parity in modern Turkish society; but there is something here for everyone interested in contemporary art. The collection changes frequently (my wife was told some works she'd particularly liked on her last visit two years ago had moved on), and there is something for everyone, but you'll like it best if you're genuinely interested in the Istanbul and Turkish angle on contemporary ways of seeing. And one way of seeing we found difficult to manage was the view of the Bosphorus, as it was largely blocked by a gargantuan cruise ship tied up at the berth below. Recommended - but don't pay just to see the view!

Breathtaking location. This museum is a little off the beaten path but a must see. The architecture and location on the Bosphorous are stunning. The art is contemporary and very good and the dining room is spectacular for coffee or a full meal. This was our favorite museum in Istanbul and worth a few hours.

Lots to see, well worth the entrance fee. Great introduction to contemporary Turkish art, with detailed English descriptions. Took my time wandering around and, before I knew it, 2.5 hours had passed. No photos allowed. Grab a tea and sit in the museum's outdoor cafe after your visit -- there's a terrific view of the water. (Food is pricey, though.)

They need to scale down the security presence. There is some interesting modern art to see at this museum. They also have a cinema where we saw a silent Hitchcock film, accompanies by a live pianist. The film is included in the price of admission. A nice afternoon activity. However, I was very uncomfortable with the aggressive security presence at the museum. They seem to be very anxious about guests taking photographs, so much that I had my own security guard stalker following my every move, staring me down while I tried to enjoy the art. It's really obnoxious. Also, they will accost you if you do not wear the red sticker they give you at the entrance (I suppose to keep restaurant customers from visiting the museum without paying), but the stickers don't stick and are constantly falling off. This museum is beautiful but I cannot say that I felt welcome there. The cinema is an enjoyable experience which is why I gave it an average rating. If you aren't bothered by security guards in your face every minute, glaring at you and waiting for you to do something forbidden, then go for it.

Competitive with museums of modern art!. I've seen most of the major modern art museums, although I am not a connoisseur. I was skeptical that this one would measure up. I was wrong. It is a fantastic collection, slightly different interpretation of "modern" but stunning delivery and presentation.The building is perfect, glistening in the sun off the Bosphorus; good light in the galleries. Mostly Turkish, but also international representation. Where else is there such a wonderful display of the great talent of Turkey? And, the descriptions educate all of us in ways we need. Certainly me.Great restaurant. My only complaint? CRUISE ships dock on the outside sometimes. Ugh.But, don't miss it. Short walk from the Tophane tram stop in Karakoy.

interesting museum. The museum is closely located to Istiklal - just take a short cut; very interesting first floor, with mostly Turkish artists, I've spent more than an hour there. A very beautiful view from the restaurant. The guards are quite rough, and unwelcoming.

Modern Art in a fabulous setting. A short walk from the Tophane tram stop, the Modern Art Museum is set on the waterfront, and has a good selection of modern Turkish art, from the nineteenth century to the present day, including a large retrospective of the work of Erol Akyavas. There are some wacky installations, especially the short films by artists in side cubicles. After a leisurely stroll around, you can have lunch in the waterside terrace restaurant, with beautiful views over the Bosphorus. Entry is TL10, or TL8 for the elderly.

Best Positioned Restaurant in Istanbul?. After visiting the amazing exhibition we sat down for lunch in what must be one of the most beautiful settings for a restaurant- on the waterfront (provided no large passenger liners dock in front of restaurant)- and good quality food. What a way to end our visit to stunning art like this.

Great space and very interesting modern art.. We had an extra hour to wander in IST and were very pleased we did so at this great museum. Located in an older industrial type building (reminded me of a smaller Tate Modern) with an superb collection of modern Turkish art. Well worth the visit.
One of the best parts of the trip. The Istanbul Modern Art Museum is a gem. We could barely tear ourselves away. We spent 2-3 hours. The Erol Akyavas - Retrospective was fabulous.
Excellent. Loved the art, must visit to enjoy the library full of art books. they had some interesting art and booth with clips playing..
modern museum.. in historical city. I didnot expect such a good museum not being so old.. make sure to have 1-2 hours for this beautiful museum..

A modern museum for all. This museum has art in several forms. Paintings, mobiles, scuptures, and even video. If art can be said to be entertaining to the masses, then this must be it. The art museum has a very nice full menu, large restaurant on the second level. We combined this with a climb to the Galata tower.

World class. This gallery was excellent. Full of really interesting Turkish pieces, I could have spent double the amount of time here. I had only 1.5 hours, but you should budget at least 2. There are two floors with lots of gallery rooms and don't miss the hallway to the library with all of the suspended books. They have a nice gift shop and a cafe where you can rest with coffee and a meal. There is a train station just outside where you can catch the train back to Sultanahmet or wherever you are staying. Enjoy!

beautiful museum. Wonderful and thought provoking art pieces! Great library with artful book display and the restaurant offers lovely views. The "young artists" building was not open the day we went, I would love to have seen what is in there. The grounds are great for kids to burn off some steam, too!

Great Art Museum. I visited the museum on my own while my husband was in a meeting. We always try to visit an art museum while traveling and this one did not disappoint. Close to public transport and very progressive. Just the right size - I think I spent 3 hours there.Had lunch in their restaurant - excellent homemade pasta.

We only did the Restaurant but it looked cool!. Strange location - right next to the cruise ship terminal - and we walked past it a couple of times before finding the odd entrance.The museum looked open (even though it was 7pm) so check the opening hours.I've reviewed the restaurant separately but from the glimpses we got of the artwork it looks worthy of a visit.

The museum is great for modern art enthusiasts, and for are lovers in general. . Its location is convenient.  The restaurant looks great but should be said it is fancy and expensive in Istanbul level. Too bad there isn’t a medium level cafeteria to have refreshment in the middle of the visit. cost me 15 TL (that is the full price)

A fine museum. After the rush and crush of museums in Sultanahmet the Istanbul Modern was a pleasant break. Good quality displays of selected contemporary Turkish and international art, alongside early modern works from Turkey. Easy to reach with a walk from the tram.
worth a look. Not in the old city, but worth a look as it illustrates through art, the modern crossroads that is Turkish culture. Nice little shop also.

Modern Art for a Nice Change of Pace. We really enjoyed this spacious museum and found the chance to see contemporary Turkish art a welcome change from mosques and antiquities. Also away from the crowds, a peaceful and spacious interior setting for nicely displayed and signed artwork. I was pleased to see a neon sign piece that had been featured in a travel magazine article .  The location near the cruise ship harbor is a bit hidden from the main street ard directions not well signed, but we persisted through a square of seedy bar./cafes for hookah smoking (think handy to day trippers off the cruise ships) through a warehouse passageway and found it. Worth the hunt.I also recommend the cafe in the museum for very good food served attractively by an efficient waitstaff. The only negative was having the view blocked by a mammoth cruise ship outside the restuarant window .

Modern. This new structure gave you the idea of how wealthy some familes in Turkey can be most of the item's were from one family and their private collection the garden's were being remodled but what was there was nice.

REEKS WITH ENERGY- A MUST TO EXPERIENCE. This museum pulses with modern energy. If you have been impressed with Istanbul history, this will blow you away with today's art scene. It gives you perspective as to how modern Istanbul ticks, artistically. Don't miss the Biennial next to it. Wow!

Nice Contrast To Chora Church. Many modern art items on display in a airy modern building. It all come down to personal taste.The food in the cafe is supposed to be excellent.Some of the "highlight"or low lights (depending on your taste) were:Multiple pairs of shoes strapped to a display wall, but hey, they were lined up very neatly.3 garbage can covers or inverted satellite dishes painted black and bolted to a wall.A movies with 4 simultaneous movies with dialogue running at the same time making it impossible to understand any of them. Lots of freakish paintings where the topic or items were unfathomable, which you will not mistaken for a Vermeer. My favorites were: A large shark made out of woven basket type material, visible only from a distance at the far end of the room; what looked like a lit writhing mass of trees displayed on a wail (you have to see it), many painted ping pong balls attached to the ceiling configured into an odd shape, and a movie showing (I think) some women unwittingly left in a building under demolition. I'm sure you can find something you would consider cool here..

Really good museum. The museum is full of excellent contemporary art, mostly Turkish, with some thought provoking video installations. It is a great counterpart to traditional Istanbul, The cafe overlooks the Bosphorous and has a terrace. It serves really good, reasonably priced food.

Interesting Gallery. This a museum of Modern Art. It has some interesting pieces and some very thought provoking works. I enjoyed the museum but it may not be to everyone's taste. We went on a Thursday evening. It stays open until 20h00 on Thursdays. As mentioned by other reviewers some of the multimedia works are unusual and thought provoking. If you like art its well worth the visit

Nice, diffrent. Unique exhibits and videos. A little expensive for what you see / experience in my opinion but cool different art and nice view from back balcony. Also note that when its time to close they close, no exceptions. We practically had the doors closed on us and had to leave out of the back restaurant exit!

Great restaurant and excellent museum. We went twice - and both times to the excellent restaurant. The museum is really excellent. The views across the Bosphorus are magnificent, though you may not get the benefit. On our second visit one of those vast cruise ships was moored along the water's edge so all we could see was twenty-odd storeys of cabins for 200-odd meters! Truly ghastly. And to think that these things are allowed into Venice...it makes me weep to imagine it. Still, Istanbul Modern is wonderful. If you're into art, do not miss it.

Plenty to see, very interesting. A very well presented museum with various forms of displays to appreciate. The crepe with banana and chocolate tastes better but it is 17 lira while a small glass of tea is 6 lira. Not sure we were eating the food or the harbour views.

Good to visit. If you are Istanbul and have some time this is a nice museum to visit. You can spend a few hours or all day here. I particularly like the photography exhibit. If you are looking for old, this isn’t the place as it fits its name, “Modern”. An added bonus is the terrace restaurant overlooking the Bosphorous River. While this may not be the best museum you’ll ever visit, it is worth the trip if you are in Istanbul.

Perfect for lunch. The museum is pretty good, especially the videos, which were compelling. The highlight of the museum is the restaurant directly on the Bosphorous. The view is fabulous and the food is great. It is a perfect setting. We went on a rainy day and it was a perfect way to spend a couple of hours.

One of the best spots to visit in Istanbul. This museum houses an amazing collection of art works, some great video pieces, and a wonderful library. There's a great cafe/bar with fantastic views of the Bosphorus...and lovely garden grounds to walk on outside. A nice juxtaposition with all of the pieces of history so close by!

MUSTAFFA KEMAL ATTURKS GRAND VISION. An extremely well organised well maintained and really informative collection of historical value geatest thing is the videos there where the locals are educated in good living and to shun old prejudices a marvel in an islamic country hats off to KEMAL worth spending 3hours a must in istanbul

Cool place. This place is a big contrast with all the other historical places in Istanbul. The museum has a large collection of contemporary art that kind of reminded my of the Metropolitan museum form back home. But with all that they also have historical stuff from the past century. The whole place can be seen in around an hour after which a visit to the museum café can bring the tour to a fitting end. They have good coffee and some nice soufflé. Certainly worth the trip.

nice. if you are into modern artists and videothings, then this is just what you have to visit. It is a reasonable big museum (pictures not allowed inside!); the prices in the bar are a bit overpriced.

Very good Modern art museum with focus on Turkish art. Very good gallery (once you find it which can be difficult as it's tucked away near where the cruise ships dock ) - Very good turkish modern art & exhibitions - a large space

Well worth a visit. If you have a few days in Istanbul, and have seen your share of mosques, Ottoman art and carpet sellers, then this is a nice diversion. It has a great collection of modern and contemporary Turkish artists. It provides an interesting insight into the cultural changes and modernisation that has occurred in Turkey over the last 100 years. It is in a recently renovated warehouse on the water (actually seems to be next to the cruise ship terminal). As well as interesting art it provides a quiet retreat from the crowds in the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and Grand Bizzare.

Vibrant Museum. I have now visited the museum twice and am thoroughly impressed by the ever changing exhibitions. Very dynamic style. I think it is a must see in Istanbul.Also really nice, but expensive, cafe.

So-so.. I was surprised to see that the collection is still rather small, and not as interesting as I thought it would be.The large cruise boats park next to the restaurant, so save your money and eat elsewhere.
Depends on the exposition. But as the modern art in Turkey is moving fast, it is worthwhile to see what is going on. Location is a bit out of everything, but still easy to reach by tram.

Istanbul Modern. This museum was one of the highlights of my time in Istanbul. It had many outstanding art works, complex and moving videos interspersed throughout and an outstanding (albeit expensive) cafe. Loved the museum.

little known gem. This should be on the 'must do' list of Istanbul. It tracks early art in Istanbul in relation to what was happening in Paris and has great contributions from new up an coming artists
A Must. Brilliant space, fascinating to see how Turkish art has developed from the Ataturk era, with a high proportion of female artists' works on display.

Outstanding exposition. i loved the place, the exposition, the roof of the books suspended.
The different art forms (video, paintings, photos, etc)
