Excellent, very interesting and great restaurant. Extremely interesting museum, great view on the Bosphorus, an amazing restaurant, and lots of things to see and activities for children too. An extremely well designed museum with excellent explanations in English and very nice staff. A must see if you want to move away from the historical Istanbul and see what contemporary Turkish artists are up to. Really a great place.

A modern museum in an old city. It is a very interesting museum to visit. It includes works by Turkish artists and some others, it has a wonderful gift shop and an even better cafe. I tried them all!! Do not miss them. Don't forget to visit base ment where the ceiling is decorated with books in a very interesting way...

A melange of old and new. This museum is housed in old shore-side warehouses and exhibits a timeline of modern (20th century) art in Turkey. In addition to the artworks belonging to the course of modern art in the country, exhibitons of new work by international artists are also shown. Every two years (odd years), this is also a venue of the Istanbul Biennale.To get to Istanbul Modern, the cheapest way after walking is to take the tramway. The museum is between the Findikli and Tophane stations of the T1 line (nearer to Tophane). I advise that visitors near to Taksim take the funicular to Kabatas station and walk the way (circa 20 minutes) and take in the view. the entrance fee as of August 2013 was 15TL for ordinary people like me. There are discounts for students, juveniles and Turkish citizens.If you go there, do not miss the view from the South windows... they offer a beautiful view of the Bosphorus.

Pleasant surprise. After being for three days in the city and seeing all the major attractions and monuments, the Istanbul Modern Museum was a very pleasant surprise! Very innovative, interesting, smart and with some truly interesting videos and installations, it really shows the modern face of Turkey. The cafe - restaurant facing the Bosporus is a real bonus.

Nice place for art/photo lovers. The museum is bigger than we expected and quite nice. They have a large number of documentary/multimedia installations and that made us very happy. The photography exhibit "Close Quarters" was nice too but those keep changing. The permanent exhibit on the first floor is intriguing. Photography isn't permitted and we found the audio guide was quite useless as it keeps droning on about where the artists got their degrees from and nothing on the actual works of art you're looking at. Our visit took about 1 and half hour.

Nice. It's a nice building with powerful air-conditioning and great video installations:) Exhibits are nice but not very special if you are not an expert in modern art. It has no buffet but a very posh restaurant with gorgeous view at the waterfront, but sometimes ocean-liners dock there blocking the view.

Impressive. The Istanbul Modern has a great location, just off the tramway at Tophane, and right on the waterfront. There is a large collection of mostly Turkish modern art, with paintings, sculptures and film all well represented. The restaurant is very nice and with good service, although expensive.

no need to worry about museum fatigue here. This was my second visit and even though they do have a permanent collection, they do change the exhibits. The current exhibit was titled "Past and Future" and featured works from the permanent collection chronicling art from the mid-1800's to contemporary Turkish art and how the Turkish artists re-interpreted and reacted to the art movements and trends in Europe. Wonderful show. There is always a temporary exhibit focusing on living artist(s) as well. And it is a cool building.
Where the islam meet the christianity. A unique place to feel the complexity that is/was Istambul, a place were we can understand too very diferent cultures living side by side.

cool. Istanbul Modern is the first and only modern art museum in Istanbul. It opened in 2004 and is home to modern Turkish artists and Istanbul fashion week. It is a great space with a delicious restaurant and beautiful view of the river.
Bar is too bad respect attention. You feel that you should not sit moré than 25 mens. They Clean the table And look at you !!!!! The view is good but trendy place brings stupid clients.
Great gallery. Artists I did not know, impressive list of female artists and very challenging works on subject of women's rights.

Definitely Worth Visiting. I thought the Istanbul Modern museum was a good stop, definitely worth visiting. For a city that has been around for over 1000 years, this museum gives a completely different picture of Istanbul. I would definitely recommend a visit.

a great museum for those who aren't into museums. Highly recommend a visit, it reflects a Turkey that is both modern, secular and to some extent ancient and Islamic. Great way to spend 2 hours and a nice view of the Bosphorus from the cafe.

Wonderful Experience. Spacious, clean, aesthetic museum with wonderful collection and exhibition. There's also a wonderful terrance cafe/bistro with great view to the city. A hidden gem in Istanbul. Friendly staff.

Not the best museum of the city..... I'm not crazy about Modern art but I tried.... There are some nice pieces of art and a view on Sultanahmet. You can find a restaurant inside. but there are better museums than this one in Istanbul....

Make sure you spare some time to this Museum!. Istanbul Modern is a must visit place if you are new to town or even if you are just passing by. The collections are impressive and you wouldn't be able to have such a mixture in any other museum in Istanbul. Enjoy a nice lunch or afternoon snack in the restaurant as it feels good to be sitting right beside the water, that is, of course, if your view is not blocked by the huge cruise ships docking.

A nice way to spend an afternoon. Really interesting and diverse art pieces from mostly Turkish artists. Many unique mediums such as film, photography, paintings, sculptures, etc. It's not too expensive and you can browse the galleries at your own pace. After you've seen all the major tourist attractions, take some time to walk through this museum, it has a good view of the water too.

Stunning reflection of Turkish modern art. The Istanbul Modern is an extremely interesting gallery that showcases the best of Turkish Modern art. When we were there they had a retrospective from the 1850's to present day: extremely well curated, taking you on a journey through all the phases and influences of modern Turkish art.Also visit the downstairs gallery that has more revolving exhibitions and explains some of the other projects and the development of the museum.Apparently the cafe is also highly recommended, although we did not stop there.
Surprising. A nice diversion even if you don't like modern art. My only "complaint" is the prohibition on photography and the lack of available postcards of the much of the art.

Good but need more information. There was a great collection of paintings but didn't think much of the video installations. There was a installation performance on whilst there but no information (at least in English) so would of been nice to have some context to what we were watching. ALSO stumbled upon a FREE shuttle bus from Topkapi palace outside archeology museum which saved the taxi ride which was great. There is return shuttles but last one seemed to be at 4 so too early for us. The cafe was very nice and great deck overlooking Bosphorus but quite busy and bit pricey but hey it was peak season. Well worth a look

Excellent Modern Art Museum.. We really enjoyed this museum. It has some very interesting and beautiful pieces with great information about the artists. There is a great balance of local and international artists. I think this is one of the best modern art museums I have visited and would recommend it highly.

One of the Best modern Art Museums in Europe. Every year when we visit Istanbul, we pay a visit to Istanbul Modern and everytime we are very pleased. This year was not different. Some of the pieces on exhibition was very interesting. Looking into The old city and the harbor, the restaurant of the museum has one of the best views as well as good food. Eventually one can enter the restaurant without entering the Museum. For us the best method for transport was the taxi.

Great introduction to the history of Turkish modern art. The Istanbul modern, located on the docks at the foot of Beyoglu, is a nice introduction to the spectrum of modern artists in Turkey, highlighted by a permanent exhibit installed chronologically. The exhibit focuses on paintings and video -- other media formats are lightly handled. But the video exhibits are contemporary and thought-provoking, and the selection of paintings is consistently good. The narratives for each installation are helpful and well-written.The temporary exhibits, especially those on the lower level, had eye-candy appeal, but did not touch the same intellectual nerve as those in the permanent wing. Still, for the entrance price, they were worth the wander, and I am sure these will only improve as the museum's efforts grow.Suggestion: If you're in Istanbul in the summer, save the museum for an afternoon trip. You'll appreciate the air conditioning, and the easy pace of the atmosphere. A nice respite from the city outside.

Turkish art at its best. Very easy to reach by tram (Tram stop Tophane). A place to relax. Some exhibits were very interesting, the others less but all in all it is one of the contemporary and modern art museums that every European capital or large city intends to have. Nice restaurant/café with the view over Fatih and the Asian part of the city (certainty if there if there is no cruise ship blocking in the view).

Good modern art gallery. Nice location, easy to get to (take the tram to stop Tophane). Selection was hit and miss for us. We saw the Past and Future exhibition and were introduced to some excellent 20th century Turkish artists such as Burhan Dogancay and the 1914 generation. The exhibits downstairs weren't great. Learned about taxidermy though through a surprisingly interesting video (still not sure if it was a video installation on taxidermy or just a movie from the museum). Worth a detour if you like art and would like to see something different (and particularly if you like taxidermy videos).

Always stimulating. Visited Istanbul Modern for a third time this year and truely enjoyed it once again. This time I went there, there were Egyptian naval officers visiting the museum and me and my friends had a chance to chat with the soldiers. Looking back now, I realise that that was just before things started again in Egypt. Anyways, Istanbul Modern is a great place with always new comtemporary art to show. 2 thumbs up, 5 stars!

The Modern Museum on the Bosphorus in İstanbul. The Modern Museum is located at the beginning of the Bosphorus and close to the old city and easy to move around. It has temporary and permanent exhibition halls art area ,arts library, a shop that combines design with art and its cafe and restaurant that offers its visitors a fantastic view of Istanbul. Curating is well done presentations of modern art by Turkish artists and paintings. The cafe has a view of Topkapi Palace, Haghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque and Asian side is visible.I recommend this museum to everyone. Do not miss it!

Need at least 3-4hours to see and watch the videos definitely worth to see.. It helps to break the prejudices about religion,can give wider clues and approaches to the social dimensions of Turkish society,helps to travel in history concerning art,beautiful view on Bosphorus,also highly recommend to eat in its restaurant.

Classy. Now this is the type of museum me and my family likes to visit. Definitely 5 stars. I especially recommend the exploring exhibitions showcased on the lower floor and then enjoying the beautiful view from the restaurant while sipping on your coffee.

Relaxing way to spend a morning in Istanbul. After 2 days of hector touring led by a guide, we decided to relax for the morning with a stroll through Istanbul Modern. We especially enjoyed the permanent collection on the main floor, notably the video installations. Each piece had a detailed written description, in both Turkish and English, posted on the wall next to it. The terrace restaurant overlooking the mouth of the Golden Horn was an excellent spot for long lunch. (Be sure to reserve your table ahead of time as it fills up at lunch.) The panoramic view of Old Town and the Bosphorous made it a great spot of photos.

Modern Restaurant as Well. I thought this would be a fun family day. My husband and I wanted to see the museum and there happens to be a great kids program each day. Well the kid went the "Future Architects" program, which happens to be in turkish, but our kids fit in fine. We though during that time we would see part of the museum. Instead we went to the restaurant that overlooks the water and enjoyed a quite lunch. Great atmosphere.

Great energy, stimulating atmoshphere. I was lucky fortunate enough to visit Istanbul for a third time this year and I finally got around to visit Istanbul Modern. As a comtemporary art lover, I must say I was stupid not to have visited it before as it really left a great impression on me and my husband.

Excellent art museum!. Gorgeous museum setting on the Bosphorus with a lot of interesting, contemporary, mostly Turkish art. It's big and well worth going to. Also had one of my best Istanbul meals in the museum cafe.Only wish that they would let visitors use cameras! I'd like to remember and refer to some of the art I saw there.

Critical insight view of Turkish culture and society. Very modern contributions of Turkish and other artists reflecting their society with a variety of medias: paintings, fotos, installations, videos ..... You can get from there are very interesting insight view to Istanbul, Turkey, tensions between East and West ....

great museum. Istanbul should be proud to have a such a nice museum. Very new and very modern setting in Karakoy area. Karakoy is not far from historic part of the city, easiest way to come here is by tram, parking is also available. You can see famous turkish artists paintings and also different exhibitions. Museum has a great restaurant just by the water, and food is delicious, you can find both turkish and international cuisine.

modern Istanbul. Museum was cool place with many interesting exhibits. Was not allowed to take pictures, but I still remember some artwork. If you come with your children, don't worry, you can walk and look exhibition easy because they organize some art workshops for them. Also there is library, a lot of books about art waiting for you. For this museum can be enough 2 hours if you go fast, but if you are real art lover than leave for it half of your day :)

Great View of Bosphorus and nice coffee bar. Like some of the exhibits but very hot walk to get there so didn't take much in! Like the outside installation and then took lift up to the terrace restaurant. Worth going to have a look!

Great museum restaurant. Both the museum and its restaurant should be on every Istanbul travellers itinerary. The restaurant has a lovely terrace right on the waters of the Bosphorus and offers Turkish Italian dishes.

all the same.... I love museums, I love the restaurants in museums and I love the Museum shops. If you have enough time, a nice thing to do, but if you need to go to a museum, go to the one in your home town. A lovely installation, beautiful photography exhibit. If you are short on time, give this a miss!

Fantastic!. Great opportunity to get a glimpse into Turkish modern history of contemporary art while you strolling around Istanbul. It also has a nice shop offering many gift choices for the art lovers.Definitely a highlight of our stay there!
Definitely worth a visit. Modern as its name says, but really interesting place to visit. Nice cafe with a terrace towards sea.

great museum. one of the finer small museums i have seen. Anexcellent collection of turkish artists very well displayed if you happen to be lucky and be there when there is no cruise ship blocking the view enjoy lunch or a snack at the cafe there
Not to be missed. I almost passed up the chance to visit the museum but glad I didn't. There is a phenomenal amount to see. A great introduction to Turkish modern art.

fun and surprising. I visited the museum without much expectations, but I left happily surprised. It's well done with quite some variety. Check out the restaurant by the bosphorus and the library with the suspended books downstairs.
Another view of Istanbul. Not to be missed. While you are submerged in history, take a respite and visit the Museum. A great education is art and sculpture.

Fascinating Museum. Yes, I'll admit it, modern art is not quite as bad as I thought all of my life up until our visit to the Istanbul Museum of Modern Art this morning. Of course, there were those pictures that looked like a kindergarten class group project, but there was more than that too. In particular I was very impressed with many of the 3D displays. One was a mosaic of a shark in the ocean composed of clothing tags pinned and measuring something like 10 x 8 feet. Another was a sphere that reached from floor to ceiling made up of smaller one foot balls that were tied together and suspended by ropes anchored all the way around the room on the ceiling, walls, and floor. The roof in the library was designed by hanging books very close to each other from strings. I think my favorite was a collection of vintage suitcases, chairs, and artistic replicas with all sorts of movable, mounted magnifying glasses that provided many opportunities for new perspectives. I really enjoyed our visit.Ticket: 15 TL
horrible. i think its a waste of time to go and visit it , i was really disapointed , maybe the best thing that is there is the restaurant >

Ample museum with nice array of modern Turkish painters. The works are well displayed with a lot of space. A lot of audiovisual works. Go for the art but plan to eat at the cafe for a unique view of Istanbul. The gift shop has very nice stuff and not expensive.

Modern Turkish Art in a Stunning Setting. Spent the morning in this lovely museum looking at works from the late nineteenth century (a lot of Impressionist type paintings), to very recent years. The works are displayed in airy white spaces with room to sit and contemplate. Thursday is free for Turkish residents but the museum was not very busy - a quiet change from the crowds in the better known tourist spots in Istanbul. Great value at 8 Turkish lire for a senior.

A mind-boggling amount to see. You really need to spend at least a whole day, if not several, to see all the Topkapi Palace has to offer. There are the buildings themselves with every wall decorated in the most beautiful tiles and with wonderful, richly painted domed ceilings, the amazing treasures inside - like an Aladdin's cave of gold and gemstones, and the tale of an opulent and exotic history which unfolds as you walk around the Palace and gardens, visit the harem and admire the lovely views across the Golden Horn,the Bosphorus and the Sea of Marmara.The restaurant on the premises is a bit pricey but worth a visit for the view alone. , ,

Defo go check this out!. Lots of diverse work in here, from Turkish artists to international. Priciest cup of tea I've ever had however to be expected from one of the few modern museums in the city - they do student discount so make sure you ask :)

The Restaurant is amazing. I'm never really convinced by Modern Art and Istanbul Modern hasn't changed that. However I would go back here again and again just for the restaurant which served really lovely modern Euro/Turkish food with an amazing terrace that has fabulous views of Istanbul. (I couldn't figure out if you could get into the restaurant without buying a museum ticket). The one piece of art that did stand out and captivate my attention was the "False Ceiling," which is intriguing and worth seeing.

so-so. Great location but my guide book said it was free thursdays but this is only to Turkish citizens so it was 15 Turkish Lira. A large collection and mix of everything but was a tad disappointing compared to the excellent free exhibitions at SALT Beyoglu and Galata
Istanbul Modern Museum. You can almost find all kinds of modern art there. From the beginning of the 19th century till now. I was really impressed by the variety of this museum. Great artists!
Cool!. Very sdimilar to Tate Modern... Interesting Art & Installations and (like Tate) a fabulous cafe/restaurant with a great view (Cruise ships allowing!)

Definite must see. You don't have to be a big fan of modern arts to visit this astounding museum. The location right at tthemselves is an unforgottable experince by itself. You should not miss the museum restaurant right over the waterfront for a quality breakfast, lunch or coffee. Not only the breathtaking panorama, but also the taste and presentation of food is first rate. If you have a spare half-a-day in Istanbul, you should not miss Istanbul modern...
contemporary life in Istanbul. edgy and alive.. don't miss what the art scene perspective is on modern Istanbul.. sexuality, women's rights. civil rights, religion.. really fascinating
Good surprise. I didn't know what to expect.It is actually better than Tate modern in London. Do not miss it!Only down side is you can not take photos.

Art lovers ! Here's the place. Istanbul Modern Museum is an unforgettable place. "Past & Future" was the name of the exhibition held in the museum during my visit. I love all kinds of art, especially contemporary or modern art and I found great masterpieces for incrediably talented artisits during my visit. Every piece tells it own story and shows hard work and talent. I really loved it! You're not allowed to use cameras in the museum,but you can take photos at the restaurant. We had lunch at the museum's restaurant and guess what ? The food was excellant and the views over the Marmara Sea were amazing. I strongly recommend it, especially for those who taste art just like me!

Modern Art in an ancient setting. Difficult to actually find the entrance, despite the occasion signage. Worth the effort . . . if only for the restaurant that overlooks the Golden Horn and the Bosphorus

A modern jewel in an ancient city. We liked the curating - interesting presentations of modern art by Turkish artists - video, 3 dimensional, and paintings. The cafe has a view of Topkapi Palace, Haghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque across the Golden Horn - with ferry boats plying the waters back and forth. From most places one would be staying, a tram ride or a taxi ride necessary. No nearby hotels.
Well worth the visit.. A fantastic permanent collection and brilliant location. The restaurant upstairs has a wonderful view of the water and fantastic terrace alongside perfect service and food.
A good break from the city. A great, concise collection. Went there with older children, felt welcomed and the museum was interesting enough for them.

Great, if you like modern art.. Well worth a visit if you like modern art, my daughter discovered that she doesn't - at all! The restaurant connected to the museum is excellent and also has a great view on the Bosphorus.

wonderful and varied art. although the museum is in an odd port-side location and often has huge cruise ships docked next to it, the art on display is quite good and quite varied, it is a worthwhile stop, the restaurant also has reasonably priced good food and if no cruise ships obscure your view the sites across the Golden Horn are amazing

One of the best in the world, a hidden gem. We were extremely impressed by this museum and the art exhibited in it. We were completely unfamiliar with Turkish art of the modern era, and were "on the fence" about whether to go or not. We're so happy that we did. The art we saw was refreshing, had a point of view, and came from a perspective very different from "western" art. The experience left me with renewed faith in the ability of modern art to relate to society and individuals in new, interesting, and relevant ways.Outside of the work, the museum itself is also well done: beautiful building, incredible location on the Bosporus, great cafe, excellent light

Well worth the trip off the normal tourist route. A bit out of the way, along the waterfront in the Beyoglu part of town, this museum is well worth the effort to get to. Stunning setting (with a delightful cafe overlooking the Bosphorus), interesting collection, beautiful facility. A very good museum .... and a nice break from the other, Ottoman-oriented tourist stops.

Beautiful location. Unlike anything else in Istanbul this museum offers a refreshing break from the long history of the surrounding city. The restaurant is pricey but it is a lovely respite with gorgeous views literally on the Bosphorus. Well worth purchasing the audio tour to enhance your understanding of the exhibits.

Great view, good but pricey restaurant & amazing artwork. The gallery itself is not very big, but the artwork I have seen is very special. Although on the day I went there there were 3 big cruiser ships blocking the view of the Bosphorus, on a normal day you can enjoy this view from the restaurant. You pay for the view and not so much for the food. The food is a bit overpriced and the portions are not very big. It may get a bit chilly, so I suggest bringing a light cardigan when sitting outside, although you have the option to eat inside as well. The museum also has a small library of books with places to study. You cannot check out the books, but every day except for mondays you can come here and study things art, architecture and design related.

Great experience!. We really enjoyed their contemporary departement. We found among others Olafur Eliasson, which was breathtaking.Also it is Not very Big, which makes the exhibition suitable for everyone.Theresa a wonderful cafe by the sea-go there for breakfast or lunch:)

not truly modern. the selection of the collection was suspicious that I couldn't distinguish which was modern or not. Although there was a selection of good Turkish art, I don't think it is limited to that. If you want to see real good art go to the streets.

Istanbul Modern. If you enjoy contemporary art...go.. You will see some wonderful interpretations from national and international artists. I found it easy to get to. Just get off the tram at Tophane and the signs tell you where to go. When I went the advertised exhibitions were smaller than I expected but still great things to see. Stop and have a bite to eat even a glass of wine there... Good all round

Now this us what I'm talking about!!. Took this Cornish bird a couple of additional boat trips to find it but we'll worth it!( Especially as I wouldn't have seen so much of Istanbul if I didn't get so lost) ! Fed me with energetic inspiration that I really appreciated and yes the glass of wine sitting by the water is just the cherry on the cake!!
excellent breakfast.... the breakfast on the terrace is great. the food is just perfect and the view is magnificent. try the fresh juices!
what a view. what a view! great spot to drink a coffee or have a glass of wine after touring the museum. a bit overpriced but it's worth the relaxation...
Great modern museum. Please make sure you visit this museum when in Istanbul. Great art, nice building and a fine place to eat. The cafe is really nice and has great view.

Istanbul Modern is right on the water. It has a fine collection of modern Turkish art primarily.. I liked the selection of modern Turkish artists as well as the excellent library and exhibition space provided for international artists.

Unexpected Wow. Great modern museum. I enjoyed nearly every piece in the Museum. The surprise was how many women artists are represented here.
The space - a converted warehouse (?) - is spot on as well.
A must see for anyone with a passion for Contemporary Art.

A little known gem, and one of the easy to see places if you are on a cruise ship with just a several hour stop. The museum has a solid, well-exhibited permanent collection of painting and sculpture. We were there for a week, but for people on ships, the museum is basicly at the cruise ship port, and wll worth a visit.

Inspirational. am glad we made time for visiting Istanbul Modern during our short visit to Istanbul- if you are interested in art then its a must visit - very enriching with the history of Turkish art - no pictures are allowed inside so snap as much as u like out side - from sultanhmet we took the metro to tophane walked less than 100 meter and there it is beautifully located by the phosphor. you will see the red singe.. kids are welcomed but you have to pay - 30 tl for entry a gift shop inside stuffed with goodies - supervenes inspired by the art on exhibit. would love to visit again :)

Excellent Range of Exhibitions. Really enjoyed the layout and the range of exhibitions. From fabulous and well-known contemporary faves, to historical turkish paintings, to contemporary turkish art. Photo, video, painting, installation etc. are all on hand. The gift shop is lovely as well if you are so inclined. We heard the cafe was quite good but the prices had us looking elsewhere as we didn't feel like spending. Go out to the balcony at least, though, to enjoy the view.

Fantastic collection, great art space. Istanbul modern is a beautifully designed, large open space on the Bosphorus. It has an excellent collection from Turkish artists, starting from late 19th century until the present. There are excellent visual art displays. The audio guide is helpful in providing more information on some of the more prominent artists and their work. There is a well reviewed cafe over looking the river and Sultanahmet. Unfortunately there was a huge cruise ship in front of the museum during our visit. Apparently this is a regular occurrence.Don't miss the library!

Pity about the cruise ships blocking the view of the Bosphorous. Great art venue, nice cafe, pity about my view being the lifeboat of the massive cruise ship parked right outside. What a huge disappointment. At least the art was wonderful.

Modern art set on the Bosphorus. If you are looking for a contrast to the ancient and traditional art that surrounds your every move in Istanbul then take the tramway over to the Istanbul Modern. The day I visited the museum it was completely dwarfed by the monstrous cruise ship parked along side but the ship could not overpower the art work inside. The current show, a retrospective of the museum's holdings was smartly filling all the galleries which have an excellent layout and flow. No crowds. No long lines. Easy to find from the land side but often hidden from the waterside because of the huge cruise ships. A refreshing setting for contemporary art—somewhat like dental floss for your eyes and mind. Makes the rest of Istanbul look all that much better. Combine your time here (at least 1.5 hours) with a trip up the hill to the SALT gallery on Istiklal.

If you like modern art, don't miss it (and the waterfront cafe's views...). The Istanbul Modern Art Museum is a beautiful place. We began with a coffee on their terrace and what a view! The collection of modern art on display was excellent. An while some of Istanbul's main tourist attractions had enormous queues, we strolled right into the Modern and it was not too busy inside. (a note about some of the bad reviews here - if you're looking for old European paintings, historical displays, etc, for goodness sake don't pick this museum - it is a modern art museum with a focus on Turkish artists.)

Lovely range of installations, photography and art. Really great and extensive selection of art. Floating book installation outstanding and photography really insightful. Tasty restaurant attached for lunch.

was told it wasn't worth it... very wrong!. all the tourist guide people in town told us not to visit, but i was determined. on my way there i ran into two architecture students from america and they told me it was in their top 5 modern museums. it was only 2 floors but i spent 2 hours there and had to rush through the end before closing time. there are a LOT of video rooms. there's art from all over the world but also includes some middle eastern artists and content that i wouldn't see in most modern art museums. as everyone says, the view out the back of the sea is to die for. i didn't have a chance to try the restaurant but it looks nice. also has a pretty nice gift store and some great handmade jewelry.
Excellent museum. Reminded a lot of the Tate Modern in London. Extraordinary pieces of art, id you like modern art, nice view of Bosporus, tasteful cafe.

Fab Gallery but Heavy on Security. Not the easiest place to find or get to, but its well worth the effort. A Fab Space right on the Bosphorus. A great selection of work. The cafe, although expensive, did good chips and had nice views. The only problem i had was with the high security getting in. X-Ray machine and metal detector. A bit extreme? Once inside, you were not allowed to take any photos. A stupid rule and security in every room, checking that your wearing your entrance sticker. I felt this was a little over the top for a gallery, but didn't let it spoil my visit.

Modern art and excellent food.. A very nice modern museum with a really interesting collection of contemporary art. It is located in an old warehouse right next to the Bosporus strait and it is easily assessable by tram. But the best thing is actually not the museum but their splendid restaurant where you can sit on the first floor balcony with a fantastic view over the busy strait. The food is excellent, modern Mediterranean (Italian) with some Turkish specialty’s on the menu. I can recommend a selection of dolmas (stuffed vine leaves) as a starter accompanied by a glass of cool Turkish white wine. If you just visit the restaurant, there is no fee.

A visit to Istanbul Modern Art Museum. We were a diverse group in terms of our artistic knowledge. We all had a terrific time enjoying a wide variety of very interesting exhibits. We have been to the major modern art galleries in NYC and Washington , and this was every bit as good. The location makes for the main part of a pleasant afternoon tour on the river side of Istanbul. I would not miss it if I was to return to the city. A fabulous art gallery !!!!

Marvellous art gallery. Went there on a cold rainy Spring day. Really impressed Blythe quality, imagination and creativity on show. I thought it was far more interesting than most modern ,British art over the last few years. If I go back to Istanbul this gallery would be high on my list of must-sees.
good museum and restaurant. Well worth a visit. An excellent museum and the restaurant had great views over the water and reasonable food and service.

Art in Istanbul. We were pleased to find this modernist gem of a museum in a city full of historic treasures. The restaurant inside topped off a wonderful morning learning about Turkish art and history. Do not miss this place if you have time. You can go to Aya Sophia and Topkapi to see antiquities but why not learn about current trends in Istanbul?

A fine museum of modern art. Worth the trip if you have time & like modern art. There were some odd pieces. The restaurant is good and it has nice views, so a good place for lunch before or after a museum stroll. It is awkward to get into as it is designed for cars to get in, not pedestrians so you have to walk through the uninviting parking lot.
Art. A day well spent when you're tired of museums, palaces and churches. Also great products at their store! If there is no cruise liner, the cafe has a good view of the river.
brilliant. a show case for world and local art. dont miss all the small independent galleries near Galata too. turkey is now on the world stage for innovative art
Good day. I'm not a huge modern art fan, but there was a lot worth seeing here, and when I got tired of the art, the view of the Bosphorus from the cafe was STUNNING.

Nice art, great restaurant!. This museum is an island of modernity in Istanbul. The building is new, the are interesting, but the restaurant is superb! Come visit the museum towards the end of the day and stay for diner. Theres a long porch with breathtaking Bosporus views and great food. Its not cheep - but its worth it.
Great balance of very contemporary and historic Turkish art. Everything from film clips to a brief representative tour of Turkish art since the mid-19th century.

great space, meh collection. you can appreciate the effort to give contemporary turkish art a showcase but there's not a lot here to write home about. Temporary exhibits can be interesting. Restaurant has great views of the river.

Very Good Museum. Very nice museum enjoyed my visit very much and adored the exhibit of a television with a young lady who kept kissing everything in the room, she kept redoing her lipstip and leaving kisses on everying until the room was full even herself. Wonderful Museum
Modern Museum. Interesting and well sized gallery with a nod to the Tate Modern in terms of location and content. Only down point was expensive cafe: 10 lira for the museum.

en sevdiğim yerlerden biri. a must see...perfect opportunity to see and understand Turs contemporary art. a nice restaurant with a wonderfull view as well. peacefull place. check the web site to see which exhibition is on.

Interesting insight into modern Turkish thought. We went here as a family of 4 (two teenaged sons, ages 15 & 17) as an activity to do on a rainy afternoon. It ended up being one of our favorite things in Turkey! First, realize that the "free on Thursday" is for Turkish citizens only. No discount for "students" if not Turkish citizens. I do think that maybe children under 12 of any citizenship might be free???I would really recommend taking the time to scan the descriptions posted next to each painting or work of art. The first paragraph with each work of art is about the artist....I found that to be information I could skip. But the SECOND paragraph explained the thought behind the artwork. Really amazing insight into what is important to modern Turks socially and culturally, and what is on their minds. I mean, really REALLY interesting. The artwork ranges from lovely to choke-back-a-snort-of-laughter crazy. Much is very thought-provoking. Nothing about this place is heavy-handed or pretentious. There are short films in little alcoves with dark curtains for doors that range from funny to thought-provoking to "HUH?!?" Again, read the explanation posted next to the door before going in or you will be scratching your head for sure. Be sure to go downstairs where (I think) they house travelling or temporary exhibits. The absolute wackiest stuff was down there (as well as a really thought-provoking photo exhibit that had our family discussing everything from Chernobyl to the BP oil spill to how America is perceived overseas to business women in the Arab world). I mean, really out-right laughing with glee stuff. There are some candy machines in a little glassed in area off the lower level for if you're starving at some point. A happy bonus is that the first floor is right on the Bosporus and has the most AMAZING view of Istanbul, especially the point of land that has the Topkapi Palace. There is a cafe there that looked luscious and if it wasn't raining we absolutely we would have sat down and enjoyed the view and either had a meal or else just a cup of tea. Figure a half day to enjoy this if you reading the descriptions. We went in the afternoon (again, dodging the rainy weather that day) and found it to be perfect because it was uncrowded and we had no time constraints and could relax and not look at the time.

decent art on the waterfront. Whether you enjoy the art is a matter of taste, but Istanbul Modern is worth a visit if you're in the area. The museum is a modern art hall with videos, installations, and frames on par with any top tier modern art museum. Some installations were magnificent, others bland. It's got a great view right on the Bosphorus near Dolmabahce palace. There is a student discount. You must check your bags at the cloak room.The cafe is a bit expensive, and you have to walk through a parking lot and vehicle gate to get in from the street, as the building is geared more towards vehicles than pedestrians. That situation was certainly out of place in old Istanbul and diminishes the value of the museum.
Modern Art. This place had a really good show on when I was there. It was eye opening to see the world through turkish eyes. Pattern, of course, played a large role in many of the pieces.

Modern art on the waterside. As modern art galleries go, this is a good one, with a small but mixed collection of modern and contemporary work. If you are more of a traditional art lover, then this probably isn’t for you.One thing to say is that their cafe, though expensive (fresh fruit juices were about 20TL!), is on a waterside terrace, offering unbeatable views of the Bosphorus.It’s 15 TL to get into the Istanbul Modern, and you’ll have to leave your luggage in the cloakroom. Also no photography is permitted on the ground floor.

Interesting option if you have some spare time to kill. We decided to visit Istanbul Modern on our last day when we found we had a couple of hours spare. The museum itself is not overly large and the art inside is interesting and well-presented. Coming from London and being used to the likes of Tate, I found the 15TL admission fee steep for the size of the collection. In our guide book it stated that on Thursday admission was free but this is now only for Turkish citizens. It has a good shop and an interesting looking cafe though we did not have time to eat there. There are cloakroom facilities but beware the moody and unhelpful attendants! We instead ate a delicious meze meal at Karakoy Murat Muhallebicisi before visiting - 2 plates of hearty Turkish fare for 20 TL so very good value and service with a smile - I recommend eating here if you're in the area.

Cool and focused. This museum is not big, but it is very interesting and keeps up your attention span. The building and location are cool, the exhibits are designed well and I saw types of art I had never seen in my life. Well worth the trip and doesn't waste your entire day. Great for kids.

Excellent Contemporary Art. It ıs an excellent place for contemporary Exhibitions.I highly recommend the restaurant too.The prices are not cheap but ıt is worth to go as it has a great view..Enjoy the view of İstanbul..

Oasis of calm, great museum.. Easy to find, welll organised, attractive and thought-provoking. Nice cafe/restaurant with terrace over-looking the Bosphorus. Groups of tiny school children, super well behaved were being treated to educational experiences whilst we were there.We wandered from here, crossed the busy street went uphill toward Galata Tower, stopping en route to buy the most delicious breads, baked for us straight from the wood-fired oven. Locals came in while we were there to buy their bread. Cool!

An excellent place to spend an afternoon. Interesting and at times challenging art which makes you think. Beautiful exibits that cover the full range of media. Plus, a great view of the city. Use a tram or a cab from Sultanahmet.

One of the best modern art museums I've visited. Going to a modern art museum is a really good way to get a feel for a city - we loved Istanbul Modern so much that we went back for another visit. Took our 14 year and 11 year old children and they really loved it too. There's a great cafe with a deck that looks out over the harbour (and the first time we were there on to an Egyptian navy ship - that was fascinating).
Lovely place. Nice situated on the shore of Bosperus. Interesting display of development in Turkish painting. Especially modern Turkish artists are great.

An excellent museum of modern art. It's an amazing museum full of interesting objects by talented and outstanding artists. There is much to see here. Make sure to dedicate some time for it, at leat an hour or two.

Brilliant Modern Art..... ..... with a focus on young Turkish artists. Some remarkable pieces of sculpture, thought provoking video instillations and highly skilled paintings which demonstrate that, when it comes to creativity, this country can match anything produced in Europe.The down side of this museum is the staff. Officious guards, bored ticket sellers and some of the least customer focused waiters I have come across.Top tip - when dealing with paying customers remember, you should not appear to be grudgingly doing them a favor.Top tip - middle aged English people are unlikely to ransack the place; you do not have to stand over them suspiciously for their entire stay.It's a shame because this lets down what could be a world class gallery.
Not my type of museum. While I am not enamored with Modern Art, this building was exceptional. Check out the videos/movies.

Excellent modern art. Very impressed with the collection. Some outstanding pieces of art. Some weird short films playing continuously in small alcove theatres. I enjoyed this as much as other site in Istanbul.

Didnt regret it at all. amazing display and work of local artists. Very educational. Great view of the sea and of both Asia and Europe side from the vewing deck of the restaurant while sipping a cupof hot coffee. Totally worth it. And dont forget to rent the audio. It helps with the explanation of the display and the artist.
Modern art museums seem the same. It was pretty interesting visit and we had a good time. I think the cost was reasonable and we spent almost two hours in there.
good but not essential. if you want to know where modern turkey's art is headed here is the place, some interesting pieces although historical istanbul has plenty to allure

Worth the trip. There is lots of stimulating modern art here, plus currently a great photographic exhibition. The cafe is an ideal lunch location - try the salads - with very efficient staff. We enjoyed a walk to Istanbul Modern from our hotel in Sultanahmet, via the spice bazaar and over the Golata bridge - follow the tram lines. After lunch, we headed through Beyoglu up to Istaklal Caddesi. Made for an interesting day.

Worth the visit with kids. I think contemporary art museums are very worth an afternoon visit when traveling with children. Istanbul Modern did not disappoint. You can also relax on the terrace with a strong cup of Turkish tea and a wonderful view.

Awesome space, exciting collection. Few visitors to Istanbul are likely to know much about contemporary Turkish art. This stunning venue on the waterfront offers an excellent and efficient education. Stimulating exhibits, well explained in English. Will definitely return on every Istanbul visit.

A "must see" in İstanbul. İstanbul Modern is the first and most visited modern art museum in İstanbul. İt accomodates basically Turkish contemprorary art in its permanent exhibition that also changes in intervals. Besides the permanent collection, the Museum hosts various interesting temporary exhibitions of local as well as artists from around the world.The location is at the heart of İstanbul and right on Bosphorus.A "must see" when in İstanbul.

Fine museum, well-chosen pieces. The museum shows art that surprisingly is very much comparable to the West-European national modern art collections. Towards the contemporary part there is more than adequate display of video and recorded performance art. We should have preferred more modern paintings, sculpture etc.
Amazing variety. this is a great museum, and there is a wonderful cafe on the water for your afternoon snack or lunch. check out the local mosque within walking distance; it is quite unique
A new museum in Istanbul. Most interesting contempary art museum. Good collection nicely represented. Nice restaurant with great views!

Istanbul Modern. We went to the Istanbul Modern with high hopes, and they were met. The collection is a bit limited, but it is very interesting. The interior space and layout of the collection is outstanding. We particularly liked some of the video installations, many by women artists challenging traditional roles. One particular video installation on what I'll call "dancing land mines" really caused the viewer to think about the subject. There is a nice if a bit pricey cafe there with spectacular views out over the Bosphorus. A great way to spend a rainy or chilly day getting to know a little more about the history of Istanbul, particularly in the last half of the twentieth century.

Istanbul Modern.. This building looks better when viewed from the water but inside it's a stunning and large space devoted to a permanent exhibition of Turkish (mainly 20 century) art, alongside regular short term exhibitions. Currently there's an exhibition of French influences on Turkish art. It's open until 8pm on Thursday evenings. The restaurant looks out onto the waterfront and you can sit outside. We sampled a couple of fabulous puddings with our apple tea before viewing. The nearest tram stop is Tophane.

A Favourite Place. The Modern is exactly that, and for those who say 'oh I am not in Istanbul for Modern Art' then you are missing an extraordinary place: in location, views, and such a rich variety of exhibitions that focus on Turkish views outward and inward, and some recent historical collections too. A refreshing place to visit to balance the older historical site tours, and one that can always surprise. just check that there are no cruise ships in to block the stupendous views over the Bosphorus!

Glad you exist, Istanbul Modern. I could easily spend a full day there, especially with the photography exhibition which is currently there but I am very curious what will be next, so I can't wait. As I am a blogger as well as a photographer at the same time, therefore I could not resist to write about my visit. When typing in the search of caroliengeurtsen . nl, the whole story will appear, both in Dutch and English.

A »must« to visiti. Istanbul Modern Museum is a must to visit. Unlikely, photos are forbidden. Join the café just to haven a great view on the Bosporus. If you want to sit down, first have a look in the card, it´s expensive.
Good museum. I very much enjoyed this museum and learning of the talented artists that have been practicing in Turkey.
Not easy to find, perservere. Is free on Thursday for Istanbul residents, not tourists. Children are free. Great cafe/restaurant albeit pricey.

Nice Art and Food. Istanbul Modern is an art gallery with a restaurant/cafe in it. This art gallery is very close Karaköy port and it is easy to find. After you finished your tour in the gallery you can have a coffee break in the cafe with a nice Bosphorus view. But watch out! If there is a cruise visiting the port then you may feel unlucky cause your view may become the walls of the cruise.

A Fresh Look at Art. Although Modern Istanbul has been operating for a few years now, I waited to see how it will fare. The structure comprises two functional areas. One is the Gallery, the other the cafe/restaurant. I must they the choices for the Gallery have been very distinct and fulfilling. The Gallery is spacious and serves its exhibitions rather well. Coming to the restaurant I must add it has an amazing view over a bustling and historic part of the Bosphorus and hence Istanbul. The view expands to partly to "Karaköy", the Historic Peninsula and Sirkeci (places one should definitely stroll through). The menu is very balanced with various taste directions and the service is wonderful. True, it may get busy and you may not end up at the forefront of ther view but still the ambiance is relaxing and enjoyable. From the restaurant you have direct access to the gallery. Modern Istanbul is also superbly situated. a short stroll from different corners and sites of the city. It is easily accesible (relatively compared to the general layout of Istanbul's many sites). A visit could be combined with another visit to the nearby "Tophane-i Amire" (historic building worth a visit, used for exhibitions as well), or to some mosques, or what not else. Again a visit can stretch an interest from a solitude-seeking art connoiseur to a famliy willing to spend a nice time surrounded by food and art.Have fun!

Worth the detour if you like modern art and beautiful water views. This is easy to access from the Tophane tram stop. It is a bit hidden from view, but there are signs (and friendly locals) to help you find it. Check which evenings it is open late. Enjoy the wonderful Bosphorus views from the deck or the restaurant outside.
Modernism's Legacy. I like Istanbul Modern because it is an interesting and thriving modern art museum, this time with a challenging exhibition about modernism's legacy
Interesting collection. We visited the museum on our last morning in Istanbul, it's a varied and fascinating collection of permanent and temporary exhibits. The restaurant is good but expensive.

Excellent experience. The museum has a nice collection of modern art and worth the visit. The museum's cafe not only has an amazing view but excellent food as well! It is the perfect place to relax, have a drink or coffee overlooking the Bosphorus and then have dinner.The food and service were excellent.

Good pkace to visit. Istanbul Modern Museum looks like all museums of modern art in Europe but with its unique parcularities.The best thing in this museum is a painting of a man who always looks at you wherever you stay...

Great museum but only sandwiches in restaurant. We went here as a result of reading the reviews on here. Its a great space with fantastic views (book if you want to sit outside on the narrow terrace). However, we found that at lunch time at least, the restaurant really only have an admittedly large selection of sandwiches - toasted, club etc. Nothing much else.
great exhibitions - greater view from the cafe. great to combine modern art and a coffeebreak with a 1st row view of the harbour and sea. the cafe also has an inspired menue and clean toilettes

A moment of constantly being watched. Living in Istanbul when the museum opened, I've seen it become better and better and I've seen some of the best art of my life in here, both by personal favourites like Anish Kapoor and by other artists, which were new to me. Exactly the way it should be.Admission is not a problem, free wardrobe is a charming plus, but then it all goes terribly wrong. From the moment you walk in, you feel like a prisoner. There is security staff in every area an trust me, they are not shy. It's absolutely impossible to get an experience in this place. Not mention if you, put off by the constant supervision, should want to check your mails or if you get a text from a friend, then they rush forward, loudly and clearly stating "NO PICTURES, NO PICTURES". Here's a bit of advice to the people runninght e museum. If you want to make Istanbul Modern a museum of the same ranks as the ones in other big cities, you have to change your mentality. Totally. For now, it's a joke. Who can take in pieces of art in this environment? A last tip for you as a visitor as well, make sure you put your big, red sticker on your forehead, because otherwise the staff will also hunt you down to see your ticket. Again and again and again...

Interesting.. We walked to the museum and it was pleasant to go from ancient mosques and structures to a modern art museum along the Bosphorus. Worth visiting if you like this kind of art. The gift shop is pretty decent.

Modern surprise in ancient Istanbul. This modern art museum is a short walk from the tram line (Tophane stop on the Kabatas line), sandwiched between ancient buildings and the waterfront, a stone's throw from the cruise ship pier. Possibly inspired by the Tate Modern in London, this very up-to-date museum is in a converted industrial building on the waterfront, with some spectacular views of the Golden Horn and Bosphorus. Appropriately, the museum features work by young Turkish artists, complemented by a good selection of modern international works. After visiting numerous Byzantine and Ottoman sites, it's refreshing to step into a starkly modern setting showcasing some really thought-provoking pieces, such as a silent film depicting political upheaval during the 1960s. There is also an excellent cafe with outdoor seating overlooking the Bhosphorus) where you can enjoy a break while processing some of the exhibits, as well as a well stocked museum shop. An excellent way to spend half a day or so in Istanbul.

A highlight for me. the instillation were very interesting, a lot of variety in the displays, perfect amount of displays. Took me about two and a half hours, very relaxed atmosphere, by the time I finished seeing all the pieces I found that I have read about every single one of them, which I never do. insightful and interesting.

Well worth the trip. If you are a fan of contemporary art, treat yourself to a visit to Istanbul Modern. The shows are generally intriguing and there is a very nice cafe with a gorgeous view of the Bosphorus. The museum is easy to get to. It's very close to the Tophane tram line stop.

Great collection. In addition to the modern art by Turkish artists, they had a collection of Chris Marker films from France. This was a real treat as I had studied Marker in graduate schools. I found the quality of the works in this space to be interesting as well as the physical design of the museum. Great gift shop, too.
wasn't disappointed. went there more out of curiosity that anything else, but was surprised by the Turkish artists exposed in the museum, some very nice and interesting pieces.

Important institution for a culturally booming city. Istanbul Modern is the first gallery of its kind in Turkey. It's very much western in style with white walls and well curated exhibitions of both Turkish and international artists' work. This place is a great introduction to Turkish painting and modern art in general. It also houses a cinema which shows documentaries and international films, often with mini-thematic festivals. The cafe is a popular meeting place with an excellent view of the Bosphorus. If you're resident in Turkey then entrance is free on Thursdays. You definitely shouldn't miss this place if you want another peek into true modern culture in Turkey today.

An Amazing side of modern Istanbul. Most people know of the Byzantine or Ottoman cultural aspects of Turkey but not many know the modern secular voice of Turkey. This is a great opportunity to see a side of Istanbul that is not that evident. The art is phenomenal and world class and ranges from art from the Ottoman era to the present. There are different areas and the art includes: paintings, installation, video and other forms and there are both temporary and permanent exhibits. There is a great but pricey restaurant/ cafe and a gift shop. There is also a research library for visiting scholars of Turkish art and artitsts. The museum was a gift to Istanbul and the world from the Eczacıbaşı family who were prominent industrialists and the works are from their private collection. This museum is one of 4 that I love to visit when I am in istanbul, the others being: the Sabanci museum, the Pera Museum and Santral, all in diverse parts of Istanbul. All of them are examples of philanthropy filling the gaps that the State increasingly refuses to fill. As for the person who didnt like the cruise ships docked there, I think it adds a pleasantly surrealistic side. By the way, when you leave the museum walk to Karakoy and you will see a side of Istanbul that is historic and may not be there much longer if the developers gentrify it.

superb contrast to the old city. After a few days of smoking sheeshas, soaking up souks and meandering around mosques in Istanbul, what better than a complete contrast? The Istanbul Modern hides behind a mosque currently under restoration, so apart from a few distinctive red and white signs, you would never know it was there.... which is a shame. A mere 15 lira to get in, the place is a delight. packed with a vast collection of painting, sculpture, installations, concept pieces, light projections and much more, from Turkish and international artists. Easy to spend a long day here if you wander, read a lot of the info boards, and take to the cafe, with a stunning view of the Bosphorous, for a lunch midway through- however be warned, you pay for the view- a light lunch with a drink will cost you about 30 Lira per head (but the food is quite superb, and there is some pretty cool backing music, or you can eat locally within 200 metres once you come out). The gift shop has a few cheap postcards and a lot of very expensive memorabilia (one of the areas where they copy the Tate Modern and SF MOMA). A great day out if the rain is falling or you have old-world fatigue and need a change of scene. Not really suitable for children, although there is no age restrictionCheck the website before going- at present IM is closed on a Monday and open until 8pm on a Thursday. Wheelchair access is possible (there is a lift), but on a very crowded day you may not see much. There is a lot of parking outside, or it is a short walk from the Tophane stop on the Tramvay system from Kabatas. Photography is not allowed in the gallery, by the way

Not to be missed in Istanbul!. We live in Istanbul and visit this museum from time to time throughout the year. We like the permanent collection and changing exhibitions both+ we love the cafe inside overlooking Bosphorus. The collections inside give you a good idea on Turkish painting and the cafe (especially when you, re sitting outside in nice weather) is a blessing. The food,the air you smell all make you feel "I am in Istanbul, it is great". Good place for tourists and locals both.

superb museum/superb restaurant. i had to drag my husband to this museum. He gets "museum head" after about 2 hours. But he cooperated and his reward was lunch in the museum restaurant which he described as one of his best meals in Istanbul. Turkish ravioli (manti) and a leek/potato/onion side were so good, I wished we had eaten more. The art was superb, especially the videos---be sure to find the iconic video from 1976 (?) by a Turkish artist writing a manifesto on her body before she begins belly dancing. It's revolutionary.

A great contrast. After a few days taking in all the amazing historical sights of Istanbul it was great to see a modern side to the city. There were some fab works of art, a calming place to wander quietly around learning new things. Also a great view from the outside terrace.

Modern masters in a new town.. Always good to see what the contemporary artists in this amazing land are up to. Thought provoking and interesting. I enjoyed the sculptures and much of what was on display.
a beautifull museum. very chic, very eclectic, athmospheric, its a fabulous place, the art work, the history is fantastic, a lovely cafe with a fabulous view, its a must.
Other side of Turkey !. Amazing museum. Great to spend 3-4 hours inside. If You like modern painting, photography, video or draw i's perftect places for You.
It's art, but not as you know it. Small, abstract and poorly described. Minor interest was the stories around ancient artists, but it's not a patch on the London Modern.

Outstanding collection. Beautiful exhibition of modern and contemporary - including some amazingly elegant video works. A real education for one who didn't know that the abstracts of other countries were equalled in the Turkish studios.

Worth a visit. Check out the Istanbul Modern to see some amazing Turkish artists. If you are there on a sunny day I would highly recommend the outdoor terrace restaurant for lunch. One of the best views in the city.
Good. The exhibitions are interesting and well organized. The cafe has a great view, as long as there isn't a cruise ship in front, but is just ridiculously expensive.
A undiscovered museul. On our last visit 21 yrs ago we ran out of time to see all the sites. We spent a few hours in this marvellous museum and were not disappointed
A small and up and coming modern art museum. Not too much to see, but some of the exhibits were stunning, mainly turkish artists. A quiet and peaceful place to while a time away from the crowds.

A fast-lane to Turkish art. This small museum gives excellent value for time spent. It is focused and well composed, telling about recent development i Turkish art with a view also towards its historical roots and international influences. We were impressed by the originality of the works and of the melange of humor and deep critical thought.
A perfect view to enjoy Istanbul. I loved the view from the first floor especially the restaurant area. The art work in the first floor and the location of the museum.
Great little museum. Excellent survey of Turkish modern art and a delicious restaurant, too. Not far from the Museum of Innocence, which is also worth a look.

Great stop if you appreciate modern art. Very cool, very modern, very chic. Many interesting displays and some avant-garde, as you would expect. terrific deck on the Bosphurus is a perfect location for a rest and a libation

A nice change from the Turkish. Had lunch while visiting the museum. Excellent (really excellent) pizza with fresh ingredients and made with care. Same went for the burger. Professional service and reasonable pricing (for what was received and the situation at least).

Throughly refreshing. Off the beaten track, this art gallery also known as Istanbul Modern boasts temporary and permanent art collection by turkish artist which are thoroughly original & inspirational! A must for all art enthusiasts.

Needs More International Art. I don't know anything about Turkish politics, but it seems most of the artists represented by this museum have a LOT to say about their history, struggle, placement, whatever. In general, I would say it IS worth the price of admission because there are some real treasures (like the piano suspended by three helium balloons). There was a terrible video playing an incessant Ping-Pong-Ping electronic sound at a high pitch in the main space and you could hear it throughout the museum. It was grating. Unfortunately when we were there the entire subfloor exhibition space was preparing for a new show, including the photography, so even though our admission was reduced I felt what WAS available wasn't enough. If nothing else, the views of the water are sensational, and one should always support art wherever one finds it. I would, however, suggest the art advocate leave the museum and head up Bogazkesen and get a gallery map of the area. Take the road all the way up the hill (way way way up) and then walk the full length of Istiklal Avenue, being sure not to miss SALT Beyoglu Gallery. Give yourself at least a full day to see the art in this area, and bring GOOD walking shoes.

Modern museum on the Bosphorus!. We loved this museum, it's exactly as the name suggests very modern! The contemporary works are fantastic and the outdoor cafe right on the Bosphorus is amazing! Relax and enjoy a healthy lunch or just have tea or coffee as you take in the view! The museum store was lovely as well bought some cool items there. It's on the Asian side of Istanbul and very easy to get there with the Tram, just get off at the Tophane stop and a short lovely walk. Will definitely visit again!

Excellent venue. Excellent collection of work sensitively arranged. The museum's location is fantastic with great views of the Bosphorus. A fine juxtaposition of classical and contemporary. well worth a visit.

Love the view from there!!. Small compared with museums in NYC or Washington DC but a really good one. The best? The bar-restaurant inside with a view of the Bosforus to die for. Really nice variety of drinks and plates to choose from, alittel expensive altough even more since you have to pay for the entrance to the museum Around 10 Euro.

Great collection, incredible setting. Right on the Bosphorus. Not a huge museum, but a nice collection -- well presented. The cafe is worth visiting: decent food and you can sit outside and enjoy the view (unless there is a cruise ship parked here, apparently!)

A highlight!. Love the Modern! A great space and I think the main collection offers a unique glimpse of the culture in Turkey since the founding of the republic. So interesting! And the restaurant, while. Not cheap, is a great setting!

Good on a Rainy Day. We visited Istanbul Modern on a rainy day. Perhaps we just don't understand modern art, but it just seemed like a standard art exhibit to us with two floors. There's a good view from the cafe, which had covered outdoor seating, which meant that we could sit outside even though a storm was brewing outside.We really enjoyed the portrait photography exhibit on the lower floor, especially the very interactive jump zipla portion, where we spent a good half an hour thinking up ridiculous poses. I also enjoyed the ceiling lined with books on the lower floor.

A good history of Turkish art. The museum is laid out by decades starting at the end of the 19th century. Each area had an explaination of what artists were trying to achieve. I am sure I missed some nuances because I did not know enough about Turkish History but it was fascinating anyway.

lovely place to spend an afternoon. Istanbul Modern is a beautifully renovated warehouse space, that highlights the work of some fine contemporary Turkish artists. The gallery provides a wonderful backdrop for the art, and it's a very comfortable gallery to visit. The basement featured a truly spectacular photography exhibit and the "book ceiling" was a highlight. Don't forget to visit the museum shop, it's one of the best of its kind. A great place to pick up Turkish music, I bought two mixes from the legendary nightclub Babylon. Also, the restaurant it the perfect place to have lunch, the food is delicious, but it's the setting that shines. We would definitely visit this place again. Photography in the galleries is not allowed and this is enforced rather vigourously.

Not so modern. We are not sure why they call it Modern, because they don't have much modern art in the place. Don't get me wrong it's not a bad museum it just needs to acquire some modern art. For me one of the highlights is sitting outside in their cafe just admiring the view.

Not only tradition. It is very important to visit modern museums to try to think "out of the box". This one lays in two floors and presents interesting stuff. Take time and stop for reading the art works descriptions, it gives the key of interpretation and what your eyes see arrives to your brain and your heart. The location is by the Bosphorous, so it' s a pleasure to rest at the Museum Cafè drinking a Turkish Coffe. No puctures allowed, just memorize and make reflections.

good contrast to historical sites. Varied art, some interactive and/or giving insight to modern-day issues within Istanbul; good contrast to other tourist sites that all focus on the past; high quality cafe with good view across water too.
Interesting !!. Visited the Modern Museum, found it very interesting. Would have scored higher, as no photo's are allowed inside museum.

Refreshing and surprising. A great insight to the modern art scene in Turkey and some refeshing and surprising art on view. More western influenced, but still well worth the visit. Easially accessible on the T1 tram route

A very interesting and pleasant gallery experience. The building is an old warehouse on the seafront. It is an excellent location on the Kabatas tram route, and the exhibition space is excellent. The art showcases modern Turkish art and is very good. Like lots of good galleries the cafe is really good, we had a lovely meal here overlooking the water.

Don't overlook this one.. We visited to the photography exhibition 'The Gaze'. I gave less points because I was not allowed to take pics, this bothers me. We enjoyed the photo exhib but wold rather recommend the Istanbul Photography Museum in the Old Town.

Great come rain or come shine. Nice modern collection of Turkish artists plus some specialist exhibitions. Very friendly staff. Great views out to sea and I'm told an ace caff/restaurant. Nice little sho too.

One of the best museums of modern art. The museum is not huge but the art is really interesting, all or mostly local with an impressive array of multimedia art, photography and a very cool library.
The pluses are the restaurant (not cheap but outstanding) and the view of the Bosphorous and any cruises that happen to be in town. It's worth the visit just to the restaurant

One of the better ones. Great museumOnly had 3 hours but loved it - great art and a great way to understand how modern history has shaped turkish art and vice versa. Very heavy on security and guards which is a shame - even writing artists names in my iphone had them all twitchy. Best thing is the lack of crowds which give you time and peace to explore

Modernism comes to Istanbul. this is a splendid use of olddoack buildings to make an airy museum somewhat reminiscent of London's Tate Modern. there is a fine but rather small permanent collection with exceptionally interesting work from the early 2oth Century and always one or more visiting exhibitions. I saw a Chinese onen(so-so) and a fine photographic show. Good restaurant with views over Bosphorus.

not bad. We had a rainy day and went to the new museum. It was nice and we were lucky ot fall on a great photography exhibitI wouldnt have gone if the weather would have been great as theres so much to do in istanbul but glad we went

Modern Museum in an ancient city. Excellent , spent whole day and could have been there longer. See new exhibit set up 7 November 2012. Cafe, overlooking the Sea, good place for break and delicious soups and salads

Go for the biennial if you can.. The permanent collection has some very nice pieces, particularly the almost-hidden portrait section along the windowed wall. We really liked a lot of the work displayed in the biennial. The entire exhibit felt almost like a haunted warehouse and smelled eerily like roses...

Fantastic. One of the best modern art galleries I've been to in a while! Information panels are extraordinarily detailed for every panel. They had an exhibit charting the development of Turkish modern art which was really great. One pointer- entrance on Thursday is free for Turkish residents only. A highlight of my trip to Istanbul- don't miss it!
a lovely space - great art. delightfully uncrowded with some really interesting pieces. eclectic collection. really short walk from T1 tram. great shop!
Must. It is a really nice museum. Nice area, nice restaurant, nice store and of course really good museum. If you come on right time you can visit great exhibitions.

Excellent Art Museum, Beautiful View. Istanbul Modern is a large museum with a beautiful view of the Bosphorus and the Old City of Istanbul from its balcony and cafe. We were utterly entranced with its exhibits of contemporary and modern Turkish art. In particular we enjoyed the New Works, New Horizons exhibit which is an excellent overview of the evolution of modern and contemporary Turkish art. There were also excellent exhibits of contemporary Chinese art and of portrait photography. We were somewhat less enchanted by the Istanbul Design Biennale exhibit which included a cacophony of design ideas, but a few very worthwhile exhibits including an interactive exhibit on how various urban factions approach the design process. The Biennale is a separate admission and I'd only recommend it if you have lots of time. The museum is easy reached at the Tophane Tram 1 stop from the Old City.
An interesting modern art galery. Very nice location, industrial building on the Bosphorus, interesting exhibitions, a place of modern art in Istanbul.
A big surprise . The museum surprised me. It has friendly art and design, not stride that are too deep to understand. A lovely place to go.

nice museum, lovely food and view. This isn't as good as the Tate Modern - they are two different beasts. But it is well worth a visit. Some lovely art - not that many big international names, but that isn't the point. Some of the changing exhibits were great. We ate at the restaurant which was lovely and stunning view towards the old town over the Bosphorus.

Creative, artistic and fun. After days of looking around historic buildings, though as beautiful as they are, this made for a refreshing change.It is smaller than the London comparator but offered a perfect blend of innovative and modern work along with traditional art forms.

Vibrant and informative.. This was so much more than I was expecting. The art was vibrant and political, the layout really engaging. I learnt more about the history and the culture of Istanbul than anywhere else (although it is probably more accurate to say, that this visit 'fleshed out' what I had gleaned from all our sightseeing and guidebooks). Fascinating installation on the building of the third bridge. It felt like Art at the edge, really challenging, outrightly political. The cafe had stunning views of the Bosphorus; the food was great, and the service ghastly.
A real treat of a gallery. The cafe/restaurant has the most brilliant views across the Bosphorus and the exhibits show just how vibrant and challenging life in Istanbul can be.

"meh". there was a brilliant exhibit of chinese art downstairs, but almost all of the rest was not what i would see as top-notch modern art... many pieces seemed very amature/immature...we also paid extra to go to the Design Biennialle (about urban development) which was expensive and not worth it.. LOTS of text, presented in a fairly dry, basic format - was expecting the exhibits design to make the ingenuity of the planned/proposed development strategies...

An extraordinary surprise. Athough I'd read about the Istanbul Modern, I never expected it would be this wonderful. Throughout the 20th century, the Turkish government subsidized artists including grants to study art in Paris. The result of this paid off. Istanbul has an excellent and well supported gallery scene and the Istanbul Modern is a great space. There's plenty of room for huge paintings, sculpture, video and installation art. Do not miss this

Another unexpected pleasure. If you are only interested in Istanbul's fabled history, you might choose not to visit Istanbul Modern. But that would be a loss. Located on the Bosphorus in a modern building, the exhibits include a history of late 20th century Turkish art, much of it derived from European styles and training, but nonetheless of quality and an interesting insight into the lively cultural life of the city typically inaccessible to the foreign visitor. The basement houses changing exhibitions, a fascinating library installation, and other works by Turkish artists today. The museum was filled with young people, almost entirely locals. The waterfront cafe is a wonderful place for a coffee or lunch overlooking the constant flow of ships along the Bosphorus. Again, a place off the predictable tourist track.

One of the top sites in Istanbul.. It's right by the cruise ship jetty so every day another huge liner is in port.
