Fabulous museum with loads of culture, old and modern and it's sited next to yet another mosque. Lovely restuarant overlooking the Bosphorous, great views over the whole City and great food too. We sat outside in the warm sunshine and enjoyed a glass or two!
istanbul modern. Location is a bit tucked away but the museum had a very nice temporary collection, and an interesting permanent collection with mostly Turkish artists.
OTHERS TAKE NOTE. It was interesting, different and laid out in a way that keeps you intrigued. Easy to get to and not too enormous which means you can see every piece without getting bored.

Must-see for contemporary art fans. Fantastic collection of contemporary art in a great modern building. Thoroughly enjoyed the exhibition (and the coffee in the onsite restaurant overlooking the Old City across the water).

Wonderful view of Istanbul new and old. Terrific reuse of old warehouse set on Bosporous. Well designed building housing an excellent collection and interesting changing exhibits. The museums provides a welcome insight into contemporary views of modern Turkish politics.The cafe is a superb place to sit on the waterfront, enjoy the views and shipping traffic and enjoy a nice meal.

A very modern Museum. We loved all those books creating the false ceiling! Great concept! The video of biennale, where people talked about the new project was very interesting and someone can realize that something is going on in Istanbul, which is slowly changing...Exhibition of Photography could be better...

Do something different. With so many ancient places to see in Istanbul, it's nice to do something that relates to modern life for a change. I stayed in Istanbul with my teenage son as part of our 10,000-mile cycle expedition from Ireland to Japan (book: Long Road, Hard Lessons). The Modern Museum provided us with something different after 3 weeks of seeing ancient sites. There's some interesting stuff here.
Beautiful location. I love the location and atmosphere in the museum. The galleries are perfectly designed for a great experience
A world-class art gallery. Well organised, good captions, not very crowded, interesting exhibits.Security pretty intensive - don't have a penknife in your rucsac.

handicap access to the Modern. My wife and I were is Istanbul in October. I had a transport chair for her. We went to the Modern, were shown an entrance for wheelchairs and an elevator to take her to the main floor.We arrived about 12:00 and went immediately to the resturant and fortunately got the last table on the balcony over looking the Bosphurus. The food was quite good, but just sitting on the balcony and watching the boat traffic was super. Breakibg away from the view, we toured the museum. We particularly enjoyed the Turkish impressionists. The art was beautifully displayed with full explanations of the art in Turkish and English. A visit to the museum should be included in addtion to seeing Topkopi, and Blue Mosque and the other traditonal sites.
Only been to the restaurant. I don't know about the museum but the restaurant is worth a visit.Great view of the Bosphore and the bridge spanning Europe and Asia. A bit expensive though so be aware.
not bad. a bit of an odd location and felt a bit under used... wish I had spent more time there, I was there for a conference- more work than a visit

2012 Design Biennial. We only attended the Istanbul Design Biennial portion of the museum. We took the ferry from Eminou to Karakoy and enjoyed the 10 minute walk parallel to the river to the museum. The show was generally very good. It is definitely accessible to English-speakers. Some of the installations were a little too reliant on text. I'm sure if our knowledge of Istanbul was deeper we would have grasped more of the nuance but as it was we found it to be cool and thought-provoking. Some of the installations are very interactive. Don't miss the one where you can alter the city skyline depending on whether you are a politician, and NGO, a tourist, etc. Brilliant concept and execution. We were a little taken aback that after spending 20 TL each on tickets to the Biennial they wanted another 8 TL apiece to see the rest of the museum. That seemed a bit like chiseling. Also, the staff was a bit on the too-cool side. I used to work a contemporary art museum and I'm all too familiar with the phenomenon. It was more jarring than usual because of the unusual graciousness of the rest of the folks we've encountered in Turkey. Hipsters, ugh.We had an excellent but expensive lunch in the museum cafe. The view across the Bosphorus was spectacular. The service was clunky, but friendly.

Amazing Collection!. If you love modern art you will love this museum. Many artists I've never heard of, but truly, truly talented artisans.The museum is laid out very well and there weren't many people there even though it was a rainy day. We had planned on staying an hour or so and ended up walking out over three hours later. We lingered at so many beautiful, thought provoking pieces that we just lost track of time. GO, GO, GO!
away from the hassle. I like this place because of the relaxed atmosphere. the exhibitions are great anyway. too good to miss this great museum.

Most Enjoyable of the Sites. Their exhibit traced the development of modern art in Turkey over the last 100 years from impessionist painters to the present digital media. Exhibitions were interesting and educational. Everything was in Turkish and English. Much to our surprise we discovered the modern museum had an excellent restaurant (expensive) on a deck overlooking the water. The seafood rizotto was as good as any I have ever had. It is located where all the cruise ships dock. I enjoyed this visit far more than viewing antiquities.

World class contemporary art, right on the Bosphorous. After being completely worn out from the mosques and traditional art and palaces, etc, etc, I had to get out and see something more contemporary. This museum is a true breath of fresh air. A bright airy building, right on the water, with a fine collection of Turkish art, and rotating exhibitions from other international art museums. I saw a well-curated photography exhibition about portraiture, and a fascinating show on contemporary Chinese art. The restaurant there was excellent - huge wine list - but it was also OK to just sit out on the terrace, overlooking the boats, and sip an espresso. It seemed very popular with the locals on the weekend, too. Can't go wrong with a visit. I think it's one of the top museums in the city.

Fascinating Art Gallery. First of all, İstanbul Modern's athmosphere was really fascinating, especially in the winters. There are small rooms across the art galleries and you can watch the special art illustrations which means that some special days like engraving sovereignty theme. Landscape also awesome, just go and see immediately if you don't

a great modern art museum. the exibitions are always very well chosen, mostly of the contemporary artists. the restaurant within the museum is excellent. It is a wonderful place if you want to to spend quality time full of culture and good food with friends you should visit this museum.
Not to be missed. An excellent way to spend a few hours. Istanbul Modern is spacious and has a good feel to it. You can take the tram or walk 15 minutes from the Galata Bridge.

A Place of Contrasts. The Istanbul Modern is a wonderful international contemporary art museum, on par with any other in the world. The exibits were enlightening, the space was amazing and the cafe a treat.

Gallery on contemporary art. The building itself is of interest and located on the Bosphorus right at the cruise terminals. It has lovely views on the water. Dont be put off by the industrial location as it is a unique collection, extremely well presented.

An interesting collection. The museum has free entry on thursdays but is very cheap to get into on any other day too. The gallery is well laid out with an interesting mix of Turkish and international artists. The best thing is the view you get out across the Bosphorus across the Maiden's tower and the asian side of the city. Worth a look in if you have a few days longer in Istanbul and have already seen the rest of the attractions but I wouldn't put it on the list of only in the city for a few days.

Disappointing. We were very interested in seeing the building with such a beautiful Bosphorus-side location and a collection of Turkish modern and contemporary art.The location, especially the restaurant overlooking the water, was great, but the collection was a bit disappointing with a reasonable photography exhibition, and a reasonable mix of modern and contemporary, national and international art but not much to excite.

A great discovery. Not many people would talk about this as a must do in Istanbul. After going to Hagia-Sophia and Blue Mosque, this was the place that lifted our spirits. Its a museum of modern art, with some fascinating work displayed. They have a restaurant, which is a must visit, which sports the most breathtaking view of the Bosphorous and the city.

Quirky but nice art museum. The best thing about Istanbul Modern is the stunning view of the Tokapki Palace from the sea. There are good exhibitions of modern art, mainly Turkish and a nice way to spend an afternoon.
nice place with great view. very easy museum good for kids as well.retuarant has a great view so a must for a coffee break takes just an hour and very central location

An afternoon away from the crowds. This is a very nice museum to visit after having seen all the historic sites of Istanbul, you might eventually understand a little more about what led to Turkey's modern and contemporary art. The museum itself is not very big so it will give you time to spend in its restaurant overlooking the Bosphorus strait. Good food too.

Istanbul's answer to London's Tate Modern. Modern art is alive and flourishing in Istanbul. This is a fascinating and stimulating collection. There are some amazing bits of kinetic art as well as the usual paintings and sculpture. We had a very happy morning there, followed by a really delicious lunch in the restaurant which has a terrace on the Bosphorous (just by where the cruise liners dock when they are in Istanbul). Strongly recommended!

A fabulous afternoon. The building is beautiful, the art work fascinating and the restaurant a must-dine. We loved our afternoon here...especially the air conditioning on a hot, muggy Istanbul day. A must see if you are an art fan!
Not a lot to see.... I like to visit Modern Museums in most countries... this one was just a bit underwhelming. Not a lot to see.

A nice but normal Art Museum. I would consider it a medium to large sized art museum. There are numerous painting from different sizes. Some rooms are dark and display video recording of art related topics. There is a restaurant/ cafe inside. It is directly located on the shores of the Bosphorus strait. The entrance fee is relatively cheap.

Interesting change. If you tire of the marvels that this city has to offer in terms of the old world you can't do worse than spending a couple of hours browsing the collections at the Istanbul Modern.Not as intense as the Tate Modernbut still visually stimulating.
Great place to see. I liked a lot.just a little note if u want to see this place choose Thursday because only Thursday it is free:)

It was a great experience. We visited this museum tom see the Turkish history, it had a lot of pieces, i think 125000 pieces, all of them are great stuff, it was a great importunity to study the Turkish history. we love it

great little museum. We really enjoyed "50 years of Urban Walls", and the "New Work New Horizons" exhibit, especially the multimedia content. The cartoonified land mines was particularly interesting, where it took a bit of time to figure out what they were (before reading the curator comments). Combine a visit here with a visit to the Dolmabahce Palace and a walk towards Ortakoy. The space is a nice museum space - large, flexible, also with some content from past Istanbul Biennielles.Restaurant was surprisingly good for a museum restaurant though the service is a bit slow. Sit out on the patio - it has a great view of the Bosphorous.
Art. A well curated art museum featuring a snapshot into a burgeoning art community in Turkey. The collection is great and the cafe has a great view and terrace.

If you love art, then make the trip.. We caught the tram to the last stop. Got off and walked a few hundred metres. The gallery arranged works in historical perspectives. Showing artist reactions to times and events. You get a good overall feeling of recent Turkish art. The 'modern' refers to recent times not necessarily the flavor of all work.Nice balcony for lunch if an ocean cruiser isn't blocking the view.

very impressive. there was a photography exhibit that was fantastic on display when we were there and that alone would be worth the visit if you're into photography. the modern art can leave you dizzy it is so intense. several of the installations are hard to pull yourself away from. all in all this is a must see. and the surrounding area is full of galleries so you could easily spend a day just soaking it all in. if you're a fan of modern art this museum will absolutely tickle you. and the restaurant/bar is a great place to take a break if needed.

.. collection of modern art impressive, good exhibition layout and design, and the modernity and stillness of the space a nice contrast from the eclectic nature and chaos of the rest of istanbul. Catch the tram in from taksim/galata bridge as although its only a short walk, the road is busy and not a good part of istanbul.The restaurant inside is a qui!e pricey but well worth it,
Good Exhibition. If you're not a modern art person it might not be your thingBut if you are , it's a great place to visit.

Modern art museum with perfect sea view restaurant/cafe. If you stay in Residenz La Vue, the modern art museum Istanbul Modern is just a few hundred meters away and it is must see place. The restaurant/cafe with a breathtaking view of Bosphorus is a bonus.

Loved the Modern Museum!. Make sure to check this place out when in Istanbul, I would go on their website to see the new exhibit but there is a cafe which you can have lunch outside right on the Bosphorus!

The culture in Istambul is continuing. It's a must for young people but it can be appreciate also from everybody! If you have time beforing the visit it is very nice to relax in the inside restaurant for drinking or eventually eating.

beautiful collection and nice views. We were positively surprised by the beautiful collection of modern art that was on display here. It took us some time to find the museum (S-line stop "Tophane"), but it was definitely worthwile. One of the highlights of Istanbul.The restaurant has a nice menu and the view from the terrace is excellent.

Fantastic museum. I was extremely impressed by this museum as were my two teenagers - and we live in New York where there is no shortage of museums or galleries. Wonderful collections and a fabulous view. Have a drink on the terrace and admire the Istanbul skyline.

A must in Istanbul. Located by the sea, so much to see and enjoy. Both temporary and permanent exibitions are great. They also organise ateliers for the children. You should visit it when you go to Istanbul.

Nice collection, excellent lunch. Nice to see what Turkish modern artist do. When we were there there was a great exhibition of anti-war 'murals' and an interesting photo collection. The regular art collection is worthwhile. Stunning location for lunch wit excellent food

Out Of The Way, But Worth It. Nicely and neatly presented collection of modern art coming out of Turkey. A decent change in the middle of all the ancient sites around the city.
The cafe there serves some of the best food in Istanbul for a decent price, eat there, thank me later.

Very friendly and relaxed atmosphere. A higly sophisticated choice of what to exhibit and how. Modern clever building allows visitors to relax and concentrate what has been displayed. Video rooms takes care of very interesting subjects and gets rid of daily stress of huge and busy Istanbul.
I recommend to pass by and spend couple of hours, don't miss its cafe with wonderful view.

A Modern Break amongst all this history. Check out some cutting edge modern art ranging from the turn of the century to now at the Istanbul Modern. The permanent collection is stunning and the temporary ones are always fun and thought-provoking. I'd categorize this place as a DON'T MISS.

Happily surprised!. Just came back from the Modern where i received a great introduction to contemporary Turkish art. The museum has a great photography collection and exhibit. The place is very nice and you can also enjoy great views of Eminonu. Add it to your list if you have enough time!
Great exhibitions. I visited Istanbul Modern for Burhan Doğançay exhibition. It was amazing! I will definitely go back before the exhibition ends.

It's incredible. But if you're not a modern art afficiando, it might not be your thing.
I heard a terrible rumour that the PM is going to close it - I hope not, it's one of the most significant Modern Art Museums in Europe.

All package, not much substance. Istanbul Modern is set in a warehouse next to the Bosphorus. You get a very nice view from the restaurant's terrace (but beware, prices are high!).
As for the art, they mostly have 20th century Turkish artists on show. I wasn't very impressed with their work.

If you are into Modern then visit here. After seeing so many historical places the Istanbul Modern is a great contrast and filled with lots of interesting art. If you work up an appetite looking at all the art, have lunch at the restaurant and get a table on the terrace to take in the view of the Bosphorus

Sooooo disappointing. A wonderful building and space but the paintings were very,very disappointing and the whole collection was very poor.A fab cafe view of the Bosphorus but ruined by massive cruise ships that seem to be permanently moored there

Don't miss!. This place is not one of the historic sites of Istanbul, and is a bit out of the way, but for anyone interested in contemporary art, and the history of modern turkish art, it is a must-see. Fabulous (if pricy) restaurant too.

So good I bought the museum catalogue. A great compact museum which you can whistle through in an hour if you are on a short visit but it is worth spending much longer to take it all in. It really focuses on Turkish artists so gives you an alternative perspective of Turkish recent history.

It is a nice effort, but.... I am in for all kind of modern museums, but I was not impressed by the final result of the museum's architecture and inside structure. From time to time, there are very interesting exhibitions, and the restaurant is a "don't miss" place, with nice view to the Bosporus sea, but it was not the place I was expecting.

Small with an entire floor of junk art. Only two stories, this museum is easily viewed in an hour. The lower floor has traveling collections. We unfortunately saw a collection of art made of old doors, old signs, o.d subway walls. I know, I know, it is "modern" art but it looked like trash to us.

Amazing situation overlooking the sea. Great fresh salads with herbs, nuts etc perfect as v hot. Very good service, did have a liner partly overlooking our view of bps Horus but that was interesting as well. Can sit out on decking by sea. Whole museum and restaurant spotlessly clean and fresh looking

Well worth an afternoon. The relatively new Istanbul Modern does a good job introducing viewers to 20th (and 21st) century art in Istanbul. Nicely scaled, not overwhelming but not so small as to be unimportant.

one of my top adress in istanbul. Istanbul Modern in one of the first adresses that have changed the understanding of classical museum in the city with the social programs and education projects which it has hosted.In the museum there are permanant and temporary exhibiitions are held. You will find paintings and photography. It has a really nice cafe with amazing view of Bosphorus where you can rest. And also a library whre you can find materials about art. ındependent films which are not easy to find is displayed in its cinema

Recommended. A lovely venue filled with an insteresting mix of modern art and phtography. After walking outside in the baking heat all morning this venue offered a refreshing break and something different for the eyes to feast on. The entrance is a little bit concealed and we missed it on the first pass thinking it was just a private car park.

A Lovely Unexpected Gem. Some good quality art, well mounted, in a spare contemporary setting. While it can not be compared with its counterparts in New York and other major world cities, it offers a refreshing break from the antiquities, and some earnest and creative works by Turkish artists.

Not much to see.. Obviously they have tried to exhibit much as they can but it really is not quality laden at all. The 'theme' is not there. The only plus is they are located by the magical Bosphorus waterway!

MUST. I think Istanbul Modern is a must sightseeing!. Last Year, i have been to Steve Mccurry's exhibition. it was mind blowing! Not only the Photography but also you can enjoy the real ART.
You will also love the restraunt..it has one of the best breath taking city view..
Strongly recommended!

an art lover's drug. the istanbul modern is an amazing place for people who are interested in art ! they house really nice projects, from paintings to 3d objects to audiovisuals, i loved the one about the assassination of rafic hariri in beirut ! the music was really touching

Different from US Art. While one of the exhibits going on when I was there was a Turkish artist who liked NYC subway art, most of the art in the museum feels totally different to me. All kinds of textures and treatments you don't see in Paris or the US. While you're there, have lunch on their terrace with fabulous views and home made pasta. For me, it was a welcome relief from the heat and humidity. Just a 5-10 minute walk from the Metro/Tophane stop, so it's easy to get to, even in the heat. If you're into art, it's a great option in a place where everything else is 1500 years old.

If you came for the art you might be disappointed. Although lots of people have given good reviews of Istanbul Modern, I see it more as a nice break, get out of the sun, and see something different from the Byzantine and Ottoman monuments. However, upon seeing the collection, the first impression is that the contemporary art scene inTurkey still has a long way to go--most of the pieces in the collection are derivative, second-rate copies of western artistic movements. The best aspect of the museum is the library's collection of photographs, especially the documentary work from the 1930s and '40s. Spend an hour or two there and you will make the visit worth while.
Pleased we went. Very pleased we came here - worth the walk from Sutanahmet. Lovely and cool as it was baking outside! Really interesting pieces on view in a stunning setting. Cafe was ace too.

If U R into modern art, U gotta check it out. I had read good reviews about İstanbul Modern, but I didn,t know what to expect.I can summerize it into: A place where U can enjoy modern art, totally out of the box! :)Here U can find:Abstract Art ( Photography & Paitings)CollageInstallation art ( This was beyond perfect!!)SurrealismVideo ( totally unique films!)It is a shame that photography is not allowed, but I wrote down all my favorite artists names so I can search for them later.The souvenir shop and cafe are a bit expensiveIf U R ınto modern art, you really would not want to miss this heaven :)
the modern side of the ancient city. in a reclaimed warehouse on the bosphoros the best of turkish modern art, movies, photography. Drink an expensive coffee on the terrace for the view...
great restaurant. It's really good museum. When we were there, there was a photography exhibition. We love it. Also you have to take a sit in the restaurant inside the museum. It has wonderful view.

Surprisingly good, don't miss!. The Istanbul modern is a relatively small museum for the most part devoted to 20th and 21st century Turkish art. Notwithstanding the small size, the fascinating collection and temporary exhibits make for a remarkable experience. I never knew there was so much dynamism in modern Turkish art! Plan to stay for a few hours. As an added bonus, the terrace café has spectacular views overlooking the Bosphorus in the direction of the old town.
Satisfying experience. Very nice and , well curated exhibits. some that represents Turkey nicely. Also looking over Boshphorus with nice view

Save time for lunch or a drink here!. A fascinating museum - great use of converted industrial space, and art that informs of both the past and the current politcal and social Turkey! There is a waterside restaurant that serves very good food - make a reservation so you can get a seat outside if the weather's good.

Worth it!. Modern art in such a historic city?? Take a break from the mosques and visit the museum. It's not very big but the collection is worth seeing and the Bosphorus views are one of the best in town. The restaurant was a bit pricy for our budget although it looked delicious.Also, take a look at the museum store, you will find nice souvenirs not seen in other shops.
Art by the Sea. The Istanbul Modern Museum not only has great art exhibitions, but it overlooks the Bosporus, so its setting makes it just a pleasant place to hang out.

a pleasant surprise!. spent a full day at the istanbul modern. was pleasantly surprised at the curatorial work in presenting the contemporary work of turkey's artists. a large collection. well-lt rehabbed building. i was fully engaged in the work.

a gem; world class art museum. very interesting, well curated exhibits. both general modern art, and some art that helps one understand Turkey. Lovely cafe for lunch. Interesting "edgy" exhibits as well as more standard. Can do in about 3 hrs with lunch in a pinch. walkable from Galata Tower.
Go if you have a free day. Very good for a modern art museum. Across the street from a tram station.
Very interesting art center showing turkish visual art. A very well presented good collection of Turkish Visual arts in the 20 century. Nice cafe with beautiful views on the Bogaz

Little Gem in Istanbul's Business Area. Large modern art museum dedicated to Turkish artists. Great array of Turkish art including the largest collection of Turkish photographers displayed in the world. Exhibit of hanging books-wonderful too.

Great. Istanbul is a hive of modern art activity. The Van Gogh show curated by the local uni that was on when we were there was fantastic. Definitely worth a focus on this slice of the city if it is something that you enjoy.

Twenthieth Century. This acknowledges amongst other things the two world wars. Australians blame the English for the mess at Gallipoli not the Turks. The Turks have treated Australians with the utmost respect since that disaster. This museum is not Turkish orientated-it is balanced and thoughtful
great museum. We enjoyed exploring this museum on our only rainy day in Istanbul. The museum has a great variety of interesting exhibits.

Great museum. I know it's not the easiest to get to but it totally worth the trip. Pros:English captions on every piece so you don't have to buy a guide. And if you prefer self interpretation, don't read the plaque. Huge! It was two large floors that took over three hours to go through and we rushed through the second floor. True turkish artist. I've gone to many museums where the art was foreign. This museum has at least 50% of it of Turkish artists. Very cool to see a different perspective in art. Restaurant upstairs is amazing. You can sit there and have an expensive cup of tea and not lose much lira but can relax with an amazing view of the bosphorus. Not crowded! It was a peaceful environment to view and enjoy art. Cons:Out of the way. Though, I guess if you're on a cruise, it is pretty close to a major port. A bit hard to find. The entry is next to a large parking lot so it feels like you're entering a controlled company lot or something like that.
Lot of history. Couldn't get involved much in seeing around since shortage of time, but it has several ancient antiques that some one might wonder that they are still exist.
Modern face of Istanbul. This modern art museum has different exhibitions time to time and worth to follow. The view and food of the restaurant in the museum is wonderful.

An oasis of peace and quiet. That may not be what art lovers are lookin for, but this gallery is such a contrast to the hot crowded noisy intensity of Istanbul in summer, the tranquility of the place is what I loved. Asfor the collection, i was particularly impressed by a couple of videos: one was don quixote looking for the Tate Modern, another was Memory of a square, very interesting. You've got to get past the security guard on the gate to the car park, he sent me away when I first arrived. But just walk past him across the car park to the entrance. The cafe is expensive but a great location.
One of the best modern arts museums.... ..if not just for its restaurant and location in the old dock area and on the banks of the Bospherous
The city's major contemporary arts space. Great selection of art displayed - modern and contemporary

An art surprise in Istanbul. Istanbul is not a place which comes to mind when thinking about modern and contemporary art. However, the Istanbul Modern is worth a stop if you like to check out the art scene as you travel. Unlike the Archeological Museum in Sultanahmet, this museum does an very good job of displaying its collection. Istanbul Modern is a bit hard to find. Get off the tram at Tophane and walk past the mosque and take a right toward a booth at the entrance to a parking lot. Once there you'll see the entrance.

Ideas and location. A lot of nice things to see and clever ideas - a lot of them coming from local artists. Interesting touring exhibitions.Plus a nice and very modern restaurant (with terrace) by the water, opposing some of the old palaces and mosques.

Contemporary along with modern.... The location of this museum is amazing and the art displayed will give one an idea of modern and contemporary art scene in Turkey... The have the most amazing terrace with a great view of two continents , Europe and Asia...
Interesting. Nice, modern building, wonderful views from the cafe, interesting collection of modern Turkish art.

Great counterbalance to the antiquity.. The museum has a good collection in a spectacular setting, well displayed museum. Beautiful facility, very modern and a good window into contemporary Turkey.
View the galleries then sit in the cafe and watch the ships on the Bosporus pass by.
Cool and stimulating. The range of art works is of a very high standard and excellently presented. Has also a good restaurant with great views along the waterfront.
Life changing !. This is one of the absolute best modern museums I have ever seen. It was inspiring to me!

Great Turkish contemporary art. For those who want to explore contemporary art in Turkey, this is the place to go. Also, the cafe by the Bosphorus must be one of the best locations to zip a coffee by the water watching the ships sail by.

A must do. The Wallpaper guide recommended this museum, and I find their recommendations to be pretty spot-on.
The exhibits were great and ground floor is doable without getting overly-saturated.
The lower floor got overwhelming although it had a great photo exhibit and the iconic hanging books piece which is pretty amazing.
Artist Gutierrez. It was a good show, it was titled the gun and it was interesting
Small but important. The permanent exhibit presents a good overview of Turkish art, and the temporary photography exhibit was wonderful. The restaurant in the museum is frightfully expensive.

Great neighborhood, great cafe and an easy stop. Just off the Tophane stop on the main tram line, the IM is a nice stop to give a flavor of where Turkish modern art is and where it is heading. The Karakoy neighborhood next door also offers lots of good lunch stops as well if you are making a day of it along the Bosporus

Interesting but not MOMA. This is a nice sized museum focusing on Turkish modern art (from late nineteenth century onward). It is a pleasant space and worth an hour or so, but not a must see. The restaurant, however, is terrific and a great place for lunch.

It's Just Really Cool and What a View!. I liked the menu selections and the service was fantastic. I ordered a cocktail and was really surprised by the unique taste. It was the perfect late lunch/happy hour stop. It's a great place to take a break, enjoy the fresh air and simply stare at the marvels around you!
A nice break. It's great to see modern art from artists I wouldn't otherwise be exposed to.
Grab a bite to eat on the rooftop terrace!. The food is amazing and the views are even better.

definitely worth visiting for art lovers!. Already the building of the museum is worth having a look around - the view on the Bosphorus is stunning (although the restaurant on the terrace is a bit expensive). I liked the permanent display that shows a chronologic development in modern Turkish art, starting in 19th century till today. I also enjoyed very much the exhibition of photography, especially the one with old pictures of Istanbul. And I'll never forget the installation on the ceiling made of books - when you walk with your head up, you feel like floating on a sea of books. Great experience!
A nice lunch or dinner place. It is a nice lunch and dinner place but not a not miss attraction

Just your typical Contemporary Art Museum - but with a nice view towards the Bosphorus. Contemporary (Modern) Art Museums are pretty much the same everywhere, so if you've been to one, you've seen all of them. In this case, the building itself isn't very impressive, but it has an excellent view towards the Bosphorus. As always, there's also a gift shop selling photo books and instant cameras and a pretty comfortable-looking cafe. Not bad, but nothing special either – I'd save my time for other attractions.

Don't leave istanbul without paying the visit. Definitely worth to pay a visit during your stay in Istanbul. There are permanent and temporary exhibitions and performances. It used to be free on thursdays but I think they changed that. Have a look also at the view on the Bosphorous from the restaurant.Once you are finished with the museum you can have a walk around the mosque behind it or walk until Kabatas. For info about transportation:http://istanbul-costantinopoli.blogspot.com/

My favorite place and I live here..... With all the beauty of Istanbul this is a spot that should not ever be missed. Located on the waterfront warehouse district the Istanbul Modern combines beauty, with culture, with a sense of the modern Istanbul. A gorgeous restaurant/bar overlooks the Karakoy docks for cruiselines all the way up to Topkapi Palace, and beyond on a good day to the Islands. A really modern-art-museum-in-training that is so charming, quiet and sophisticated you'll have to try to remember where you are again. This little museum will really give you a sense of 'the other side' of Istanbul. And when I say in-training it is because they are really starting to come into their own in attracting some very interesting European exhibits. There is real potential here, but for now the price is extremely reasonable, the bar and restaurant cannot be missed and the museum an oasis of modernism in a city steeped in ancient history. Try the gift shop too for some great bookmarks of famous Turkish modern artists, among other great and reasonably priced things. I love it here...

A great Museum in a great City. This is where the ancient and modern meet. It is a cultural fault line expressed in art - the Museum which is child friendly captures the evolution of modern art from the 1900's to date and illuminates the emerging trends in modern art with an emphasis on Turkish artists. Well worth a visit.

Outstanding experience. Stunning views of Istanbul from the restaurant and museum.
This is a world class Museum,with a great collection of Turkish Modern art.

A Glance of Modern Art!. After you see all the historic places in Istanbul, it will be nice to have a glance of Modern Art. This museum is situated on the Bosphorus with amazing views and the art gallery is really unique featuring the works of various artists from the current and last centuries
Great gallery to visit. Fantastic selection of Turkish art and a great restaurant with views over the Bosphorus, book a table if you want one outside with the best views.
Be by the Bosphorus. Great chance to see Turkish art and Bosphorus together... Try museum cafe and enjoy the view.... Maiden Tower and bridges are magnificent...
Don't miss. One of the best contemporary art museums. Amazing collection.
Nice. Nice museum, situated right next to the water. Don't miss out on the water pipe (nargile) café right next to it.
The modern side to Turkey. This was a perfectly sized space, with some interesting pieces informatively displayed. Great spot for lunch, with some fantastic views.
what's happening now. Artistic insight into the ongoing evolution of modern Turkish culture and society

A must see...really!. When you spend so much time pondering antiquity, it is very refreshing to see what modern artists are doing and saying with their work. This beautiful museum is housed in a converted warehouse on the Bosphorus near the Galata Bridge. Stepping into it, I was reminded of the Dia in New York but with views of the Mamara and not the Hudson. Visiting the modern helped give me perspective of the growth of Turkish art from the times of the Sultans to recent graduates of the design school next door. They were showing the progression of Turkish modern art over the last 100 years, which was very facinating. Don't miss out on the photogrophy downstairs as well!

May 2012 - World-Class Videos Here. We have seen art videos all over the world. The Istanbul Modern's current exhibition should not be missed. Go downstairs and plan to spend at least an hour or more viewing this varied group of videos. The first floor shows Istanbul artists as they became aware of 20th Century art. It is the video section downstairs which pulses with energy and will engage the viewer.

One of the best. One of the best modern art museums in Turkey. They have a large continous exhibition of Turkish modern artists. And a lot of different exhibitions during the year. I reccomend the cafe in the museum. Nice menu with beautiful bosphorus view:)

Turkish modern art plus the best museum shop in Istanbul.... They have a good selection of Turkish modern art and some interesting exhibitions. You should check out the exhibitions before you go but visit anyway for the permanent collection. Their cafe has a very nice view of the Bosphorus but is a bit pricey. The shop on the other hand is small but pretty good with lots of local designers' products. A must visit!
very good. The art was interesting and varied, but what we really appreciated is that there are detailed explanations of the artist and the work in multiple languages.

A nice museum in a great location. We were at this museum in late April. They have a terrific show on right now of photos in Turkey from the last 200 years. It is very well curated. They have another show from Holland that we found a bit odd. The permanent collection display was quite good. The museum is very near a long line of hooka places which looked like fun. Lots of people sitting outside in the sun and visiting over coffee an tea. The building is quite lovely and they have a restaurant that looks out over the water. The only challenge with it is that the cruise ships dock in front of it and completely block the view (bad planning!) so check to make sure there is no cruise ship docked the day you go.
Modern art heaven. Excellent and quite electic collection and good temporary exhibitions. Great to see modern art through a different lens ie: not just the usual suspects. Lovely location and views

Modern in the midst of ancients. The modern museum is a great icon in the middle of an ancient city, of Istanbul. The restaurant in the museum is one of the best I have been to, in a museum. Great views of the Bosphorus sea, and the exhibits at the museum are worthwhile visit.
not recomnded. i didn't like it simply i don't recommended . its not contain any new ideas or strange things
Istanbul is an arts city, still nowadays. It is time well spent to be in the Istanbul Modern for 1-2 hours and get an impression on the quality of contemporary Turkish art.

Surprisingly fresh. We were surprised to find such an evolved art scene in Istanbul and really enjoyed the visit, both on the permanent exhibitions and on a temporary photography exhibit on the basement.The restaurant is a must.

Good Art. If you like modern art this is the place to go. On Thursday they stay open until 8p.m. This was one of the highlights of my trip. Next door, at least when I was there, there was an interesting Van Gogh experience that is very different. It's worth a look. But 5 stars for Istanbul Modern!
excelent. Everything was good from people, to builind and food. Excelent location.
nice place. where the museum located is a wonderful place, its called Karaköy Rıhtım

Interesting art; fabulous location. The location on the Bosphorous is not to be missed; great cafe overlooking the water and very, very interesting exhibits. I especially liked the self-portrait section and the photography.
Go for the view!. Make ure there is no cruise ship parked in front and even if you do not gave time for the museum go for the view of the Bosphorus from he cafe.

Insightful exhibition into modern Turkish art. I had no real preconception of what I might see here but the work was extremely varied and gave a great insight into the work of contemporary Turkish artists and the influences they were responding to. Brilliant photography section also which is sometimes overlooked as a contemprary art. Not here!

Modern art is rich in Istanbul!. Really enjoyed to see modern art from Turcs. Great pieces. The museum situation is totally outstanding! Go have a the on the terrace after having look all the collection!

Interesting, intelligent exhibits... lovely view. We arrived at the museum the last day of our trip with suitcases in hand, as we were going to the airport right afterwards. We just hadn't gotten a chance to get here. they kept our suitcases for us, and off we went. Wow. I felt I learned so much about this country, and its politics and the region's history...and its young people, as well...just by viewing the exhibits, which included some interesting short films. Don't miss out on the cafe, even if it is just for a glass of wine and small plates. It has a beautiful view, and the wait staff is wonderful.

A proud member.... I am a proud member of the museum as a visitor.We visit this museum at least once a year.Has a very tasteful collection and a lovely program for the exhibitions.The kids arts classes are so tempting but sadly my daughter is only 2.5Yo.must say; do Check if there isn't a LOVE BOAT by your table!You'll see when you visist the cafe...

Modern and contemporary art. Very interesting and worth a visit. I'm not much of a fan of contemporary art but it was very interesting. The installation of floating books in the lower floor was fantastic!
Well worth it. You could skip this if you mainly want to see mosques and Greek antiquities, but if you want a glimpse into modern Turkish cultural life this is a must.

no words but terrific experience!. bad you can't take videos or pics but it's such interesting as Withney Museum in NYC is! Love the collection and the brand new turkish artist (to me), nice place to watch and learn about history of modern art since Turkey became Republic. please, go!
art. If you are interested in modern art, this place contains art pieces from all over the world.

Not impressed. This museum advertises itself as comparable to the Tate Modern or MoMA -- which it is not. Some interesting Turkish interpretations of the Western canons of Modernism, but most not arresting or innovative. Rather 'desperate' in parts. Best exhibit was the 'Working Rooms' with displays by well-known (Western) artists

Great - but not all child appropriate!!. I really enjoyed this but was with my 2 small kids and was glad they are still small or they'd have been asking some interesting questions - some of the art is quite graphic and there was a film which used the f word several times - so just view these things with caution and make your own choices about what's appropriate for your children!! The cafe is great though - and has a fantastic cocktail list!!! You can access it without paying the museum entrance fee if you just want to stop for lunch - beautiful view over the Bosphorous

modern art!!. we loved our trip the the Istanbul Modern - there was a great exhibit of photography and some really wonderful interactive multi-media pieces as well. one of our favorite things to do is see modern art in an old city! a must do...
Absolutely to visit. Modern art museum of Istanbul, very nice view of bosphorous aswell

Wonderful art with great, detailed explanations. The art was interesting and varied, but what we really appreciated is that there are detailed explanations of the artist and the work in multiple languages.Sometimes its frustrating to see only the work explained but know nothing of the artist, but Istanbul Modern took care of both ends.

Meh. We weren't in love with the Istanbul modern. Better to stick with the tried and true...Topkapi Palace, Istanbul Archelogical Museum. Here there are cool examples of Turikish artists, but nothing was particularly mind-blowing.

Great Collection of Modern Art. Yes there is a mix of great art (globe) and some really bad annoying pieces but overall really quite good. The resturant/cafe is quite good and gives a great view.TIP: Plan lunch / dinner into your trip.

Quality of Exhibitions Varies. I have been going to Istanbul Modern for 5 years (I live in Istanbul) and while I have seen some good exhibitions there, I have seen some exhibitions which were downright terrible. The price of admission has gone up significantly in the past several years. On the positive side, they have a great library, and you can enter for free if you just want to use that. If you only have time for one art museum in Istanbul, I would recommend the Pera Museum, which has a stunning collection of Orientalist paintings of Istanbul in their permanent collection and in the past several years hosted works by Josef Koudelka, Frida Kahlo, Diego Rivera, Joan Miro and many others.

New building nice setting - Good Restaurant.. Very interesting - The art work was varied and think there was something for everyone. Security staff seemed to be everywhere watching people. Was well worth the visit - The Cafe/Restaurant has a great terrace with lovely views.

Loved it - went twice. We're fans of modern art and wanted to see the modern side of Istanbul as we'd heard great things about Istanbul Modern. Feels a bit like Tate Modern but smaller yet with a really eclectic mix of contemporary art and some temporary exhibitions. Spread over two floors there's a mix of 20th century modernist art from some of Turkey's leading artists as well as some very recent installations. Great gift shop and an ace cafe with decently priced dishes. Breathtaking views over the Bosphorous.
One of the best.... It is one of the best museums that you can visit with everything it has...I love this Museum...

Incredible location. Really hard to describe. It's in the middle of the harbour, by the sea... You'll be confused. Which one is more attractive? The view from the windows or the modern paintings on the wall...
great. It was a little look into modern Turkey.The presentationof the Van Gough exhib.with music was special.

wonderful art and a women's film festival. a compact location with wonderful views of the bospherous, good comentaries and a wide concept of art both paintings and installations. I also arrived at the last item of the women's film festival a film about land rights subtitled. It was interesting and informative with interesting discussion in the audience afterwards, an added bonus
Great!. Very nice museum. Again, it tells the history of Istanbul and other countries in East Europe.

Very expensive modern arts exhibition. I am not so into modern art I must express this at first. Probably because of this I hated this museum. There are lots of pointless art(?) collections and lots of exhibitions to see. The most obnoxious item was the video of a man dancing as Turkish Belly Dancer. I could not understand why it was named art and put there for display. It was pretty absurd. There are lots of stuff like that.If you want to visit the museum you should probably ready for overwhelming walking and hours of free time. And the entrance fee and car park fee are too expensive.
A Nice Contrast to the Bedlam of the Bazaars!. Lovely museum, with interesting works, by artists mainly unknown to us. Very fine gift shop. Check out the earrings!
Interesting Place. Anyone who comes to Istanbul should also have a chance to see this outstanding cultural museum

Great place. It is Istanbul moderne...not (when I was there) art from other countries. Fine. Gives a very interesting insight in how Turkish modern art developped, how the government encouraged Turkish painters to get impressions from "Old Europe". The results are quite fascinating...especially if you now something of European art history. Otherwise just enjoy...there are laughs, puzzlements and just esthetic joy. Oh, and they have a very nice cafe with great view!
Nice contemporary art collections. This is a must place to visit if you like contemporary art. Inside you will find nice cafe/restaurant to enjoy Bosphorus view.

unique world of art. there is always a programme in the movie theatre there, they show the movies that are very hard to find on the net or anywhere. there is a lot of work of art and they change in every 3-6 months. there is a lot of unique stuff in every aspect. i totally recommend.
Loved it!. A great way to spend a cold or rainy afternoon, well any afternoon! Lots of interesting installations and beautiful art works. And who doesn't love museum gift shops!!

If you like your art contemporary. A really well curated series of collections, a mix of their permanent collection and other exhibitions. There is a marked preference for very modern video art, some of it quite shocking in its form and content. When we visited there was also a retrospective of their extensive collection of photographs but by far the most interesting was an exhibition on the history of Turkish Art from the Victorian to the present day, a fascinating insight into how European art influenced the work of Turkish artists throughout the last 100+ years. Oh, and it is worth the trip just for the cafe, great food and amazing views of the Bosphorus.
GREAT. Excellent museum with great views. Really enjoyed visit. Nice gift shop..

Excellent side of Turkish modern culture. A refreshing modern insight to the cultural progress Turkey experienced from the early 20th century to present. Multi-media; photography, painting, graphics, etc. (Great restaurant facing the Bosperous!)
Nice place.. lstanbul Modern Museum was very easy to find. A few tram stop from sultahmad and right next tophane tram stop. Try to go on thursday it is free.
Amazing. lt was really great to know istanbul has such a nice Modern Art Museum. lt was absolutely one of highlight of istanbul trip.
Istanbul Modern. World class art, interesting 'book' ceiling, fantastic first class restaurant.

i really enjoyed. it is worth going to see the new turkish artists , nteresting exhibitions, caffee to rest with a fantastic view .
nough to get a good sense of the different movements of turkish art during the 18th, 19th and 20th century,
Surprising. Excellent collection. Wish I had more time to stay there.

Contemporary Turkish art. A view into the modern Turkish art scene
A museum shop with some fun stuff
A restaurant with good coffee and an almond cake worthy of plate-licking (I didn't....)

GO!. I don't even have words. Also, we stopped to have lunch at the museum restaurant which overlooks the busiest, sunniest part of the Bosphorus. A bottle of wine, the top menu choices- for two people, ONLY 20 TURKISH LIRA EACH. The service was out of control on top of their game.

Culture vultures - go and enjoy here. The perfect way to spend your Sunday.
We went to a gorgeous gallery showing several artists then enjoyed lunch in the restaurant.
Superb day altogether.
Will definately go there again.

Very small, a bit overrated. That was the only museum we visited in Istanbul and we picked it beacuse of the good reviews from some guide books. The entrance was not cheap TL$14 for a one floor museum as the basement was closed when we were there. So it was very small. Some pieces were interesting but still not quite worth the whole hassle getting there and paying such entrance fee.
a surprise. it is not the usual visitor´s site, but it is worth going to see the new turkish artists; there is a very good restaurant with an excellent view of the Bosphorus.
art museum for every age. if you have enough time you can visit this museum. I stayed 1 week so i had enough time to visit there and. it really worth my time.
A real modern museum. Interesting exhibitions, caffee to rest with a fantastic view.

allow yourself plenty of time for this museum. We visited January 2012. We had heard that the museum was free on Thursdays, so were disappointed to learn this is only for Turkish residents. The art collection is huge, two floors worth, and we didn't manage to get to it all, so allow yourself plenty of time for your visit. We stopped at the cafe/bar for a drink afterwards, spectacular views, as the museum is situated right on the bank of the Bosphorus. However, beware the prices, 18TL for a glass of wine, though a nice treat.

Great contemporary collection. Nice museum of international standards, with a nice, but not overwhelming colelction of contemporary, turkish pieces. Enough to get a good sense of the different movements of turkish art during the 18th, 19th and 20th century, and not enough to wear you out before the end of the tour. Decent café too with good food and drinks at a fair price. Go there if you like art, but not just to eat :)

A quirky arthouse in Istanbul. Loved it! This is a museum (but perhaps more an art gallery) of mainly modern art. Open your mind and indulge yourself. Mostly you will cry 'Emperor's new clothes' but then occasionally there is a real gem. We wandered through for over 2 1/2 hours, and only left to catch the tram back to the hotel. And the views of the Bospherus are to die for. Try and beat 14, as the number of ferries scurrying around.
Amazing Views from Restaurant. I only ate at the restaurant - it had unbeatable views of the Bosphorous and the Asian side.

Great exhibits. If you take the light rail away from sirkici across toward the galata tower, you'll be heading toward istanbul modern. It has many great exhibits, some a little strange, but it was worth it. And some of the exhibits weren't just turkish artists. If you are a woman, I would be very careful as to how you present yourself or ask questions, one gentleman during my visit got a little fresh...It was not welcomed....

great art museum. i liked the collection, the building and certainly the location. there was one problem though: the museum website advertised that entree was free on the day we visited. when we arrived, we were told the entry was indeed free but only for turkish people...anyhow, the museum is worth seeing. also, do not miss the bosphorus view from the in-house restaurant!
A must living in Istanbul. Always changing shows, a must visit for all of us living in Istanbul.

Educative, artistic and varied.. I simply loved this museum. First I went through the Turkish art where once can see almost any trend in paintings for the last two hundred years at least. I wanted to see what Turks had been doing and was not disappointed. Furthermore it had variety of art such as photography, video, installations and more which made the visit richer. I specially enjoyed the exhibition by Turkish women which is excellent, provocative, creative and beautiful.Don't miss the cafe, the food there is excellent and the service is good. In addition you have a wonderful view over the Bosporus. It would be worth it just going to the cafe;-)

Art that is alive. This museum is a must. In it modern art still lives and isn't just some asthetic stuff, rather it is art that still has a message, that is part of a discussion and truely shows Turkey as the country between east and west.

World class museum, outstanding restaurant, excellent film programming. I have been to almost every major museum of contemporary art in the Western world and Istanbul Modern may easily be counted among the top five. Exhibition curatorship for the Dream and Reality exhibition of art by Turkish women was extremely well thought out. The Museum itself is huge. Two other shows were being presented concomitantly with this one - a photography show (Uncanny Encounters, the weakest of the three) and a selection of contemporary work by Turkish artists called New Works, New Horizons). We attended several films in the AFRIKA! retrospective (a rather idisoyncratic selection of African cinema covering over 25 years of film by well-known directors including the extraordinary Mahamat Saleh-Haroun and Ousmane Sembene. Subtitles in English AND Turkish. Films were shown in a very comfortable theater and admission to them was FREE with admission to the museum. As for the museum restaurant, this was really special. Food was delicious, drinks top notch, service impeccable and the view of the Bosphorous breathtaking. This view, by the way, is incorporated in the architecture of part of the exhibition space, running along one whole side of the building. Not to be missed under any circumstances. Thought-provoking contemporary art in a magical setting.

Wonderful collection. First, I must note that I'm not the biggest fan of modern art, but the Istanbul museum had a very large collection, certainly something for everyone. I was able to find some very nice political pieces as well as interesting film. To see the whole museum at a reasonable pace would take at least three hours (more for those who love the modern art).
Not memorable!!. Nothing special was about this museum. The museum sections were disjointed, and to me nothing had an artistic significance. However, we had good lunch at the cafe there.

Excellent spot for all the fans of modern art. As I'm a big fan of modern art I enjoyed this place very much. Apparently I never knew Turkish artists are so good in modern art. Here you can find lots of their works, most of them are really interesting. Both storeys are definitely worth visiting, totally takes about 3 hours. Actually audio guide is not much helpful and could be missed easily as there is quite enough info about every work written on the walls. Don't miss their cafe! It has spectacular view to Bosphorus which I also enjoyed a lot in the evening time with all those highlights of the city.
fun afternoon. great selections, great layout. good rate for students!
at the old ship docks, absolutely surprising!. Location is wonderful, artwork interesting, regularly change expositions. A drink at the very popular bar of the museum is a must...
Istanbul (very) Modern. This has some really interesting cutting edge art and is located at a great spot right along the Bosphorus. Well worth a couple of hours.
intresting. Istanbul Modern museum is worth a visit They have a great permanent collection and Lots to see, diverse, interesting location on the water.
Turkish modern art. New museum, most works of turkish artists, nice seaview cafe

Her daim gidilir,gitmeye de değer. Eski LOFT un bir uzantısı olan bu başarılı restaurantta her daim gerek iş gerek ailecek yemek yer ve her zaman son derece memnun kalkarız. Fevkalade organizasyonun etkisi hemen görülür,bar olarak da bulunmaz,yemek ve ziyaretcilerin kalitesi yüksektir.

Magnificent Attraction if a little too expensive. Awesome exhibits. I saw an exhibit by Turkish women and was blown away. Even the Guerilla Girls liked it! Great gallery even if a little expensive. Thursdays are only free for Turkish Citizens or students contrary to what some guidebooks say.
Not blown away. visited it the last day of our stay. No waiting cue, but actually not very impressing. Has a very nice café with nice terrace overviewing the Bosphorus

Pleasantly surprised.. Prior to visiting this museum of Turkish artists I was hubristic (arrogant?) about the quality of work I would find. Within minutes that myth was quickly dispelled. Their 2 floors of galleries were packed with interesting and provocative work of many Turkish artists. I am so glad I made the trip and proven that my preconceived idea of what I thought Turkish art would be was vastly inaccurate.

Worth The Trip!. Housed in a renovated warehouse right on the Bosporus, Istanbul Modern is a delightful counterpoint to the many ruins, mosques, palaces and bazaars that are the mainstay of the Istanbul tourist experience. Don't be dissuaded by the "Modern" title. While it has many similarities to the better-known MOMA in NYC, it's not all funky soup cans and avante-garde art installations. Indeed, you have to put 'modern' in the context of Istanbul/Constantinople. In a city with buildings and cultures that are thousands of years old, "modern" becomes a relative term. The Istanbul Modern collection highlights notable Turkish artists from the late 1800's through to present day.One remarkable painting on display is a self-portrait by Sultan Abdul Mejid II, the last Caliph of the Ottoman Dynasty. Born in 1868, he and his family were expelled from Turkey in 1924 when the Caliphate was abolished. He was an accomplished painter and served as Chairman of the Ottoman's Artist's Society, not roles I would have expected of a Sultan!For me, the highlight was the special exhibit of 35 photographs by Andreas Gursky a renown German photographer (it's a temporary exhibit through Aug 2007). Even if you don't like "art", it's worth the trip just to see these incredible photos. They are simply breath-taking. They are HUGE, the biggest being 2 by 5 meters (6 by 16 feet)!! The depth of field, perspective, and resolution of these large-format images are amazing. If you've ever taken a tourist snapshot with your trusty 5 megapixel camera (and who hasn't), you'll be in awe of these photographs and leave the exhibit shaking your head wondering how Gursky created them.Your last stop at Istanbul Modern should be the café, on the second floor overlooking the Bosporus. You can have lunch or a mid-afternoon snack (I highly recommend the almond soufflé) while watching the boats big and small pass by. It's a delightful place to relax and recharge your batteries before heading back out to the crowded bazaars and mosques. Note that Istanbul Modern is on the waterfront just a short walk from the Karaköy cruise ship terminal. If you are departing Istanbul on a cruise, I suggest you check in early, dump your bags, and then spend an hour or two wandering through this marvelous museum. You can probably watch your cruise ship loading supplies as you sip a Turkish coffee in the café.
